name: 1. Khajuraho
info: Khajuraho is a very special city and tourist destination in Madhya Pradesh located in the middle of India, which is famous for its ancient and medieval temples in the nation and worldwide. Khajuraho, the curious land of Kamasutra in Madhya Pradesh, has drawn visitors worldwide. This little village in the Chhatarpur district is well known for its good suggestive set of memorials, which has made its standing on the list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

name: 2. Pachmarhi
info: Pachmarhi is a beautiful hill station located in India's Hoshangabad district of Madhya Pradesh. Pachmarhi is the center of attraction for the country's tourists and abroad for its beauty; it has everything that a tourists expects, such as peace, blooming mountains, evergreen greenery, flowing waterfalls, silver cascading waterfalls, colorful shades, and more. The enchanting views of the beauty of the four moons of Pachmarhi. Pachmarhi is very cheap compared to other hill stations; this tourist place situated in the hills of Satpura is also known as Kashmir in the central region.

name: 3. Indore
info: Indore is the most crowded city  of Madhya Pradesh, discovered on the southern boundary of the plateau Malba, 190 km from the state capital Bhopal.

name: 4. Gwalior
info: King Surajsen builds the famous city of Gwalior. The beauty of this historical city, the attractive monuments, palaces, and temples are less appreciated. The splendid architectural work has been done in the mosques, rock temples, and sculptural structures. Gwalior is not limited to palaces only; its hills and beautiful greenery attract many tourists. Let us tell you that Tansen was born in Gwalior, and his tomb remains the same.

name: 5. Kanha National Park, Mandla
info: Kanha National Park Located in Madhya Pradesh, it is the largest national park in central India, famous for the national animal tiger and the habitat of many such wild animals. Kanha National Park is a city located in the Mandla district of Madhya Pradesh, which mesmerizes the tourists visiting here with its natural beauty. Kanha National Park was established in 1955, and since then, many endangered species have been protected here. Kanha National Park was carried beneath Project Tiger Reserve in 1974. The national park area is spread over 940 square kilometers, divided into two sanctuaries, Hallan and Banjar.

name: 6. Orchha
info: Orchha Fort is situated on the island of Betwa river at a distance of 16 km from Jhansi in Madhya Pradesh. Orchha Fort was constructed in the 16th century by Raja Rudra Pratap Singh. The main attraction of this fort is the Raja Mahal, which displays intricate architecture. Along with the Raja Mahal, many attractions like Sheesh Mahal, Phool Bagh, Rai Praveen Mahal, and Jahangir Mahal are located in this fort to attract tourists, which adds to the charm of this fort.

name: 7. Omkareshwar
info: Located at the confluence of the Narmada and Kaveri rivers, Omkareshwar has been given the state of the Hindu holy symbol 'Om' due to the merging of the two holy valleys and the river's waters Narmada. Its name is derived from 'Omkar,' which is the name of Lord Shiva. Located on Mandhata Island, Omkareshwar is believed to be one of the 12 Jyotirlingas that entice thousands of enthusiasts every year. It has two old temples; one is Omkareshwar, and the other is Amarkeshwar. This holy city also has architectural marvels and natural beauty, apart from pilgrimage sites.

name: 8. Sanchi
info: Sanchi, one of the Buddhist pilgrimage sites in Madhya Pradesh, is famous for the oldest stone structures in India. The Buddhist Monuments at Sanchi symbolize the vast heritage of culturally rich India. Emperor Ashoka of the Maurya dynasty established the great stupa in the 3rd century BC. The stupas at Sanchi were built as homes to Lord Buddha and many important Buddhist relics. This place is surrounded by lush green gardens, which provide a different kind of joy and peace to the tourists visiting here.

name: 9. Ujjain
info: Ujjain is the most religious place in Madhya Pradesh, which is called the city of Mahakal; in this post, information about the tourist places of Ujjain like Chintaman Ganesh Temple, Mahakaleshwar Temple, Siddhavat, Sandipani Ashram, and Vedashala (observatory Ujjain), etc. is given.

name: 10. Hanuwantiya
info: One needs to visit an amazing place to calm the mind, take a break from the daily lifestyle and spend some wonderful moments in peace. Although there are many tourist places to visit in Madhya Pradesh, after seeing Hanuwantia Island, located in the Khandwa district of Madhya Pradesh, you will also be convinced of the beauty of this place. One of the most popular tourist places in Madhya Pradesh, Hanuwantia Island, is famous for many exciting things like sports activities, floating, and trekking. Let us brief you that Hanumantiya Island is even known as Hanumantiya Island. So, if you are also going out to visit Madhya Pradesh, then definitely reach here.

name: 11. Jabalpur
info: Jabalpur is a very beautiful city in the central state of India. The population of the city is estimated at 12.7 lakh, according to the 2011 census. In terms of area, Jabalpur city is spread over 367 square kilometers, and its height is 412 meters. Madan Mahal Fort, built on a rocky hill on the western outskirts of Jabalpur city, was built in 1116 AD. The age-old Pisanhari ki Madiya in the city gives a mesmerizing view of the Jain temple. Apart from this, Hanumantal Bada Jain Temple and Rani Durgavati Museum are some of the major tourist places in the city.

name: 12. Bhimbetka Rock Shelter
info: If you are interested in history, this place is best for you to visit. Bhimbetka Rock Shelter is an archaeological site located in the Raisen district, considered the starting place of human development. More than 500 rock shelters and caves where paintings made thousands of years ago are still present today. The most aging painting here is assumed to be 12 thousand years old. Coming here, you will feel like you are in a distant world.

name: 13. Maheshwar Temple
info: Maheshwar is located on the drifts of river Narmada and is known as the temple village of Madhya Pradesh. This city has its own mythological and historical significance. The city has also been mentioned in the epics of Ramayana and Mahabharata. Maheshwar was earlier the capital of the Holkar province of Queen Ahilyabai Holkar. She built many buildings in this city and beautified the city with Maratha architecture while carrying out public works. Maheshwar is quite famous for the production of Maheshwari Sarees.

name: 14. Bhojpur Temple
info: There is an incomplete Hindu temple in Bhojpur village near Bhopal, the capital of Madhya Pradesh, dedicated to Lord Shiva. The most special thing about this temple is a 7.5 feet high linga in its sanctum. It is said that this Shivling was constructed during the reign of King Bhoj in the 11th century, and due to some reasons, the construction of this temple was left incomplete. If you visit this temple, you can also see the construction material there, which is of old times.

name: 15. Bandhavgarh National Park
info: Bandhavgarh National Park is one of the most important tourist places in Madhya Pradesh, which was the hunting ground for the Maharajas of Rewa in the olden times. This national park is known all over the world as Tiger Reserve. Bandhavgarh National Park is world-famous for Royal Bengal Tigers' density in India. This park is a very beautiful forest because of its abundance of wildlife and flora. More than 22 species of mammals and 250 species of avifauna are found in this park.

name: 16. Amarkantak
info: Amarkantak is one of the major pilgrimage centers of Madhya Pradesh, which is also known as "Tirtharaj" (King of pilgrimages). Let us inform you that Amarkantak is a hill station situated at an altitude of 1065 meters, which is also famous for some of its exquisite temples. The most sacred and biggest river of Madhya Pradesh, Narmada, originates from Amarkantak, making this place very special. The dense forests of Amarkantak are rich in medicinal properties, making them ecologically important.

name: 17. Shivpuri
info: Shivpuri is a famous city in Madhya Pradesh with special historical significance. It is around an area where Hindu and Mughal rulers have ruled for a long time. Shivpuri is a very quiet town situated at 478 meters above sea level, good enough for peaceful tourism. Named after Lord Shiva, the city served as a refuge for the Kachhwaha Rajputs until 1804 and was later ruled by the Sindhis. Let us inform you that the Han freedom fighter Tatya Tope was given the Shivpuri sentence of death.

name: 1. Shrikrishna Scientific Centre
info: This wonderful and well-equipped scientific center, which was constructed in 1978, is considered one of the essential locations to visit in Patna. This location is well-known for presenting many remarkable exhibits that depict scientific ideas. Whether you're a youngster or an adult, this site offers a diverse range of activities to participate in, including an innovative instructional tour. It is one of the most well-known attractions in Patna.

name: 2. Bihar Museum
info: The Bihar Museum is one of the most interesting places to visit in Patna if you are interested in history. This location provides insight into the history of the state and the ancient culture of the region. Artifacts from the Patna Museum, which has been in operation for more than a century, are housed within the museum. Along with that, there are artifacts and information about human history that have been installed. The museum, spread across 5.6 hectares of land, has a dispersed scheme of buildings, including galleries, educational, and administrative areas. The museum is divided into three sections: the main building, the educational area, and the administrative area.

name: 3. Patna Planetarium
info: The Indira Gandhi Planetarium, commonly known as the Patna Planetarium, is situated in Patna's Indira Gandhi Science Complex, home to the Indira Gandhi Science Complex. The planetarium was built by the Bihar Council on Science and Technology at a total cost of around ?110 million (equivalent to US$13 million in 2020) and took approximately two years to complete. Bihar Chief Minister Shri Satyendra Narayan Sinha conceptualized the project in 1989, with building beginning the following year. It was completed and officially opened to the public on April 1, 1993.

name: 4. Patna Museum
info: The Patna Museum, also known as the Jadu Ghar in the local dialect, is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Bihar. This location is well-known for housing around 50,000 unique art artifacts that are well-worth seeing. In addition to that, Indian artifacts dating back to the Middle Ages, the British Colonial Era, and even the ancient past are on display. This site, which was built in 1917, contains many artifacts that illustrate Indian history and the state's splendor. Many galleries are housed inside the tower, with Mughal and Rajput architectural elements. It is one of the most well-known attractions in Patna.

name: 5. Sanjay Gandhi Jaivik Udyan Botanical Garden
info: The Sanjay Gandhi Jaivik Udyan Botanical Garden, also known as the Sanjay Gandhi Jaivik Udyan, was established in 1969. One of the greatest places to visit in Patna for couples, this park is home to a diverse range of flora and wildlife, making it one of the best places to visit. Patna Zoo is another name for the botanical park, and visitors come here with their children to enjoy thrilling activities such as an elephant ride and a toy train.

name: 6. Lauria Nandangarh
info: With its magnificently constructed Ashokan Pillar as its most notable attraction, this town is 28 kilometers northwest of Bettiah in a weird landscape. A pillar (Laur) built by Mauryan Emperor Ashoka inspired the name "Laurita," which means "pillar of Ashoka." There are also around 20 archaeological banks on this site, arranged in three rows. Although Emperor Ashoka initially constructed roughly 40 pillars at this location, only one of them remains now, and it is well worth your time to see it. One of the most prominent tourist destinations in Patna is the Patna Palace Museum.

name: 7. Golghar
info: Golghar, a storehouse built by Captain John Garstin in 1786 in the center of Patna, was originally intended to serve as a warehouse. Atop this massive tower, which is nestled among the natural splendor of Patna, you may enjoy panoramic views of the whole city and its surrounding areas. It is undoubtedly a fascinating spot to visit in Patna if you are looking for calm.

name: 8. Gandhi Sangrahalaya
info: In Patna, there is another great museum to visit, the Gandhi Sangrahalaya. This museum has a lot of interest among visitors since it presents a visual biography of Mahatma Gandhi's life via photographs depicting his life journey. There are also many books and an audio library that include special information about that period.

name: 9. Jalan Museum
info: If you are a history buff on vacation in Patna, you should visit the Japan Museum while you are there. The museum, known as Quila House, is located in Agamkuan and is open to the public. It is private property, and you must obtain permission from the owner before visiting the location. The museum contains a collection of rare artifacts from the British Raj in India. Additionally, there are other rare collections, such as the wooden bed of Napoleon III, which makes this one of the most popular places to visit near Patna. Quila House is a private residence located on the banks of the Ganga river in the old town of Patna, in the Indian state of Bihar, in the northern Indian region of northern India. Originally constructed in 1919, the house is notable for its collection of art objects and antiques, which was the personal achievement of Diwan Bahadur Radha Krishna Jalan (R.K. Jalan) (1882-1954), who was a businessman as well as a collector of fine arts.

name: 10. Eco Park
info: Rajdhani Vatika, also known as Ecological Park or Eco Park, is a park in Patna, Bihar, situated on Strand Road. It was established in 1992. In October 2011, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar dedicated this park to the state's people after an effort by the Department of Environment and Forest (Department of Environment and Forest). In addition to the 1,445 meters of the footpath, a children's corner, and a 1,191-meter jogging track, the facility offers a playground. It has been created to reduce the workload at Patna Zoo. 9.18 hectares of land is dedicated to the park, including two lakes.

name: 11. Buddha Smriti Park
info: This urban park, also known as the Buddha Memorial Park, was constructed to commemorate the life of Lord Buddha. The Dalai Lama dedicated the park on the 2554th anniversary of the Buddha's birth, which was the Buddha's birthday. The park, which covered an area of 22 acres and was constructed at the cost of INR 125 crores, is the largest in India.

name: 12. Hungama World
info: In Patna, Hungama World is one of the largest water-cum-amusement parks in northern India and is synonymous with excitement and enjoyment. In the years after its construction and opening in 2014, it has established itself as the most popular themed water park in the city of Patna. It offers a variety of breathtaking thrills and attractions that will get your heart racing and provide you with the excitement you've been yearning for. The park's land and water rides have been thoughtfully designed to provide a fun-filled experience for visitors.

name: 13. Rajendra Smriti Sangrahalaya
info: If you are interested in history and politics, the Rajendra Smriti Sangrahalaya is one of the tourist attractions in Patna that you should visit. It is dedicated to the works and life of Dr. Rajendra Prasad, India's first President of the Republic of India. You may study Dr. Rajendra Prasad's life and experience it here. Since the founding of Bihar Vidyapeeth on February 6, 1921, he has resided and worked in this location.

name: 14. Khuda Baksh Oriental Library
info: The ancient Khuda Baksh Oriental Library, also known as the Khuda Baksh Library, is located approximately 5 kilometers away from the Patna Railway Station and quite near to the banks of the Ganga. This wonderful library has a vast collection of over 2,000 antique Mughal and Rajput paintings and 18,000 Persian and Arabic manuscripts, among other things. In addition, the collection comprises around 550 video and 850 audio cassettes created by a variety of well-known individuals.

name: 15. Chhoti Dargah
info: At a distance of 30 kilometers from the heart of Patna city, the three-story Chhoti Dargah serves as the last resting place of Muslim saint Makhdum Shah Daulat, who was buried here in 1616, according to tradition. Ibrahim Khan built this tomb in 1619, and it is a work of art in terms of architectural design. The top of the Dargah is topped by a massive dome, the roof of which is adorned with many carved verses from the Islamic holy book of the Quran. In addition, there is a massive tank in front of the Chhoti Dargah. Currently, there are many graves with cloth coverings in the vicinity of the Dargah.

name: Places to Visit in Odisha
info: Bhubaneswar, also known as the "City of Temples," is one of the amazing tourist destinations in Odisha. From the ancient period, this area was known as the capital of the state of Odisha, and King Shishupala ruled it. It is a classic example of urbanization, history, and legacy. Many magnificent things, such as amazing temples, artwork, sculptures, wildlife sanctuaries, caves, and so on, are found here. The main attractions here are the Dhauli Hills, Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves, Ratnagiri Buddhist Excavation, Bindu Sarovar, and Nandan Kanan Zoological Park.

name: 1. Bhubaneswar
info: Bhubaneswar, also known as the "City of Temples," is one of the amazing tourist destinations in Odisha. From the ancient period, this area was known as the capital of the state of Odisha, and King Shishupala ruled it. It is a classic example of urbanization, history, and legacy. Many magnificent things, such as amazing temples, artwork, sculptures, wildlife sanctuaries, caves, and so on, are found here. The main attractions here are the Dhauli Hills, Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves, Ratnagiri Buddhist Excavation, Bindu Sarovar, and Nandan Kanan Zoological Park.

name: 2. Konark Temple
info: Konark Temple is the most renowned site in Odisha and the center of ancient art and sculpture. Tourists visit this place every year to witness the incredible art of carvings of the Konark Sun Temple, one of India's Seven Wonders. The city also has an interesting archaeological museum, a seaside view, and magnificent temples. This temple has been designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Lord Suryanarayan is the presiding deity of the Konark Sun Temple. The main attractions here include the Archaeological Museum, the Temple of the Sun God, and Ramchandi, Chandrabhaga Beach.

name: 3. Puri
info: Puri is a lovely city in the eastern Indian state of Odisha, around 60 kilometers from the capital. Puri has numerous exquisite temples. The primary attractions here are Puri Beach, Puri Beach Festival, Puri Jagannath Temple, Chilka Lake and Bird Sanctuary, and Gundicha Ghar Temple. If you plan a marine vacation, you must visit Puri at least once. This location is also significant in the Char Dham Yatra.

name: 4. Paradeep
info: The historic Paradeep is located in the Jagatsinghpur district and is one of the country's most important and oldest ports. Paradeep's coastal scenery includes beautiful beaches, lush woods, waterfalls, and forts. People travel from all over the world to visit Paradeep, one of the country's top beach spots. Huge ships and other marine activities can be seen at this spectacular confluence of the Paradeep, Mahanadi, at the Bay of Bengal. The main attractions here include the Paradeep harbor, Gahirmatha Sanctuary and beach, lighthouse, and Jhankadi.

name: 5. Jeypore
info: For nature enthusiasts, Jeypore is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Odisha. The Suryavanshi Dynasty founded Jeypore city in the 16th century. Jeypore, nestled in the Eastern Ghats Mountains, is one of Orissa's most popular tourist destinations, with deep woods, mist-covered valleys, and spectacular waterfalls attracting visitors from all over the country. The prominent attractions here are Gupteshwar Caves, Sunabeda, Devmali, Duduma Falls, Jagannath Sagar, Hathipathar, and Kolab Falls.

name: 6. Jagannath Temple
info: The ruler of the Ganga Dynasty constructed it in the 12th century. Rath-yatra, one of the world's most famous festivals, is hosted here. Lord Jagannath, Lord Balabhadra, and Goddess Subhadra are the primary deities worshipped here. People travel to Odisha to seek Lord Jagannath's blessings. Puri, Dwarka, Rameshwaram, and Badrinath are all included in the Char Dham Yatra. The temple is located on a high platform in the city's heart. This temple, surrounded by seven-meter-high walls, is a sight to behold. According to the temple's laws, foreigners and non-Hindus are not permitted within the shrine.

name: 7. Pipli
info: This little village in Odisha is known worldwide for its arts and crafts. This city's applique handicrafts are particularly well-known. Embroidery designs are a specialty of the local artisans. If you visit Odisha, stop by this city for handicrafts and sculptures. It is one of the most visited attractions in Odisha.

name: 8. Cuttack
info: It is the capital of the East, the second-largest city in Odisha, and one of the most beautiful destinations to visit in Orissa, located near the Mahanadi river delta. Cuttack's history can be traced over 1000 years to the Keshari Dynasty in 989 BC, and it is currently considered one of India's best-planned 'Millennium' towns. Popular tourist destinations are Mahanadi Barrage, Barabati Fort, Bhitarkanika Wildlife Sanctuary, Ansupa Lake, Singnath, and Bhattarika temples.

name: 9. Raurkela
info: Rourkela is the capital of Odisha's Sundargarh district. Rourkela is known throughout India as Ispat Sahar because SAIL has a steel plant in this city. Rourkela is known as Mini India because it is a city where people from all over India live. After Bhubaneshwar, Rourkela in Odisha's second smart city. Despite being an industrial area, Rourkela city has a pleasant temperature and is a lovely spot to visit.

name: 10. Goddess Patharasini of Arjunda
info: Arjunda is a region on the banks of the Mahanadi River at the northern end of the Barapahar forest area.

name: 11. Baseikela Gada
info: Bheden Block is home to Baseikela Gada. This location had been fortified by Bheden Jamindar Raja Manohar Singh, a close friend of Veer Surendra Sai. It receives thousands of visitors each year due to its location on the bank of the Jeera River. Visitors are mesmerized by the natural splendor of this location. The fort's remains serve as a reminder of the Jamindars' previous greatness and suffering, enhancing the significance of this location. This location is known for its Ghitghiti Pathar, which made a noise as British forces approached the native combatants.

name: 12. Bindhyabasini of Sankrida
info: Sankrida is a community in the Bheden block district. The Bindhyabasini Mountain is found near the settlement of Sankrida. The Goddess Bindhyabasini is worshipped here, and the peak of the mountain is named after her. The Goddess has a huge religious impact on the inhabitants of this region. The mountain is 200 acres in size, with 50 acres of pastureland at its base. Sankrida's residents have contributed 27 acres of land for the Goddess's ceremonies and rituals to be managed.

name: 13. Daringbadi
info: Locals consider this quiet mountainous station the "Kashmir of Odisha". Daringbadi is a fantastic getaway from the hustle and bustle, with pine forests, milky white waterfalls, colorful meadows, and rolling hills. The Putudi and Badangia Waterfalls, the Coffee Garden, and the Belghar Sanctuary are popular tourist destinations.

name: 14. Chandipur
info: Chandipur Beach is a lovely beach in Odisha. It is bordered on the east by the Bay of Bengal, on the west by Mayurbhanj, and on the north by the Bengal district of Medinipur. Balasore is 100 kilometers away from Digha, Bengal's most popular beach. This beach, which runs from Digha to Balasore along the Bay of Bengal, is relatively shallow.

name: 15. Sambalpur
info: The Sambalpuri saree, preferred by the women of Sambalpur, is quite famous. There are main rivers, beautiful hills, beautiful green woods, and a diverse range of wildlife. In the second century, the city was known as the Land of Diamonds since it was once the world's diamond capital.

name: 16. Talsari Beach
info: Talasari Beach, located 10 kilometers from Digha in the Balasore district of Odisha, is one of the unexplored beaches of the Eastern Ghats and is renowned as the final beach on India's North East Coast. Talsari beach is free of pollution due to its low traffic, and it gives tourists natural beauty and a calm setting that satisfies our senses.

name: 17. Tikarpada Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Tikarpada Wildlife Sanctuary, around 142 kilometers from Bhubaneswar, is known for its crocodile sanctuaries. The Satkosia Rock Formation surrounds the sanctuary. Alligators reproduce at the Gharwale Sanctuary, which is located nearby.

name: 18. Udayagiri and Khandgiri Caves
info: The historical significance of the Udayagiri and Khandagiri Caves is well-known across India. This cave had roughly 33 caverns, which had fallen into disrepair. In these caves, there are several Jain temples.

name: 19. Keonjhar Lake
info: Keonjhar is one of the state's major lakes, located 220 kilometers from Bhubaneswar. This lake is unique in that it is located in Jharkhand to the north, Jaipur to the south, Dhenkanal to the west, and Mayurbhanj to the east. The famous Keonjhar highland, from which the Baitarani river originates, is located here.

name: 20. Bhitarkanika National Park
info: One of the most beautiful locations to visit in Odisha is Bhitarkanika National Park. In history, it was famous for hunting among the rulers of the Kanika area. The peaceful atmosphere of this location and the beautiful green and colorful birds and sea turtles make it a popular place to visit. At this location, tourists may also view crocodiles. If you enjoy animals and the natural world, here is your place.

name: 21. Nandan Kanha Zoological Park
info: Nandan Kanha Zoo is a well-known bird sanctuary in Odisha and throughout India, and it draws a large number of visitors. Nandan Kanha Zoo is around 20 kilometers from Bhubaneswar. Nandan Kanha's zoo is a lovely place for children and the elderly to visit. In Nandan Kanha Zoological Park, you may see lions, white lions, pythons, and crocodiles.

name: Famous Food of Odisha
info: The more beautiful Odisha is tastier is the meal that is mouth-watering. Dahi-Bada Aloo-Dum, which is featured among the most delicious food in Odisha, is well-known and can be found on the state's street food vendors. Favorite meals include Sel Pudi and Ras Gulla. If you're visiting Odisha, don't miss out on the Dalma. It would be best if you also tried the pani puri and delicious cuisine while you are here. Non-vegetarian travelers will find a wide variety of foods here.

name: Best Time to Visit Odisha
info: If you're planning a trip to Odisha, keep in mind that the best time to visit is from October to February. Because the weather is perfect for tourism during this period, you may easily travel to Orissa and its major tourist destinations.

name: 1. Boudhanath Stupa
info: Boudhanath Stupa, located approximately 11 kilometers from Kathmandu's city center, dominates the Kathmandu skyline with its massive spherical shape. It is one of Kathmandu's most beautiful tourist attractions. Thousands of pilgrims from various religions visit this site every day. They perform a ritualistic circumnavigation of the 'kora,' which is a massive dome. Good karma is received by those who circumambulate the stupa with no ill thoughts in their hearts. Furthermore, the gates of hell have been closed for them completely.

name: 2. Pashupatinath Temple
info: On the eastern outskirts of Kathmandu, the Pashupatinath Temple, one of the top locations to visit in Kathmandu, sprawls over both sides of the gorgeous and holy Bagmati River. The Jyotirlinga located in the Pashupatinath temple is supposed to be the head of a body made up of India's twelve Jyotirlingas; this temple is spread throughout a vast region. Thousands of believers visit this Lord Shiva's magnificent temple to offer prayers and seek his blessings. In 1979, this magnificent temple was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: 3. Thamel
info: Thamel, originally known as Tabitha Bahal, is a maze of alleyways packed with booths one after the other. It is still one of the most well-known and busiest business areas in Kathmandu, Nepal. The small streets of Thamel have never failed to serve Kathmandu's tourist attractions in the previous four decades, whether it's cultural monuments or bars, peaceful eateries, or breathtaking temples. Thamel's street stores have you covered whether you're looking for delectable food or clothing, new music recordings, or hiking equipment. The whole region is a wi-fi zone.

name: 4. Durbar Square
info: The magnificent Kathmandu Durbar Square is one of Nepal's three durbar squares and is a must-see for visitors. Durbar Square has seen and welcomed one monarch after another as they sat and reigned over Nepal for a long time. The spot where new kings were crowned on the constant sounds of drums and trumpets.

name: 5. Garden of Dreams
info: The Garden of Dreams in Kathmandu is a neo-classical garden constructed by Kishore Narshingh in 1920. It is also known as the 'Swapna Bageecha' and the 'Garden of Six Seasons.' The park has a superb amphitheater, Urns, Gorgeous buildings, surrounding paved pathways, Pergolas, and Ponds, and it is a popular tourist and local attraction in Kathmandu. It is one of Kathmandu's most beautiful natural attractions. This garden fell into disarray when its sponsor, Kaiser Sumsher Rana, died in the 1960s, but the Austrian government restored it and reopened it to tourists lately.

name: 6. Langtang National Park
info: The Langtang National Park, Nepal's fourth national park, was founded in 1976 and has hiking paths and a diverse range of flora and animal species. It is one of Kathmandu's most popular tourist attractions. The Langtang National Park lies 32 kilometers north of Kathmandu, and it is connected to Tibet's Qomolangma National Nature Preserve.

name: 7. Dhoka of Hanuman
info: Hanuman Dhoka is a collection of old structures, some of which date back to the mid-16th Century, originally the royal palace of Malla kings and the Shah dynasty. It is widely known as Hanuman Dhoka Darbar and is situated in Kathmandu's Durbar Square. It gets its name from an ancient sculpture of Lord Hanuman (Monkey God) outside the main entrance of a medieval palace. 'Dhoka' means "door" in the original tongue. During the 2015 earthquake, Hanuman Dhoka, which encompassed 5 acres, was severely destroyed.

name: 8. Narayanhiti Palace
info: The Narayanhiti Palace Museum is a former royal palace home to Nepal's rulers and is situated east of the famed Kaiser Mahal in Thamel. Moreover, because of the 'Royal Family Assassination' in 2001, it is also historically important. This exquisite museum showcases the royal family's antique furniture, paintings, decorations, and the luxurious lifestyle that formerly adorned the gorgeous palace's durbar (halls).

name: 9. The Last Resort
info: The Last Resort is three hours from Kathmandu, perched on the rim of a deep canyon. The Last Resort is nestled amid terraced hills with the Bhotekoshi River nearby. This wonderful resort is great for relaxing, participating in adventurous activities, relaxing by the plunge pool, or reading a book while taking in the gorgeous scenery. It is one of the nicest sites for couples to visit in Kathmandu.

name: 10. Kopan Monastery
info: Kopan Monastery is a famous Tibetan Buddhist monastery on the outskirts of Kathmandu, situated on the majestic Kopan Hills (20 minutes from the city center). It was formed by the founders of the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana in the late 1960s or early 1970s. It is a well-known tourist spot in Kathmandu that draws visitors interested in learning more about Tibetan Mahayana Buddhism. It is one of Nepal's most popular tourist destinations, and visitors may spend a few hours visiting the beautiful and tranquil monastery or taking part in a retreat. The public is welcome to visit the monastic campus. However, to avoid upsetting the pupils and monks, a general code of behavior must be observed.

name: Conclusion
info: In conclusion, these were the top best places to visit in Kathmandu. If you're looking for an adrenaline rush, these are the perfect destinations. However, if you're looking for a quieter and more relaxing vacation, consider some other options. With so many amazing places to visit in Nepal, it's hard to decide where to start! So whatever your needs are, be sure to investigate all of the possibilities before making your decision.

name: 1. Agartala
info: Agartala, the state capital and one of the most popular tourist destinations in Tripura, is also one of the state's main metropolises. The landscape is well-known, rich in green ranges, hills, and gorgeous denes. Ujjayanta Palace is the primary attraction here. Maharaja Radha Kishore Manikya built Ujjayanta Palace in 1899 as a royal residence. The armature, which has three polls, tiled bottoms, a carved rustic ceiling, and skillfully machined doors, highlights the castle. This regal residence also has a Mughal-style theatre on the exterior. In addition, if you want to explore Agartala in-depth, you should plan at least two days.

name: 2. Hills of Jampui
info: Jampui Hills, in Tripura's northern region, is one of the state's most well-known tourist destinations. These hills are situated at the height of 1000 meters above sea level. It is a place of luscious oranges endowed with lovely denes and wonderful decors. Ujjayanta Palace, Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary, and Chittagong Hills are the megacity's most important landmarks. November is a fashionable month with many places to visit in Jampui Hills. The sanctuary is home to various animals and has an exploration center. In this refuge, you may discover up to 150 different species of catcalls.

name: 3. Ambassa
info: Ambassa is a picturesque megacity in Tripura that is well-known for the historic tabernacles that have been hosted there. Ambassa is one of Tripura's most popular metropolises due to its unique environment and diverse culture. Pilak, Chabimura, Neermahal Palace, Ujjayanta Palace, Gumti Wildlife Sanctuary, and Jagannath Temple are magnets in this megacity. While you're there, other tabernacles in this megacity keep you occupied. A big juice plant can be found at Nakata, some 38 kilometers south of Ambassa, one of the main attractions for visitors. This juice business is also close to several handicraft stores.

name: 4. Amarpura
info: Amarpura is one of Tripura's most fashionable destinations and is regarded as an excellent casual hangout. People often travel here on weekends to relax and spend time on the banks of the Amar Sagar Lake, an artificial lake built in the 16th century. The megacity is built mostly on old ruins, and there is a Mangalchand tabernacle (the eight-headed goddess). In addition, throughout February, a display is staged here to commemorate the month of flowers. Dumboor Lake and Chobimura Lake are two other lakes in this area. Amarpura has a water sports establishment as well. Aside from that, there are a variety of colourful expositions and activities organised at this location to keep visitors entertained at all times.

name: 5. Melaghar
info: Agartala is 50 kilometres away from Melaghar. Neermahal, situated in the middle of Rudrasagar Lake, is well-known in the vicinity. The ambience of this place is pretty soothing. During Durga Puja, the whole city is illuminated with gorgeous lights, and you find Colourful puja pandals everywhere throughout the side of the streets. Another notable event in Melaghar is the Ratha Yatra, every year in July. You may gratify your shopping passion by visiting Anandabazar, which offers everything from tiny crowds to large stores to meet all of your needs. Veeramma Kali Mandir, Pagli Masi Temple, and Melaghar Kali Temple are other popular places in Tripura.

name: 6. Dharamnagar
info: Dharamnagar, situated in the north-western portion of Tripura, is the second-largest megacity in the state after Agartala. The region is noted for its naturally gorgeous landscapes. The megacity was constructed on top of ancient ruins and is home to many well-known physical landmarks. Haflong is a well-known tea theatre situated just outside Dharamnagar and is recognised for its beauty. Unakoti, an ancient point with massive gemstone-cut images, is also close to Dharmanagar.

name: 7. Rangamati, Udaipur
info: Udaipur, formerly known as Rangamati, is a megacity in Tripura noted for its Sundari Temple, one of the state's religious attractions. The location is 55 kilometres from Agartala and is situated at the bottom of artificial lakes. Dhani Sagar, Bijoy Sagar, Jagannath Dighi, and Amar Sagar are some of his megacity's constructed lakes. The village is situated on the banks of the Gomai River and has many temples. The most famous is the Tripura Sundari Temple, one of 51 Shakti Peethas. Kalyan Sagar is a big lake next to the temple. Bhubaneshwar Temple is another well-known temple. Moreover, due to the many lakes in this municipality, it is also known as the municipality of lakes. The Nazrul Granthagar library in Udaipur is also the best place to visit.

name: 8. Tripura museum
info: The Tripura Museum is one of the must-see sightseer destinations in Tripura for people who want to acquire a sense of the past golden days. The Tripura Government Museum, originally opened in 1970, showcases the complete culture and history of Tripura. There are awe-inspiring collections of odd historical artefacts on display, including tombstone busts, antique coins, archaeological artefacts, and more. The tremendous contrast between Tripura's past and present-day existence is easy to perceive.

name: 9. Neermahal Palace
info: One of Tripura's most prominent tourist attractions is Neermahal Palace, which is nestled in the heart of Rudrasagar Lake. This Palace enables tourists to view a spectacular structure and admire the natural beauty of the surrounding. The name translates to 'water palace,' which is pretty accurate in English. When it comes to the country's seven wonders, Neermahal Palace is one of them. Martin & BurnsCo. created this Palace, which includes a royal Antar Mahal, a guest bedroom, a playground space, a yard, and more!

name: 10. Unakoti
info: Unakoti, which means "one fewer than a crore" in English, is one of the fascinating places to visit in Tripura for those seeking something unique. This site is near Kailasahwar city and is home to hundreds of thousands of mesmerising gemstone-cut formations. Unakoti is a unique area with an antique air enclosing the environment because of the many dispersed ruins of the tabernacles.

name: 11. Ujjayanta Palace
info: Radha Kishore Manikya Bahadur constructed the Ujjayanta Palace. This Mughal and Indo-Greek-style palace are situated in the Agartala city's centre. Gardens, pools, and fountains have been added to the palace. The Musical Fountain, Flood Lightings, and gorgeous interiors may also be seen and enjoyed from both sides of the domes of this three-story edifice.

name: 12. Kunjaban Palace
info: Maharaja Birendra Kishore Manikya built the Kunjaban Palace, still standing today. It is also close to Ujjayanta Palace, which indicates Rabindranath Tagore, the Nobel prize-winning poet. He was inspired to write many unforgettable melodies by the panoramic beauty of this palace set amid the emerald hillocks. This place is also an official residence for the Governor of Tripura and has magnificent gardens, lawns, and yards worth viewing. The southern half of the garden, known as "Rabibdra Kann," is available to the public.

name: Conclusion
info: In conclusion, these were the top best places to visit in Tripura. So, if you're ever in the region, visit these places! If you are looking for a diverse and beautiful city to explore, then Tripura is your place! There is something for everyone in this city, with many attractions and sites to visit.

name: 1. Sabarmati Ashram
info: Our Father of the Nation, Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, and his wife Kasturba Gandhi lived in the Sabarmati Ashram in Ahmedabad. Sabarmati Ashram, located on the Sabarmati River, is also known as 'Gandhi Ashram' or 'Mahatma Gandhi Ashram.' It is historically significant since it is where the Salt Satyagraha march started. In the Mahatma Gandhi Ashram, there are other additional establishments. The Gandhi Memorial Organization museum is the most well-known, including some of Gandhi's letters and images on show. The museum was originally housed at Hriday Kunj, Gandhi's ashram hut, but was moved here in 1963 when the museum was established. The Gandhi Memorial Museum is now housed at the ashram. Nandini, Vinoba Kutir, and Upasana Mandir are some of the other buildings and places inside the Gandhi Ashram. These structures have the names of Gandhi's close associates.

name: 2. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Museum
info: The Sardar Vallabhai Patel National Museum, located in Shahibagh, Ahmedabad, is a memorial to India's first Deputy Prime Minister, Sardar Vallabhai Patel. This museum, surrounded by a lovely park, also includes various museums and images related to the Indian National Movement.

name: 3. Sidi Saiyyed Mosque
info: The Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, also known as the Sidi Saiyyed Ni Jali Mosque, was built in 1573 and is one of Ahmedabad's most famous and magnificent mosques. The structure is one of the final mosques built by the Gujarat Sultanate and finished in the year before the Mughals came and destroyed Gujarat. Sidi Saiyyid, a former soldier of Bilal Jhajjar Khan, a general in the army of Shams-ud-din Muzaffar Shah III, the final Sultan of the Sultanate of Gujarat, is credited with the construction of this beautiful mosque. The mosque is especially well-known for its 10 stone lattice windows, commonly known as the side and back arches of the jaalis. This location is unquestionably ideal for photographers and history fans.

name: 4. Historical Place Lothal
info: If you are a history fan who wants to gain an insight into the life of previous generations, you must go to Lothal since it is a destination that perfectly blends the past and the present. Lothal, a famous Indus Valley site and a 4500-year-old city discovered in 1954, is located 85 kilometres from Ahmedabad on the banks of the legendary ancient river Saraswati (which has now dried up). Lothal was not only one of the first successful civilizations, but it was also a hub of industrialization bordering several nations. For exciting excavations and findings, geologists, historians, and archaeologists come to Lothal.

name: 5. Kankaria Lake
info: Kankaria Lake, formerly known as Hauz-e-Qutub, is the second-largest lake in Ahmedabad. Kankaria Lake was constructed in the 15th century and renovated in 2008. Kankaria Lake is a magical site where entertainment, culture, wisdom, and skill come together perfectly. From balloon safaris and zoos to toy trains and amusement parks, Kankaria Lake has it all. It's ideal for a late-night walk. Kankaria Lake provides activities like archery, gymnastics, and water rides to adventure lovers. Kankaria Carnival, the most frightening celebration, is celebrated with zeal and devotion. It also provides you with an excellent opportunity to demonstrate your abilities in numerous contests.

name: 6. Swaminarayan Akshardham
info: Shri Swaminarayan Mandir is a well-known temple dedicated to Narayan Dev in Ahmedabad's Kalupur neighbourhood. On the orders of Swaminarayan, the founder of the Swaminarayan branch of Hinduism, this majestic temple was erected in 1822. This temple is a superb example of nineteenth-century architecture, ornate with kaleidoscopic hues and detailed decorations. The goddesses are beautifully decorated and dressed in gorgeous clothing inside the sanctum sanctorum. On the day following Diwali, one lakh people attend the temple.

name: 7. Calico Textile Museum
info: The Calico Textile Museum, one of the world's top textile museums and a recognized institution in Indian textiles, is known for its garment collection. While popular pieces contain sequins, mirrors, jewels, silk threads, and other decorations, you may also discover collections of 17th-century attire. The museum is a fascinating tourist attraction housed in Gujarat's gorgeous wooden Havelis and has lush gardens and fountains.

name: 8. Jama Masjid
info: The Jama Masjid in Ahmedabad is one of India's greatest mosques, established in 1424. Emperor Sultan Ahmed Shah, the creator of Ahmedabad, created this magnificent structure as part of the old walled city. In addition to being a well-known shrine, the Jama Masjid houses the tombs of Ahmad Shah I, his son and grandson, and the king's queens. A wonderful blend of Hindu and Muslim architectural traditions may be seen here. It took 13 years to build and was meant to be a private temple for the Sultans. It's worth noting that the mosque was constructed completely of stones.

name: 9. Hathi Singh Jain Temple
info: The Hathi Singh Jain Temple, dedicated to Lord Dharmanath, the 15th Jain Tirthankara, was established in 1848. There are 52 temples in total here. The architecture of these temples is impressive, and the entire area is known as Hathi Singh Wadi. In Hathi Singh Wadi, there is also a 78-foot-tall Mahavir Stambha. This pillar's quality and elaborate carvings are amazing. Hathi Singh Jain Temple is one of Ahmedabad's most popular tourist attractions. If you happen to be in Ahmedabad, you should visit the Hathi Singh Jain Temple.

name: 10. Sabarmati Riverfront
info: Riverfront is a lovely public park created along the Sabarmati River's banks. Sabarmati River Front Park is the name of this park. Once a year, the Sabarmati Riverfront has a flower show that is well worth viewing. In addition, a variety of events are hosted here. Inside the Sabarmati Riverfront, there are numerous attractive locations to explore that are the focus of attention for travellers visiting the Sabarmati Riverfront. The Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad is a renowned tourist site. If you ever go to Ahmedabad to visit the places. So take a trip to the Sabarmati Riverfront.

name: 11. Sarkhej Roza in Ahmedabad
info: Sarkhej Roja, an amazing complex of tombs and pavilions, is just a short distance away from the huge complex. The compound is based on an artificial lake created for Gujarat's rulers. The graves of Sheikh Ahmed Khattu, Ahmed Shah's spiritual counsellor, are among the most important tombs here. Here you'll find beautiful carvings and brass latticework. This is one of the best locations to see in Ahmedabad since it is steeped in history and beautifully embellished.

name: 12. Shah-e-Alam's Roza
info: Ahmedabad has many tombs that surprise you with their elaborate designs and beauty. The Roza of Shah-e-Alam, also known as Rasulabad Dargah or Shah Alam no Rojo, is one such mausoleum that should be on every tourist's list. This mausoleum is a popular Sufi temple that attracts people from all over the world.

name: 13. Vastrapur Lake
info: Vastrapur Lake is a historic lake in western Ahmedabad that was repaired and enhanced in 2002. It contains an open-air stage where many of the city's cultural events are held. A large statue of Narsingh Mehta (a prominent Gujarati poet-saint) was built here, and the lake was renamed Bhakta Kavi Narasimha Mehta Sarovar in his honour.

name: 14. Kite Museum
info: Bhanubhai Shah created the Kite Museum on the campus of Sanskar Kendra in Paldi, Ahmedabad. The museum, which opened in 1954 and was designed by renowned architect Le Corbusier, features an intricate exhibition of distinctively carved kites such as mirror-work kites, block print kites, Japanese kites, etc.

name: 15. Manek Chowk
info: In the Gujarati city of Ahmedabad, Manek Chowk is a lively city plaza. It is located in Old Ahmedabad and is surrounded by historic structures. This is the place to go if you have a large shopping appetite because Manek Chowk serves three purposes throughout the day. It's a vegetable market in the morning. It's a bullion market in the day and a foodie's dream in the evening. It's the second-largest and busiest market in India. If you spend a full day here, you'll see how the afternoon changes the vegetable market, and evening transforms the bullion market into a foodie's heaven.

name: 16. Law Garden Night Market
info: The Law Garden Night Market in Maharaja Society's Law Garden is well-known in Ahmedabad. Traditional clothes, wall hangings, bandhej sarees, long colourful skirts (chaniyas), antique jewellery, traditional footwear, and home decoration goods are among the greatest purchases here, kept in many unique Kutch and Saurashtra stores.

name: 17. Vaishnodevi Temple
info: The Vaishnodevi Temple is a stone-built Hindu temple on the Sarkhej Gandhinagar Highway, also known as the Vaishnodevi Circle. The temple is built into an artificial rock with a deep carve of roughly 50 feet in diameter. The temple can accommodate roughly 5000 worshipers at a time, according to a 1350-square-foot hall.

name: 18. Alpha One Mall
info: The Alpha One Mall, popularly known as Ahmedabad One Mall, is located in the centre of Ahmedabad. Alpha One Mall, which covers 706,000 square feet in Ahmedabad's bustling Vastrapur neighbourhood, is the city's largest mixed-use city centre.

name: 19. ISKCON Temple
info: The ISKCON Temple in Ahmedabad, close to the Gujarat Samachar Press, is the best place to experience spirituality and mental delight. This temple, also known as the 'Hare Krishna Temple,' is ideal for meditation because of its serene ambience.

name: 20. Gujarat Science City
info: Gujarat Science City is a unique project taken up by the Gujarat government to foster general knowledge and scientific temperament, especially among the country's young generation. The facility, which covers 107 acres, also hosts regular lecture presentations and seminars for students and scientific lovers. It is located on Science City Road in Ahmedabad.

name: 21. Nehru Bridge in Ahmedabad
info: The Nehru Bridge in Ahmedabad connects the Real Old City (Kot Vistar) with West Ahmedabad, spanning the Sabarmati River. The bridge was dedicated to India's first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, and opened to the public in 1962. The bridge is recognized as one of the most attractive sites in the city.

name: 22. Vechaar Utensils Museum
info: The VECHAAR (Vishalla Environmental Centre for Heritage of Art, Architecture, and Research) Utensils Museum, constructed in 1981 near the Vishalla Village Restaurant in Ahmedabad, was created by Mr Surender C, a well-known architect. The museum houses an extensive collection of kitchenware that dates back to hundreds of years.

name: 23. Sanskar Kendra
info: Sanskar Kendra is a city museum in Paldi, Ahmedabad, founded in 1956. The museum is a collection of displays that showcase the city of Ahmedabad's art, culture, history, and architecture. It also claims to have the world's longest incense stick. Another museum area is dedicated to the Patang Kite Museum, a one-of-a-kind kite museum.

name: 24. Dhanvantari Garden
info: Dhanvantari Garden, located in Dungarshinagar, Paldi, is another lovely garden in Ahmedabad. There is more than enough green in the garden and several benches where you may rest. Aside from the vast running and walking paths, the park is frequented by local children who come to participate in outdoor games and activities in the evenings.

name: 25. World Vintage Car Museum
info: The Auto World Historic Car Museum, located in the Dastan of Kathwad, displays about 120 historic cars, including old utility vehicles, motor vehicles, and ancient carriages. The museum also has a cafe and a museum store and abundant parking and restrooms. It is organized and maintained by India's Vintage & Classic Car Club.

name: How to reach Ahmedabad
info: Most people are unaware that Ahmedabad's heart is in its street food. You may get a great selection of street food to satisfy your sense of taste. Ahmedabad's food selections, particularly it is street food, have their distinct flavour. There are numerous vegetarian options, but the non-vegetarian options are very appealing. Khakhra, Dhokla, Kulfi, Pani Puri, Dal Vada, and Maska Bun are some of the top street food options in Ahmedabad.

name: Famous Street Food in Ahmedabad
info: Most people are unaware that Ahmedabad's heart is in its street food. You may get a great selection of street food to satisfy your sense of taste. Ahmedabad's food selections, particularly it is street food, have their distinct flavour. There are numerous vegetarian options, but the non-vegetarian options are very appealing. Khakhra, Dhokla, Kulfi, Pani Puri, Dal Vada, and Maska Bun are some of the top street food options in Ahmedabad.

name: Best Time to Visit Ahmedabad
info: Ahmedabad is not ideal for summer vacations. During these days, the temperature here remains between 43 and 47 ?. Tourists going here benefit greatly from the monsoon season. However, the Sabarmati River frequently floods owing to heavy rains. The winter season enjoys comfortable temperatures ranging from 5 to 20 ° C. Winter is the greatest time to visit Ahmedabad due to the weather conditions.

name: 1. Ram Janmabhoomi
info: The Ram Janmabhoomi is a sacred location that must not be missed. According to Hindu tradition, the Ram Janmabhoomi, which translates as "Ram's Birthplace," is believed to have been the location of Lord Ram's birth. According to the Indian epic Ramayana, Ram, Lord Vishnu's seventh avatar, has grown up beside the Sarayu River, which flows through Ayodhya, where he is said to have been born. The Ram Janmabhoomi land, which had been a source of contention for decades, was finally transferred to a trust by the Supreme Court of India to construct the Ram Temple. The planned design for the temple is abundant and spectacular in its scale and scope. The Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, held the groundbreaking ceremony to lay the foundation stone for the Ram Temple in Ayodhya on the 5th of August in the year 2020.

name: 2. Hanuman Garhi
info: Hanuman Garhi is a Hindu temple dedicated to the Hindu God Hanuman located in Sai Nagar. The temple dates back to the 10th century. In Ayodhya, it is considered one of the most significant temples since it is usual to visit Hanuman Garhi before visiting the Ram Temple. It is claimed that Lord Hanuman still resides in this temple and protects Ayodhya.

name: 3. Kanak Bhawan
info: Located in Tulsi Nagar, near the Ram Janmabhoomi, the Kanak Bhawan is erected in the northeastern part of the complex. This temple, also known as Sone-ka-Ghar, was built in 1891 and is dedicated to the Hindu god Lord Rama and his wife, Goddess Sita.

name: 4. Nageshwarnath Temple
info: The Nageshwarnath Temple, built in the name of the local god, Lord Nageshwarnath, is next to the Theri Bazaar in Ayodhya and is dedicated to him. Traditionally, it is believed to have been established byKush or Kusha, the son of Lord Rama.

name: 5. Gulab Bari
info: The Gulab Bari, also known as theGarden of Roses, is located in the Vaidehi Nagar neighborhood. It contains the tomb of Nawab Shuja-ud-Daula, the third Nawab of Faizabad (Oudh or Awadh), as well as the tombs of his parents. You can find here pure Nawab-styled architecture in the 18th-century structure of the Gulab Bari, which also features a vast array of rose species and fountains and lush greenery. Gulab Bari, which is protected as a national monument under the Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act, is currently being preserved as a part of the country's cultural heritage.

name: 6. Treta Ke Thakur Temple
info: The Treta Ke Thakur Temple, located near the Naya Ghat of Ayodhya, is home to several idols, including Lord Ram, Sita, Lakshman, Hanuman, Bharat, and Sugreev, among others. One black sandstone block is said to have been used to carve out each of these sculptures.

name: 7. Choti Chawni
info: Choti Chawni, also known as Valmiki Bhawan or Maniramdas Chawni, is a magnificent Ayodhya structure entirely white marble. This location is a breath of fresh air and pure beauty, and it is worth visiting.

name: 8. Sita Ki Rasoi
info: Situated near the Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya's Rajkot on the north-western side of the temple complex, it is believed to have been an old kitchen used by goddess Sita herself at some point in her life. This sacred site, which they built near the Ram Janmabhoomi, is now a temple that houses some exhibit vessels. This Sita Ki Rasoi is a basement kitchen, and it is one of the two kitchens in India that bear Sita's name.

name: 9. Tulsi Smarak Bhawan
info: The Tulsi Smarak Bhawan was built to commemorate Goswami Tulsidas, a saint-poet living in the 16th century. The Smarak, located on the eastern end of the National Highway near Rajgang Crossing in Ayodhya, was constructed in 1969 by Sri Vishwanath Das, the Governor of Uttar Pradesh. It is said to have been where Tulsidas produced the Ramcharita, a collection of poems.

name: 10. Bahu Begum ka Makbara
info: Bahu Begum ka Makbara, located on the Maqbara Road in Faizabad, is the "Taj Mahal of the East" because of its symmetrical design. It is the tallest monument in Faizabad and is renowned for its non-Mughal architectural brilliance. In Faizabad, the unique mausoleum dedicated to Begum Unmatuzzohra Bano, wife and Queen of Nawab Shuja-ud-Daula, stands as the tallest monument and is renowned for its non-Mughal architectural brilliance.

name: 11. Raja Mandir
info: Raja Mandir in Faizabad, which is located on the banks of the river Ghaggar (Sarayu) near Guptar Ghar, has been linked to countless mythical legends time and time again. The temple is home to magnificently sculpted idols of various Hindu Gods and Goddesses, all of whom are lavishly ornamented with silken fabrics and precious jewellery.

name: 12. Ram Katha Park
info: Ayodhya is constantly thronged with pilgrims and tourists throughout the year because it is the birthplace of Shri Ram. However, even though the city has numerous temples, ghats, historical buildings, and other monuments, the ever-increasing crowds excessively strain these structures and create a slew of other civic problems such as congestion, particularly during the festival seasons.

name: 13. Moti Mahal
info: Moti Mahal is a monument in Faizabad with historical and cultural value. Moti Mahal is also known as "Pearl Palace". The tourists come from all over the world. Moti Mahal is a popular place for tourists to visit when they visit Faizabad. People from all over the world and India come to see it. The Moti Mahal in the city is known for its grandeur as a building and for capturing this culture's essence. In Uttar Pradesh, Moti Mahal is one of the heritage sites with its unique history.

name: 14. Dashrath Bhavan
info: It is located in the center of the city, in Ramkot Ayodhya, near Faizabad; Dashrath Bhavan is the ancient house of King Dashrath-the monarch of Ayodhya and father of Lord Sri Ram-and is open to the public on weekends and holidays. Dashrath Mahal, also known as Bada Asthan or Badi Jagah, is a beautiful palace complex with spectacular temples dedicated to King Ram.

name: 15. Guptar Ghat
info: Guptar Ghat is a decent place in Faizabad, near Ayodhya, and is located on the Sarayu River banks, also known as Ghaggar. In the past, this ghat was a neighbor to the colonial Company Gardens, which is today known as Gupta Ghat Van. Guptar Ghat, located on the River Saryu, is a sacred site with significant religious importance. By mythology, this was the location where Lord Rama took his last plunge (Jal samadhi) before departing this world and returning to his original dwelling, 'Baikuntha.

name: 1. Lal Bagh
info: It is an old botanical garden in Bangalore. Lalbagh is a popular tourist destination in Bengaluru. This garden is spread across 240 acres of land. This garden has the largest collection of tropical and sub-tropical plants in India. This garden has 4 gates which are the western gate, eastern gate, southern gate, and northern gate.

name: 2. Mysore Palace
info: It is a famous tourist attraction in Mysore. It is a royal mansion and a historical palace. Amba Vilas palace is another name for this palace. Maharani Pramoda Devi Wadiyar was the owner of this palace, and this palace was completed in 1912. Henry Irwin was the architect of this house. Indo-Saracenic is the architectural style of this palace. The cost of building this palace was 41.47 lakhs rupees. The palace is open for visitors from 10:00 am to 5:30 pm.

name: 3. Chamundeshwari Temple
info: It is a Hindu temple. It is situated at the summit of the Chamundi Hills. This is a temple of the Chamundeshwari deity. The important festival of this shrine is Navratri. Pooja and Darshana's timing of this temple is 7.30 am to 2 pm and 3.30 pm to 6 pm. Abhisheka's timing of this temple is 6 am to 7.30 am and 6 pm to 7.30 pm. Facilities provided by the trust to the devotees on Chamundi hill are a primary health care unit, drinking water, and a guest house with 20 rooms.

name: 4. Mysore Zoo
info: The Mysore Zoo is one of the most popular destinations in the city. This zoo is located in Mysore. The zoo was opened in 1892. This zoo is spread across 157 acres of land. The zoo is closed on Tuesday, and on other days it is open from 8:30 am to 5:30 pm for visitors.

name: 5. Virupaksha Temple
info: It is a Hindu temple. It is in Hampi. Lord Virupaksh is the deity of this shrine. The temple opens from 6 am to 1 pm and 5 pm to 9 pm for visitors. There is no entry fee to the temple. Visitors can hire a guide to get complete information about the temple. Lankan Dandesha constructed this temple.

name: 6. Lotus Mahal
info: In the Hampi, it is a secular structure. Chitrangi Mahal is another name for lotus mahal. Indo-Islamic is the architectural style of this mahal. The temple opens from 8 am to 6 pm for visitors. The entrance fee for Indians is 10 rupees, and entrance fees for a foreigner is 250 rupees.

name: 7. ISKCON Temple
info: It is one of the world's biggest Krishna temples. It is in Bangalore. This temple was completed in 1997. A gold-plated dhwaja stambha and gold plated Kalash are the special features of this temple. During the Darshana hours, the parsadam is given to all devotees.

name: 8. Cubbon Park
info: This park is considered to be the green lung of the city. Sri Chamarajendra Park is the official name of this park. This park is in Bengaluru. In 1870 the park was founded by Sir John Meade. There is no entry fee to this park.

name: 9. Bandipur National Park
info: It is a popular destination for animal lovers. This park is spread across 868.63 km2 of land. This park was established in 1974. This park is in the Chamarajnagar district. The Bengal tiger, Indian elephant, four-horned antelope, gaur, mugger crocodile, sloth bear, Indian rock python, dhole and golden jackal are found in Bandipur National Park.

name: 10. Brindavan Gardens
info: This garden is 12 kilometres from Mysore. This garden was completed in 1932. This park is spread across 60 acres of land, and the garden is operated by Cauvery Niravari Nigama. The garden is open for visitors from 6.30 am to 8 pm. The entrance fee for adults is 15 rupees, and entrance fees for the kid are 5 rupees. The musical fountain is one of the most popular attractions of this garden. This show lasts for 60 minutes, from 6.30 pm to 7.30 pm. The 4 important areas of the garden are north Brindavan, the main gate, the children's garden and south Brindavan. This garden is spread across 75 acres of land.

name: 11. Bangalore Palace
info: It is a famous tourist attraction in Bangalore. HH Pramoda Devi Wadiyar was the owner of this palace. This palace was completed in 1878. Tudor Revival architecture is the architectural style of this palace. The palace has a total of 35 rooms, the majority of which are bedrooms, as well as a swimming pool. There is a park in the palace. The Fun World is the name of that amusement park.

name: 12. Abbey Falls
info: It is a waterfall. Abbi Falls is the alternative name of Abbey falls. The waterfall was previously known as Jessi falls. As Jessi was the name of the British officer's wife, so this waterfall was named after her. It is approximately 10 km from Madikeri. The water spring comes down from a cliff from a height of 70 feet, and this is a very eye-catching scene.

name: 13. Iruppu Falls
info: It is in the Kodagu district. The Lakshmana Tirtha fall is another name for this fall. This fall is a popular tourist destination as well as a sacred site for Hindu pilgrims because, on the banks of the Lakshmana Tirtha River, the Rameshwara temple is located.

name: 14. Coorg
info: In Karnataka, it is a beautiful hill station. This place has towering hills, waterfalls, huge coffee plantations and a beautiful view. Popular tourist attraction in the Coorg is Abbey falls, Mandalpatti viewpoint, Pushpagiri wildlife sanctuary, Namdroling monastery, Somvarpet, Madikeri, Bhagamandala etc.

name: 15. Nagarhole National Park
info: It is a popular destination for animal lovers. This park is home to mammals, reptiles, birds, and insects. There are around 270 bird species in the park. There are around 60 species of ants and 96 species of dung beetles. It is the home to approximately 1,000 Asian elephants. Visitors can visit the park from 6 am - 9 am and 4 pm - 6:30 pm. The entrance fee for Indians is 150 rupees, and entrance fees for foreigners are 1500 rupees. If the visitors want to take the camera inside the park, then the visitors will have to pay 200 rupees for the still camera as the camera entrance fee.

name: 16. The Raja's Seat
info: It is a famous tourist spot in Coorg. It is a seasonal garden. There is a toy train, Gandhi mantap, and artificial fountains in this garden. The fee for the toy train is 20 rupees.

name: 17. Mahabaleshwar Temple
info: It is a famous temple in Gokarna. This temple was completed in 345 - 365 CE. Lord Shiva is the main deity of this temple. Dravidian is the architectural style of this temple. Mayuravarma is the creator of this temple. Shivratri Rath Yatra is celebrated here with great enthusiasm. Specific clothes such as jeans, trousers or shorts are prohibited inside the temple. The temple is open from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm and 5 pm to 8 pm for visitors.

name: 18. Pilikula Nisargadhama
info: It is a famous tourist place in Mangalore. It is an infotainment park. This place has a science centre, a zoo, a botanical garden, a water park and an artisan village. The zoo is spread across 80 hectares of land. The entrance fee for adults is 50 rupees, the entrance fee for the kid is 20 rupees, and the entrance fee for the foreigner is 100 rupees. If the visitors want to take the camera inside the park, then the visitor will have to pay 150 rupees for the video camera and 30 rupees for the still camera as the camera entrance fee.

name: 19. Dubare Elephant Camp
info: Dubare is famous for its elephant camp. This forest camp is situated on the banks of the Kaveri river in the Kodagu district. Dubare elephant camp offers a variety of activities like elephant riding, elephant feeding and bathing, birdwatching and fishing, and adventure activities. The camp is open from 8:30 am to 11 am and 4:30 pm to 5:30 pm for visitors. It takes 3 to 4 hours to see and do activities in the camp.

name: 20. Innovative Film City
info: This film city is in Bangalore. It is a movie theme park in India. In Bangalore, this film city is a famous tourist attraction. Cartoon city, mini-golf, aqua kingdom, dino park, adventurous sports, haunted mansion, Bigg boss tour, mirror maze, and museums are the main tourist attraction of this movie theme park. The movie theme park is open from 10 am to 7 pm for visitors. It takes 4 hours to 5 hours to see and walk in the whole park. Its entry fee is 600 rupees before 3:00 pm and 400 rupees after 3:00 pm.

name: 21. Nandi Hills
info: This hill has beautiful nature views, and it is also a famous trekking spot. This hill is in Chikkaballapur. This hill is a paradise for cyclists. Famous spots on this hill are Tipu's Drop, Bhoga Nandeeshwara temple, and paragliding in Nandi Hills.

name: 22. Snow City
info: It is one type of amusement park in Bangalore. Artificial Snow is used to creating this snow city. The idol of snow animals, toys and igloos is kept on the Snow. Snow dance floor, exclusion, snow mountain climbing, mad labs, snow hiking, 9D cinema, and gaming arcade are the main attractions of Snow City.

name: 23. Gol Gumbaz
info: It is a popular tourist place in Bijapur. It is the mausoleum of Mohammed Adil Shah. This mausoleum was completed in 1656, and Yaqut of Dabul was the designer of this mausoleum. Dark grey basalt is used to construct this mausoleum, and the height of this mausoleum is 51 metres. This mausoleum is open from 10 am - 5 pm for visitors. It takes 2 hours to 3 hours to see and walk in the mausoleum. The entrance fee for Indians is 10 rupees, and entrance fees for foreigners are 100 rupees.

name: 24. St. Mary Islands
info: It is a popular tourist place in Udupi. Its other names are coconut Island, Parashurama deep, and Thonsepar. It is a picturesque island off the shore of Udupi. The time of the ferry from maple is between 9:30 am to 5:30 pm. It takes 3 to 4 hours to see and walk in the Islands. This Island entrance fee is 250 rupees, and for the camera, the visitors will have to pay 200 rupees as the camera entrance fee. The ferry fee is 250 rupees to 300 rupees. Visitors enjoy Udupi cuisine on this island. Other sights around this Island are Vadabhandeshwara temple, Daryabahadurgarh fort, and Malpe beach.

name: 1. Sarafa Market or Sarafa Bazaar
info: In Indore, Sarafa Market or Sarafa Bazaar is one of the best places to spend time with your family or friends. This is the best place in Indore, especially for food lovers. This market is open at night only, and there is a crowd of people here all night; you can enjoy in this market from 8 pm to 2 am. In this market, you can find many shops for the different food items in a row. You can enjoy yourself with anyone by eating delicious food at this place. The location of this place is: Sarafa Bazaar, Near Maharaja Tukoji Rao Holker Cloth Market, Indore, Madhya Pradesh.

name: 2. Rajwada
info: Rajwada is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Indore. Rajwada is a historical palace, and it was constructed around two centuries ago by the Maratha Empire's Holkars. This palace is seven-storeyed, a unique example of royal grandeur and architectural skills. It is divided into two parts. One part of Rajwada is a temple, and another part of Rajwada is a lavish palace. This place is always full of tourists; you come here with your family and friends and enjoy watching the unique architecture of the grand place and spending quality time in the garden with them. The location of this place is: Rajwada Circle, Near Holker Cloth Market, Rajwada, Indore, Madhya Pradesh, 452002.

name: 3. Khajrana Ganesh Temple
info: Khajrana Ganesh Temple is the biggest temple of Lord Ganesha in Indore. In the middle of the Indore city, this temple is located. People who live in Indore or People living around Indore have great reverence for this temple. This temple was built by one of the bravest Maratha queens, Ahilyabai Holkar. Thousands of devotees come here every day to worship Lord Ganesha.

name: 4. Central Museum of Indore
info: Many people love to know about history and love to watch some unique things that belong to the past. So, the Central Museum of Indore is the perfect place to visit for those types of people. The museum is located near General Post Office. You will get to see the best sculptures in this museum. Many tourists come here every day.

name: 5. Crescent Water & Amusement Park
info: Everyone likes to enjoy going to the water park with their family or friends, but the water park is not available in every city, but you must not be disappointed. Indore has a great water park where you can go and enjoy yourself with your family and friends. The entry fee in this water park is only Rs. 499, and you can enjoy here from the morning at 10 AM to the evening at 6 PM. Every day thousands of people come to enjoy in this water park. The location of this water park is: Gram Jamniya, Near Narmada Kshipra Devguradia Khurd, Kampel Rd, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452016.

name: 6. Patalpani Waterfall
info: This is another best tourist destination in Indore. If you wish to go to a place where there is only greenery, and you can enjoy only nature, you must go to Patalpani. This destination is 30 Km from Indore city. Anyone who visits Indore, this place definitely remains on their visit list. If you are a photographer, then this place is perfect for you. This is one of the perfect picnic spots in Indore. You can go to Patalpani by bus, car, and bike; it depends upon you. The location of this place is Kekariya Dabri, Madhya Pradesh, 453441.

name: 7. Tornado Water Park
info: Apart from Crescent Water Park, there is another water park in Indore that is very good, and the name of this water park is Tornado Water Park. Tornado is the best place to enjoy with family and friends and also the best place to spend quality time with all the people you love. In this water park, there is everything that is essential to be in any water park. In this water park, you also enjoy the Wave pool, which is also in a big area. The timing of this water park is from 10 AM to 6 PM, and the price per person is Rs. 500 without food and with food Rs. 700. This place is 30 KM from Indore City, and the location of this park is: 10, Gram tincha, Tincha Waterfall Rd, Berchha, Madhya Pradesh 452020.

name: 8. Annapurna Temple
info: There are many temples in Indore, and one of these is the Annapurna temple. This temple is dedicated to the food goddess Annapurna. Moreover, this temple also has many similarities with Madurai's Meenakshi Temple.

name: 9. Indore Zoo
info: The zoo is everyone's favourite; everyone is always excited to visit the zoo, mainly children. There is also one zoo known as Kamla Nehru Prani Sangrahalaya Indore in Indore. This zoo is closed on Monday and open the rest of the days. This zoo is spread very far, about 50 acres, and you can see almost every animal, bird, and snake here. The time of this zoo is from 9 am to 6 pm. A ticket to this zoo is very economical for everyone, the price of the ticket is only 20 Rs per person. So, if you wish to enjoy with friends and family, then this place is for you. The location of this place is: AB Rd, Doordarshan Kendra, Navlakha, Indore, Madhya Pradesh 452001.

name: 10. Ralamandal Wildlife Sanctuary
info: In Indore, Ralamandal Wildlife Sanctuary is another best place to explore. If you are a nature lover and want to see different types of Fauna and flora in one place, then this place is for you. Here you see Sambar, Chital, Blue bull, Leopard, Black Buck, Jarak, Bhedki, Rabbit, and many other animals and see different flora like Eucalyptus, Babul, Bamboo Teak, Saja, Chandan, and many more. Ralamandal Wildlife Sanctuary is one of the oldest wildlife centuries in Madhya Pradesh and was established in 1989.

name: 11. Pipliyapala Regional Park
info: Park is a place where people of all ages like to visit. In Indore, there are also many parks, but Pipliyapala Regional Park is one of the best parks in Indore. This park is also known as Atal Bihari Vajpayee Regional Park. This is one of the best places to visit in Indore, where you can sit and enjoy the beauty of nature. You can bring your family and children here and spend quality time with them. Here you can do a lot of activities that make you happy. The entry fees of this park are also very economical for adults; the entry fee is only Rs. 25, and for children, the entry fee is only Rs. 5. This park is open from 11 am to 9 pm, and the view of this park at night is really mesmerizing. The location of this place is: Pipliya Pala, Indore, Madhya Pradesh, 452020.

name: 12. Bijasen Tekri Temple
info: In Indore, there are many temples, and some of them are very beautiful. On such temple in Indore is Bijasen Tekri Temple. Bijasan Mata, considered one of Maa Durga's incarnations, is worshiped in this temple.

name: Conclusion
info: Indore is a very beautiful city; it is also the cleanest city in India. We discussed in this article some of the best tourist places in Indore. Moreover, there are many other tourist attractions in Indore, which is also the best place to visit with family and friends; some of them are Lalbagh Palace, Kanch Mandir, Krishnapura Chhatris, Lotus Lake, Gulawat, Fundore and many more.
