name: 1. Madikeri Fort:
info: In the 17th century, king Muddu Raja ordered the construction of the Madikeri Fort. On the occasion of naming Madikeri as Coorg's new capital city. The monarch also ordered the construction of the Madikeri Fort, which was eventually taken over by several kings, including the Tipu Sultan. The fort's construction underwent various alterations, the most significant of which was undertaken by the British during imperialism. The fort now houses the Deputy Commissioner's office and a museum with unique collections and relics.

name: 2. Omkareshwara Temple:
info: This lovely temple, located in Karnataka's the Western Ghats, impresses visitors with its peaceful environment and unusual architecture. It was founded in 1820 by King Lingarajendra II and had a unique architecture that attracted people worldwide. If you're travelling with your family, you should stop by this lovely temple and spend some time with them. Among the various Coorg tourist attractions, it is undoubtedly one of the most popular. The combination of Gothic and Islamic architecture is a one-of-a-kind experience that must be experienced when vacationing in Coorg.

name: 3. Gaddige Raja's Tomb:
info: Raja's Seat is a gorgeous tourist spot in Coorg that is placed in the town of Madikeri. It's a popular sunset spot with a stunning view of the green valley and neighbouring hills. A magnificent garden with seasonal flowers and flowing waterfalls surrounding it.

name: 4. Abbey Falls:
info: If you're driving to Coorg on a road trip, it's simple to see the sights along the journey and all the fantastic tourist attractions in this lovely location. Because of its stunning beauty, Abbey Falls is one of the most popular places to visit in Coorg. The waterfall is 1 km from Madikeri town, situated between coffee farms and spice estates. Enjoy the Kaveri River's stunning beauty as it rushes down a hillside, eventually forming the falls. November and December, shortly after the monsoons, are the finest months to visit.

name: 5. Chettalli:
info: A visit to a local town is surprising in Coorg if you are interested in culture. The location is Chettalli, a small Madikeri - Siddapur Road village. The endless vegetation balances the foggy hills, making it a wonderful area to rest and enjoy peace.

name: 6. Mandalpatti Viewpoint:
info: Mandalpatti Viewpoint is a must-see attraction in Coorg. With so much greenery, trekking is surely one of the finest things to do in Coorg; tourist destinations for this hobby are plentiful, but Mandalpatti is regarded as the best. Climb up to Mandalpatti View Point through the gorgeous Makkandur path, but bring plenty of water with you as you begin on one of Coorg's greatest trekking adventures.

name: 7. Kopatty Hills Trek:
info: Kopatty is a fantastic excursion that takes you through forested hills, grasslands, and valleys in Coorg. Despite being only 40 minutes from Madikeri, it is one of the few unexplored hiking trails in the Western Ghats. If you prefer risky adventures, consider making a journey to this amazing place surrounded by beautiful nature.

name: 8. Bhagamandala:
info: Bhagamandala is a major pilgrimage site in the Talacauvery mountains, 39 kilometres from Madikeri. Locals think that these holy waters help them achieve spiritual enlightenment. The sacred confluence of three rivers, the Kaveri, Kannike, and Sujyoti, is known as the 'Triveni Sangam.' The fabled third river is said to run underground till it reaches Sangam.

name: 9. Dubare Elephant Camp:
info: In Coorg, there are many fascinating activities and places to see in four days, whether travelling with your family, friends, or alone. Getting close to elephants at the Dubare Elephant Camp is one of the fascinating things to do in Coorg. With almost 150 elephants, the camp is an excellent opportunity to learn about these fascinating animals. Watch as the elephants are bathed, fed, and trained by the Mahouts. Take a coracle trip along the Cauvery River to see crocodiles, gaurs, wild dogs, sloth bears, and peacocks.

name: 10. Somwarpet:
info: The major town of Somwarpet Taluka, located in the northeast region of Coorg, is one of the best destinations to visit in Coorg. Coffee, pepper, ginger, and cardamom are the high-quality crops grown in the area. According to the last survey, the population of this area is less than ten thousand people who speak English, Hindi, Konkani, Kodava Takk, Are Bhashe, Beary base, and Tulu. Local dishes such as hog curry and Kadubittu, chicken curry, and Akki Roti are also available in the neighbourhood.

name: 11. Honey Valley:
info: Honey Valley, already famous as Nilakandi Falls, is a stunning waterfall in the deep tropical rainforest. The Nilakandi Falls, which start in the Thadiyandamol range, provide tourists with an energizing waterfall shower. If you wish to immerse yourself in Coorg's natural beauties, visit this waterfall. At this refreshing place, you'll see a lot of trekkers and some of Coorg's top adventure activities.

name: 12. Nishani Motte:
info: Nishani Motte, one of Coorg's slightly better attractions, is a perfect weekend trekking track for Bangalore residents. The area is part of the Tala Cauvery Wildlife Sanctuary, home to elephants and leopards, among other wildlife. Because this is not an isolated location, it is advised that you go on the hike with a trekking guide. The nicest part of the journey is the ridge walk along the edges of the beautiful forest on the way. This gorgeous tourist destination is one of the greatest destinations to visit in Karnataka.

name: 13. Cauvery Nisargadhama:
info: A beautiful island called Nisargadhama is 28 kilometres from Madikeri and is covered by teak, sandalwood, and lush bamboo plants. The river Kaveri produced the island in Karnataka's Kodagu district (Cauvery). Staying in the treetop bamboo houses here and taking elephant rides and riverside boats are fun activities in Coorg. One of the best places in Coorg to go out at night is here.

name: 14. Bylakuppe:
info: Bylakuppe is the most culturally rich of all the tourist destinations in Coorg. The Golden Temple or Namdroling Monastery, which keeps to the classic Tibetan style architecture, is the primary attraction of Bylakuppe, India's second-largest Tibetan population. The town is exceptionally beautiful during the Losar (Tibetan New Year) celebration, which is celebrated with tremendous passion.

name: 15. Tadiandamol Peak:
info: Tadiandamol Summit, with a height of 1748 meters, is Coorg's highest mountain peak, and it is also the state of Karnataka's second-highest mountain. Tadiandamol Peak is one of the most popular Coorg tourist destinations, particularly among hikers. Both easy and challenging hiking paths are available, but the top view is truly stunning. The journey to Rock Point is very tough, and the route narrows. Tadiandamol hill is also suitable for trekkers who are new to the sport. It is a nature lover's paradise, with its green hills, foggy weather, and low-rise mountains shrouded by milky clouds.

name: 16. Honnamana Kere Lake:
info: Honnamana Kere Lake, near Daddamalthe village, is the largest natural lake in Coorg and one of the most popular tourist spots. Amid the beautiful green hills, unique coffee farms, and artificial caverns, the silent and tranquil lake appears incredibly magnificent. The celebration is extremely popular during the Gowri Festival, which is performed near the lake in a temple. This temple dedicated to Goddess Honnamana, also called after this lake, attracts many worshippers and visitors. The goddess is said to have given up her life to preserving the community. The relaxing atmosphere and spiritual vibrations will make your vacation to Honnamana Kere Lake memorable. If you wish to attempt round boating, this is one of the most popular Coorg sites.

name: 17. Talacauvery:
info: The Cauvery River's source, Talacauvery, is situated 1,276 meters above sea level on the Brahmagiri hill in the Kodagu district of Karnataka. The location, which has a lovely temple dedicated to the Goddess Kaveriamma, is visited by pilgrims all year. It is said that the Kodavas (Kodagu residents) built a tank and that the river started as a spring filling the tank and later flowed underground for a distance. This viewpoint offers a birds-ey perspective of the beautiful forest regions of Coorg, which are surrounded by muddy hills.

name: 18. Chelavara Falls:
info: The Kaveri River is the source of the waterfalls. They are also known locally as Embepare (Tortoise) Waterfall and are considered one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Coorg. The water falls from 150 feet on a massive tortoise-shaped rock, which explains the area's fascination. Chelavara Waterfall may be reached after a 10-minute trek from the Virajpet Road. The vast white curtains of water flowing down among beautiful green surroundings are a beautiful sight. Chelavara Falls is, without a doubt, the greatest Coorg monsoon destination. So, stop by this destination if you plan a trip to Coorg during the monsoon.

name: 19. Pushpagiri Wildlife Sanctuary:
info: Pushpagiri Wildlife, situated in the Somwarpet Taluk, is famous for its rare and unique birds. The animal sanctuary also features a forest reserve called Kadamakkal, named after Pushpagiri, the region's highest mountain. Bisle Reserve Forest and Kukke Subramanya Forest surround the Pushpagiri Wildlife Sanctuary. While travelling, you'll witness Kote Abbe Waterfall and Mallalli Falls, which are jewels in nature's crown.

name: 20. Iruppu Falls:
info: Iruppu waterfall is one of the most visited tourist attractions in Coorg. The river Lakshmana Tirtha dips 60 feet through the lush mountains to form magnificent falls. A remarkable experience is created by the stunning beauty of the greenery combined with the pouring sound of the waterfalls. Even if you're simply looking for locations to see in Coorg in one day, the fascinating Iruppa Waterfall should be on your list.

name: 21. Barapole River:
info: The Kithu Kakathu River flows into the Barapole River, which runs to the Brahmagiri Peaks. What's more, the rover is an excellent platform for whitewater rafting. You will have a difficult time, especially if you undertake it during the monsoon season. The Barapole River is one of the greatest destinations to visit in Coorg, and don't forget to take in the stunning scenery. So please don't put it off any longer, and prepare for an adventure today.

name: 22. Kutta:
info: Kutta, a little town near Gonikoppal, is a great spot to relax in the middle of nature, next to the Kaveri river. Kutta is the perfect destination to vacation if you want to learn about local culture. However, you won't see many people because this is not a popular tourist spot. This may be excellent news for those wishing to venture off the main path. You may relax and walk along the Kaveri River's banks. The Nagarhole National Park is also available from Kutta.

name: 23. Nagarhole National Park:
info: Nagarhole National Park is one of Coorg, Karnataka's must-see attractions. The Nagarhole National Park is one of the top Coorg destinations to see in one day if you are interested in wildlife. Despite the deep forest, the river bank offers broad sightlines, making it an excellent place to observe wildlife and over 270 species of birds. Summer (April to May) and winter (December to January) are the finest times to visit (November to February).

name: 24. Brahmagiri Peak:
info: Brahmagiri Peak is a beautiful location with forested trees and misty hills. You'll pass through meadows, vibrant foliage, and beautiful clean water streams on your route to the peak. It also features a wildlife sanctuary with animals such as the Lion-tailed Macaque, Jungle Cat, Spotted Deer, Nilgiri Langur, and the Giant Flying Squirrel. It is one of the most beautiful spots in Coorg that can be visited in two days. Consider camping on Brahmagiri Peak on a cool winter night with a campfire that burns for hours. Imagine that. Coorg is one of the nicest destinations in Karnataka during the winter.

name: 25. Virajpet:
info: This is one of the greatest venues to visit in Coorg. The town is well-known worldwide for its remarkable beauty and stunning natural surroundings, making it one of the greatest hill stations in the country. If you want to do something different, go to Virajpet, only 22 kilometres from Coorg in the Kodagu area. The small hill station is situated in the region's centre and hidden from view. It is also known as Virajpete, derived from Virarajendrapete, after the name of the former monarch and creator of the area.

name: 26. Nalknad Palace:
info: This is one of the most famous tourist destinations in Coorg. Nalknad Palace, or Nalkunadu, also known as Naalnaad Aramane in the Kodava language, is a palace in the Kodagu district of Karnataka, India. It was constructed between 1792 and 1794 AD and is located near the Village of Yavakapadi.

name: 27. Namdroling Monastery:
info: The main teaching centre for the Nyingma tradition of Tibetan Buddhism is the Namdroling Nyingmapa Monastery, also known as Thegchog Namdrol Shedrub Dargye Ling. A sangha community of over 5,000 lamas, a junior high school named Yeshe Wodsal Sherab Raldri Ling, a religious college (or shedra for both monks and nuns), a hospital, and other facilities can be found at the monastery, which is situated in Bylakuppe, Karnataka's Kodagu district. This is one of the most visited sights in Coorg.

name: 28. Chiklihole Reservoir:
info: This magnificent reservoir, situated between Madikeri and Kushalnagar in the Coorg district, will bring inner serenity and tranquillity to your journey. It's a truly unconventional and off-the-beaten-path place, away from the rush and bustle. Enjoy the tranquil ambience while exploring the various flora and animals. The lush forests and wide-open spaces provide fantastic picnic places.

name: 29. Harangi Dam:
info: Harangi Dam offers you to relax in a tranquil place surrounded by nature. This wonderful picnic location with a stunning view of a water body flowing around is built across a tributary of the river Kaveri (Cauvery). Harangi Dam, located 36 kilometres from Madikeri, is one of the greatest sites near Coorg. Allow yourself to take as many photographs as you like.

name: 30. Kotebetta Peak:
info: Kotebetta Park is Coorg's third-biggest mountain and one of the most popular tourist destinations. The hill has a fort-like appearance, and there is a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva atop it. The best time to visit Kotebetta is during the summer and fall. One of the finest things to do in Coorg in May is trekking and hiking, one of the top things to do in Coorg.

name: 31.Padi Igguthappa Temple:
info: The Padi Igguthappa Temple is another gorgeous spot to see in Coorg and is one of the best destinations to visit in the state. The temple, which has the Kodavas built-in 1810, is similar to many Kerala designs. It is a major temple in Kodava culture and customs. Devotees go here to have their desires granted, believing them to be graced with mystical powers.

name: 32. Suntikoppa:
info: Suntikoppa is a stunningly gorgeous resort and one of the best spots to visit in Coorg. Spend some time in nature and let your spirit relax. Because the environment is open here, a picnic with family or friends may be organized. Another reason for its appeal is the acres of coffee and spice farms. Suntikoppa also has some of the greatest villas in Coorg.

name: 33. Talakaveri Temple:
info: Talakaveri is famous for two reasons: it has two temples dedicated to Lord Shiva and Lord Ganesha, and it is a significant source of the Kaveri River. It is one of the most popular temples in Coorg, usually visited by devotees, but because of the waterfall, it also draws nature lovers and campers. The best time to visit is in October when pilgrims come to offer prayers for the Sankramana festival.

name: 34. Karada Village:
info: Coorg has practically everything a tourist might want, including waterfalls, national parks, forts, and views. And if you're seeking the best Coorg travel advice, look no further. A journey to Coorg would be completed without a visit to Karada village. In Coorg, Karnataka, Karada village is among the most gorgeous. You won't hear much about Karada because it is an unusual tourist spot with stunning natural beauty to contemplate. With some of the greatest ancestral mansions dating back 200-300 years, expect isolation, coffee estates, tranquility, and a vast expanse of spiritual replenishment. Relax and unwind while sampling the finest of Coorg cuisine.

name: 1. Paradise Beach in Pondicherry
info: Pondicherry's Paradise Beach, located near the city of Chunnambar, is a popular tourist destination. This beach with golden sand is quite popular with tourists. This beach is one of the most popular in Pondicherry, where visitors may relax and enjoy the fresh sea wind. Paradise Beach's sand is quite soft and grainy. A walk on the beach here provides tourists with an unforgettable experience.

name: 2. Auroville in pondicherry
info: Auroville is also known as a "Universal Town" since it is home to individuals from all over the world with various cultures and customs. Mirra Alfassa, Aurobindo's student, created Auroville in 1968, roughly 15 kilometres from Pondicherry in Tamil Nadu. This global township was founded on February 28, 1968, to create a location where people would be willing to forget their caste, creed, or nationality to become a centre of continuous education and advancement. Let us tell you that this township now has over 2,800 official inhabitants from over 195 nations.

name: 3. Aurobindo Ashram in pondicherry
info: The Aurobindo Ashram, located in Pondicherry's White Town, is a well-known landmark named after its founder, Sri Aurobindo Ghosh. Let us inform you that the foundation of this ashram was established on November 24, 1926, when he retired from politics and moved to Pondicherry. Aurobindo follower Mirra Alfassa played a key role in establishing this ashram and took care of it immediately after Sri Aurobindo Ghosh's passing in 1950. The ashram is home to around 500 followers, 500 pupils, and 1300 patients.

name: 4. Promenade Beach in pondicherry
info: Promenade Beach is a popular tourist location in Puducherry, India, extending 1.2 kilometres from War Memorial to Duplex Park on Gaubert Avenue. Tourists should visit the Heritage Town Hall, War Memorial, Old Lighthouse, Promenade Beach, Statue of Joan of Arc, and Mahatma Gandhi statue. Promenade Beach is a well-known location that is frequently busy with volleyball clubs. Tourists may enjoy sports such as yoga, walking, running, skating, and swimming on this beach in the evening. On this peaceful beach, visitors may view rocks and pebbles. Aside from that, other well-known restaurants on the beach provide traditional food.

name: 5. Serenity Beach in pondicherry
info: Serenity Beach is located 10 kilometres outside of Puducherry in Kottakuppam. Originally, this beach was called Thanthirayan Kuppam Beach or simply Kottakupam Beach. If you plan a trip to Pondicherry, you should stop by Serenity Beach. This beach is popular among honeymooners. If you wish to sunbathe quietly while resting on the sand on the beach, here is the place to be. Because this beach is far from the city, there aren't many local tourists.

name: 6. Lighthouse in pondicherry
info: The Pondicherry Lighthouse is an excellent location where travellers may witness wonderful birds in various ways. Let us inform you that there are two lighthouses in this area, one ancient and one new. The historic lighthouse on this site is no longer open to the public. The French intended to construct a lighthouse to offer visitors a beautiful sea view. This was followed in March 1836 by the building of the old lighthouse under the supervision of A. Guerre. It was closed in 1979 after several years of operation. In the same year, another lighthouse was built, which is now one of Pondicherry's most popular tourist sites. This 157-foot-high lighthouse hosts cultural events, concerts, and commercial operations.

name: 7. Gokilambal Thirukameswar Temple in pondicherry
info: Gokilambal Thirukmeswara Temple is a lovely temple dedicated to Lord Shiva that is located in the little village of Villianur, 11 kilometres from Pondicherry. The French influence on this temple is obvious to visitors. A vehicle festival at the temple demonstrates the shrine's ties to French heritage. During this occasion, worshipers drag a 15-meter-high chariot through the city streets.

name: 8. Sri Manakula Vinayagar Temple in pondicherry
info: Sri Manakula Vinayagar Temple is a historic temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha in Pondicherry. The temple is supposed to have been built in the fifth century. On the 18th day of Brahmotsavam, many worshippers attend this temple. Vinayaka Chaturthi is an important event held with tremendous zeal at Sri Manakula Vinayagar Temple. According to legend, a Frenchman attempted to take the Ganesha idol from the temple, but it returned once the statue was gone. He became a follower of the Lord after being inspired by the statue's power.

name: 9. Basilica of The Sacred Heart of Jesus in pondicherry
info: This church, located 2.5 kilometres from the Pondicherry Bus Station on South Boulevard in the city, is one of the most important and religious destinations in Pondicherry. This church in Pondicherry is one of India's 21 basilicas. It was founded in 1908 by French missionaries and was later elevated to the basilica in 2011. In the church, holidays such as New Year's, Christmas, and Easter are celebrated magnificently. If you visit the city, you must stop by this gorgeous church.

name: 10. French War Memorial in pondicherry
info: The French War Memorial, located on Gobert Avenue, is an interesting tower created to honour the soldiers who died in World War I. Let us tell you that on July 14, this monument holds an annual memorial service, during which it is attractively decked. If visiting Pondicherry, you should also visit the French War Memorial.

name: 11. Arikamedu in pondicherry
info: Arikamedu is a remarkable historical monument and old Roman trading town located about a half-hour drive from the French colonial capital of Pondicherry. From the first century BC to the second century AD, the port city was held by the Romans, Cholas, and French as a notable nautical centre. Arikemedu's glass bead production facility is the most well-known in Puri. The initial excavations at Arikemedu began in the 1940s, and there has been continual excavation since then.

name: 12. Raj Niwas in Pondicherry
info: Raj Niwas, formerly called Palais du Sarkar, is a popular tourist destination in Pondicherry. The Raj Niwas is an eighteenth-century structure that presently serves as the house of the Lieutenant Governor of Pondicherry. The structure is not available to the public, yet it is a popular tourist site. The original court is also visible within a complex within this tower. The Raj Niwas' major draw is its monolithic pillars, which were transferred here from the Gingee Fort in 1751. Aside from that, several Gingee Fort pillars surround the Gandhi Mandapam on Promenade Beach.

name: 13. Botanical Garden in Pondicherry
info: The Botanical Garden, also known as C.S. Perrotate, is a famous tourist site in Pondicherry. It was founded in 1862. As the name suggests, this garden is a fish house with various exotic plants. Tourists may witness flora collected from various areas of India and worldwide. This aquarium is a fantastic spot to observe a variety of aquatic species as well as some beautiful fish. If planning a trip to Pondicherry, you must include the Botanical Garden in your schedule.

name: 14. Chidambram in Pondicherry
info: Chidambaram is a lovely temple town 63 kilometres from Pondicherry, known for the Lord Nataraja temple and the famed chariot festival. Chidambaram is located 250 kilometres from Chennai, a place of religious significance since ancient times.

name: 15. Water Sports in Pondicherry
info: Pondicherry is a beach lover's dream. Tourists are drawn to the area's beautiful beaches. Sunbathing on the beaches here is a lovely experience for everyone. Pondicherry's beaches are also well-known for water sports. Water sports such as parasailing, scuba diving, and banana boat excursions are available to visitors.

name: How to Reach Pondicherry
info: Pondicherry is in South India and is well connected by air to the rest of the country and most major cities worldwide. Aside from that, it has excellent rail and road connections to all of India's main cities.

name: Local Food in Pondicherry
info: Pondicherry is one of the Indian cities where French food has impacted the food. Several eateries serve French cuisine in this area. Baguettes, Italian Baked Beans, Croissants, Stuffed Cabbage, and many more dishes are popular here. In addition, foods from other South Indian states may be sampled in this union region. La Cafe Carte Blanche, Maison Rose, Satsang, Cafe de Flor, Well Cafe, and Le Cafe are some of the most well-known restaurants in Pondicherry.

name: Best Time to Visit Pondicherry
info: If you want to visit Pondicherry, the ideal time is between October and March. During this period, the temperature in the city ranges from 15 to 30 degrees Celsius. The summers here are fairly hot, with temperatures reaching 40 degrees Celsius. The monsoon season is also a fantastic time to visit. However, the optimal time to visit Pondicherry differs from person to person because this city varies with the seasons and has several events that are popular with travellers.

name: 1. VUDA Park in Visakhapatnam
info: Visakhapatnam Urban Development Authority (VUDA) Park, also known as Taraka Rama Park, is one of the greatest places to visit in Vizag. This lovely recreation complex, which covers an area of 55 acres, is ideal for spending time with the family. The lush green trees (about 2500), gorgeous lawns, and colourful flowers give a special attractiveness to the place and attract many nature enthusiasts. Because the park is only a few kilometres away from Ramakrishna Beach, you may visit both on the same day.

name: 2. Victory at Sea War Memorial in Visakhapatnam
info: The Victory at Sea War Memorial on Beach Road was created to memorialise the Indian Navy and Eastern Naval Command heroes of the 1971 Indo-Pak War. During the conflict, Pakistan planned to attack an Indian aircraft carrier, the INS Vikrant, at the port of Visakhapatnam. The Indian Navy, on the other hand, battled courageously and was successful in destroying a Pakistani submarine dubbed PNS Ghazi off the coast of Visakhapatnam, returning victor. As a result, in 1996, a memorial was created to commemorate the first war victory in the 1971 conflict.

name: 3. Ross Hill Church in Visakhapatnam
info: Ross Hill Church, noted for its stunning location and spectacular design, is one of the most religiously significant and interesting places in Vizag. Vizag is encircled by three hills, with Ross Hill Church in the centre. When you reach the top of the hill, you may enjoy breathtaking views over Vizag's whole city, including the harbour, shipyards, and beaches.

name: 4. TU 142 Aircraft Museum in Visakhapatnam
info: In addition to parks and beaches, Visakhapatnam has several museums that showcase the city's unique combination of ancient history and modern culture. The TU 142 Aircraft Museum, for example, is one of the most spectacular things to see in Visakhapatnam. It is exceptional because a naval aircraft with a 30-year flight career and 30,000 hours of flight time was retired and converted into a museum. This aircraft museum, a source of great pride for the community, reveals much about the lives of naval soldiers.

name: 5. Rama Krishna Mission Beach in Visakhapatnam
info: The longest beach in Visakhapatnam is Rama Krishna Mission Beach, just 4 kilometres from Visakhapatnam Railway Station. While swimming is not recommended at the beach, you may always spend the time sunbathing, playing volleyball with friends, or surfing the waves. This beach should be on your schedule when visiting Visakhapatnam.

name: 6. Lawson's Bay Beach in Visakhapatnam
info: VMRDA City Central Park, which opened in 2016, is one of the city's greatest amusement parks. It is noted for its beautiful green surroundings and quiet settings and is located in the heart of Vizag. If you want to relax in the heart of a forest or have fun with your loved ones, Dr YS Rajasekhara Reddy Central Park or VMRDA City Central Park is the place to be.

name: 7. Bojjannakonda in Visakhapatnam
info: Buddhism was the prevalent religion in this section of the country at the time. Bojjannakonda, formerly known as Budina Konda, is a collection of Buddhist rock-cut caves extending from the 4th to the 9th centuries AD. It is situated in the village of Shankaram, 21 kilometres from Visakhapatnam. One of the most prominent Buddhist establishments in Andhra Pradesh is this modest group of six rock-cut caverns containing magnificently carved sculptures of Lord Gautam Buddha, monasteries, and monumental stupas.

name: 8. Katiki Falls in Visakhapatnam
info: Katiki Waterfalls in Visakhapatnam is another natural wonder worth seeing. The waterfall, perched at the height of 50 feet, is an ideal location for photographing some breathtaking views. The spring's principal water source is the Gosthani River. The image of water flowing down an almost vertical rock is accompanied by vast vegetation and peacefulness that you will never forget. If the lush foliage isn't enough for you, head to the waterfalls to properly appreciate the beauty of this location.

name: 9. Rushikonda Beach in Visakhapatnam
info: Rushikonda Beach is one of Visakhapatnam's most beautiful and popular beaches, helping to earn the city the label "Jewel of the East Coast." This beach will enchant you with its emerald green waves and beautiful sandy beaches. When visiting Vizag, this is a must-see destination.

name: 10. Yarada Beach in Visakhapatnam
info: A coastal city without a beach is as difficult to imagine as life without air. Yarada Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Visakhapatnam. Hills border it on three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the fourth, completing the comprehensive view. Unlike other Vizag beaches, it is quite serene and peaceful.

name: 11. INS Kursura Submarine Museum in Visakhapatnam
info: One of the best places to visit in Visakhapatnam is the Submarine Museum on Ramakrishna Beach. The Russian-built submarine INS Kursura was decommissioned in 2001 and transformed into a museum in 2002. The museum is an excellent resource for learning more about the Indian Navy. It takes you on a tour of how submarines function, what happens, and the arduous job of living within during battle, focusing on submarine life. You may readily learn about the submarine's inner workings using images, relics, and written scripts.

name: 12. Simhachalam Temple in Visakhapatnam
info: It is an 11th-century Hindu temple devoted to Lord Vishnu's forms Varaha, Narasimha, and Goddess Lakshmi. The temple architecture is largely Dravidian, with various Kalinga influences. Everything in the temple captivates the attention, from the sculptures on the inner wall to the temples of Lord Vishnu. The temple is always coated with sandalwood paste, as in South India. Spend some time visiting the temple and attempting to decipher the inscriptions dating back to 1087 AD.

name: 13. Borra Caves in Visakhapatnam
info: Bora caves are located 705 metres above sea level. You may hear the echo of your voice once within the caverns. There is also a little Shivling amid the caverns. Many worshippers travel to the Bora caves to see the Shivling. Climbing a steep stairway will bring you to the temple's heart.

name: 14. Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary in Visakhapatnam
info: The Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary, named after the nearby hill Kambalakonda, is spread across an area of 17000 acres and is a beautiful spot to spend time in the lap of nature. It serves as the city's green lungs and is a favourite sanctuary from the hustle and bustle. Many unique birds, animals, reptiles, and butterflies call this wildlife reserve home, including the pangolin, laughing dove, Bengal Tiger, Indian muntjac, leopard, wild boar, sambar deer, Russell's viper, red-muscled bulbul, and Indian sunbeam butterfly.

name: 15. Kailasagiri in Visakhapatnam
info: Kailasagiri is a well-known hill station in Visakhapatnam. Hill Park has tiny hills and beaches and is located around 173 metres above sea level, providing some of the most beautiful views. You may come here with your friends, family, or partner; there's something for everyone. It has everything from ropeways to trolley vehicles for youngsters to a Shiva-Parvati statue for pilgrims to view and enjoy.

name: How to Reach Visakhapatnam
info: Visakhapatnam is best visited between October and March. Due to the arrival of winter, the temperature here in these months fluctuates from 15 ° C to 27 ° C, attracting travellers. It rains a lot from July to September. Therefore this is not a good time to come. The temperature in Visakhapatnam fluctuates between April and July from 22°C to 41°C. Fewer visitors visit during these months due to the scorching weather.

name: Best Time to Visit Visakhapatnam
info: Visakhapatnam is best visited between October and March. Due to the arrival of winter, the temperature here in these months fluctuates from 15 ° C to 27 ° C, attracting travellers. It rains a lot from July to September. Therefore this is not a good time to come. The temperature in Visakhapatnam fluctuates between April and July from 22°C to 41°C. Fewer visitors visit during these months due to the scorching weather.

name: 1. Kallanai Dam
info: The most well-known and historic dam in Trichy to meet up with friends and family is Grant Anaicut, popularly known as "Kallanai." It is situated roughly 20 kilometres from the Cauvery River in the Thanjavur and Trichy districts. The Great Karikalan Cholan constructed the Kallanai dam in the second century AD, around 2000 years ago. The British rebuilt the dam in the nineteenth century. The primary goals of the dam's construction were to increase irrigation of the delta regions and alter the flow of large water from the Cauvery basin to the Kollidam basin.

name: 2. Varahi Amman Temple
info: The Varahi Amman Temple is situated in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchirapalli district's Mangal Nagar, Woraiyur. The building houses a temple honoring Saptha Matha Varahi Amman, a respected Matrika. Saptha Matha is the fifth mother of the Matrikas, a Hindu group of seven mothers or Goddesses. The temple at Tiruchirapalli was established by Sri Varahi Daasar Boopathi Swami, a devoted and steadfast follower of the seven Goddesses.

name: 3. Thiruvanaikoil Temple/ Jambukeswarar Temple
info: Sri Thiruvanaikoil, also known as Thiruvanaikaval, and Jambukeswarar temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Trichy Railway Junction is 11 km away from the temple. On Srirangam Island, the temple was constructed by Kochengon, a member of the Early Cholas, roughly 1800 years ago. The Thiruvanaikoil Temple is one of the five significant Shiva temples known as Panchabhoota Sthala. The temple stands for the element of water. Shiva Lingam in the form of an Appu lingam is in the sanctuary (water lingam). A water stream runs beneath Lord Jambukeshwara's sanctuary, and water may always be seen emerging from it. Devi Akilandeswari Amman is the presiding goddess.

name: 4. Brahmapureeswarar Temple
info: As Lord Brahmapureeswarar is thought to have altered Lord Brahma's fate, the famous Hindu temple known as Brahmapureeswarar Temple is dedicated to him in the shape of Swayambu Lingam. It is situated in Tamil Nadu's Thirupattur neighbourhood, close to Tiruchi. It is a traditional myth that by visiting this temple, which is primarily dedicated to Shiva, one can alter his or her own destiny. In a separate shrine, Lord Brahma can be found sitting in his well-known lotus flower meditation position. In the temple, Goddess Parvathi is also worshipped.

name: 5. Viralimalai Murgum Temple
info: In the heart of Trichy's Viralimalai town stands the Viralimalai Murugan Temple. The temple has been one of Tamil Nadu's most well-known temples. The Viralimalai hill, where the temple is situated, is where it gets its name. The shrine is reachable only after ascending a staircase of roughly 207 stairs. There are also a few mandapams along the route that offer restrooms for the pilgrims.

name: 6. Joseph's Church
info: One of Trichy's oldest churches is St. Joseph's Church. It is situated in the city's center. Our Lady of Lourdes Church is another name for St. Joseph's Church in Trichy. Its architecture is similar to that of France's Our Lady of Lourdes Church. Rev. Frederick Christian Schwartz, a Danish missionary, established St. Joseph's church in 1792. The church is constructed in the Gothic style. It stands 200 feet high. The church's 62-foot-tall tower may be seen from a distance of 8 kilometers away. The tower has five saint sculptures carved into it. Images from the Bible are painted on the glass window panels. It has an altar made of Sandalwood marvel.

name: 7. Agaya Gangai Waterfalls
info: The Agaya Gangai waterfalls are in India's Kolli Hills, which are part of the Eastern Ghats. At the summit of the Kolli Hills in Tamil Nadu's Namakkal district, the Agaya Gangai, a jungle stream named Panchanathi, rushes down. It is a waterfall on the river Aiyaru that is 300 feet i.e., 91 meters tall. It is situated in a valley of a mountain.

name: 8. Puliyancholai Waterfalls
info: The Kolli Hills' foothills feature the picturesque area of Puliyancholai. It is 50 kilometers from Namakkal, 76 kilometers from Trichy, and 340 kilometers from Chennai away. It is a forested area with a little stream running through it, as well as tamarind orchards and lush green vegetation. The area is a year-round favourite destination for tourists who prefer taking natural spring baths.

name: 9. Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple
info: Hindus worship Ranganatha, an incarnation of Maha Vishnu, the Supreme God, in the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple. It is situated in Tamil Nadu, India's Srirangam, Tiruchirapalli. The temple, which is built in the Hindu architectural style and stands out among the 108 Divya Desams devoted to The Supreme God Vishnu, is praised by Alvars in their Divya Prabhanda. The temple is the largest operating Hindu temple in the world, covering an area of 155 acres (63 hectares) and including 81 shrines, 21 towers, 39 pavilions, and numerous water tanks. It was built in the Dravidian architectural style. It is one of the most cherished Vaishnava temples in South India, full of myth and tradition.

name: 10. Vekkali Amman Temple
info: Goddess Vekkali, who is regarded as an incarnation of Goddess Durga, is the centerpiece of the Vekkali Amman Temple. The temple is situated in the town of Woraiyur in the South Indian state of Tamil Nadu's Tiruchirapalli. The Goddess is regarded as the embodiment of infinite strength, willpower, harmony, and tranquility. As soon as one enters the temple, they are enveloped with Vekkali Amman's heavenly energy. Visitors to the magnificent temple come to pray, ask for favors, and express appreciation for everything the Goddess has given them. A magnificent feature with a breathtaking chariot is the goddess' shrine, which is composed of gold and silver. Even better, one can put their desires on a piece of paper and place it in a box. Many reports that their desires have been granted and that Vekkali Amman's divine power has only grown stronger with each passing day.

name: 11. Samayapuram Amman Temple
info: The stunning temple is roughly 20 kilometres from Trichy's major city. The goddess Mariamman, who is worshipped here, is thought to be the goddess of power. Additionally, mariamman is thought to offer health and wealth to its worshippers. There is a deep belief that this deity heals both chicken pox and small pox. Processional images of Moolavar and Mariamman are housed in separate shrines at this temple. The location is particularly well-known for the Thai Poosam festival, which is observed annually with great fanfare.

name: 12. Ucchi Pillayar Temple
info: Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the Ucchi Pillayar Temple is a Hindu temple from the seventh century. It is situated in Trichy, Tamil Nadu, India, on the summit of Rockfort. Legend has it that after constructing the Ranganathaswamy shrine at Srirangam, Lord Ganesha fled from King Vibishana to this rock. In Tamil, the Tiruchirapalli Rock Fort is also affectionately known as Malaikottai. The massive granite that makes up the temple's structure is thought to be the world's oldest rock-older than the Himalayan Mountains.

name: 1. Parassinikadavu Sree Muthappan Temple
info: The Parassinikadavu Sree Muthappan Temple is a special place that celebrates devotion and diversity. This temple is dedicated to Sree Muthappan, a Hindu god who likes toddy and grilled fish. What's unique is that this temple doesn't follow the usual Hindu customs.

name: 2. Parassinikkadavu Snake Park
info: Parassinikkadavu Snake Park is unique and one of Kannur's best places. You can see the snakes through the glass cases that hold them. There are also other snakes and birds in the Park. The Park also has much information about the birds and animals kept there.

name: 3. Payyambalam Beach
info: Payyambalam Beach makes you feel like the world is just getting started! It is a beach that people haven't touched and looks beautiful. It has gorgeous golden sand that looks like pearls when the sun shines. It mixes white water with foamy water. Spending every night of your trip on this quiet beach won't be strange. You can switch to adventure mode when you're done calming on this beach. You can swim, go boating, ski, parasail, and do other fun things in its inviting currents.

name: 4. Arakkal Museum
info: Arakkal Kettu is situated at a distance of 3 kilometers from Kannur. It serves as the residence of the Arakkal family, who hold the distinction of being the sole Muslim royal family in Kerala. Historically, they held dominion over the coastal regions and the Lakshadweep islands. This palace, which boasts a heritage of 200 years, is officially designated as a protected monument by the Archaeological Department.

name: 5. Angelo's Fort
info: St. Angelo's Fort, also known as Kannur Fort, is an enormous laterite fort shaped like a spectacular triangle set against the sea. This ancient fort was the site of several battles fought to gain control of the fort.

name: 6. Mappila Bay
info: The natural harbor Mappila Bay is near Kannur, a significant port. On one side of the harbor is where you'll find Fort St. Angelo, characterized by architecture from the colonial era; on the other is where you'll find the Arakkal Palace and Museum. Mappila Bay is mostly used as a port for fishing. There are boat facilities nearby, and you can use them for a boat trip to give you a port tour.

name: 7. Dharmadam Island
info: This part of Kannur has not been developed at all. You have to go to Dharmadam island to escape the noise and chaos of the city and enjoy some peace all to yourself. If you go to Kannur to vacation from your hectic life, you can decide to do nothing except laze about on the island the whole time you are there.

name: 8. Meenkunnu Beach
info: Meenkunnu Beach is widely regarded as one of the most photogenic beaches in Kannur. In addition to being a location popular for fishing, it radiates a chill atmosphere and is an excellent choice for unwinding. The beach is in the shape of a sandy crescent that is framed by rocky cliffs and boulders that are covered with vegetation. When the tide is low, swimming in the ocean from the beach is possible. The peace of the beach is the ideal setting for some introspection. In addition, the beach bars offered tasty snacks with a spicy flavor.

name: 1. Jatayu's Earth Centre:
info: One of the many well-known locations in Kollam Jatayupara Nature Park, which features the most enormous bird sculpture in the world as its primary attraction for tourists. One of the main attractions of this place is the 65-acre rock-themed park Jatayu Earth's Center, which promotes the mythology and adventure of our mythological Ramayana creature. The place also provides access to world-class theatre, which immerses the tourists with a computerized audio-visual room and a cable car to enjoy the aura and beautiful creature of stone and the statue, the most mesmerizing at the place.

name: 2. Thangassery Lighthouse:
info: The Thangassery Lighthouse, also known as the Tangasseri Light House, believes to be the second-highest on Kerala's whole shore and is one of the popular tourist destinations in Kollam. As a result, one of the most popular lighthouses in the state. The tower was built in 1902, is 41 meters (135 feet) tall, and has been used ever since. The massive tower stands out and is visible thanks to its painted red and white oblique stripes. It looks wonderful in all its splendour and majesty.

name: 3. Palaruvi Falls
info: The English name for Palaruvi Waterfalls is "Stream of Milk." The shape of the white-stream waterfall, which is 300 feet in height and flows very rapidly, From June to January is the best time to visit this destination. It is India's 32nd-highest waterfall and is reputed to provide Ayurvedic benefits. It is one of the most popular tourist spots in Kollam because the surrounding forests and mist-covered mountains' peacefulness contrasts dramatically with the fall's thunderous sounds.

name: 4. Sasthamkotta Lake:
info: Sasthamkotta is the most significant and first lake in Kerala and a historic lake representing rich beauty and diversity in the state. The lake derived its name from Sastha Temple, which surrounds the temple and is the primary source of drinking water for Kollam residents on three sides.

name: 5. Kollam Beach:
info: Kollam Beach doesn't need any introduction; it was chosen as Kerala's first "Beach Wedding Destination." There are many things to do in Kollam, but this beach is one of the prettiest and most attractive. This beach, known to some travellers as Mahatma Gandhi Beach, calms travellers with its lush greenery, peaceful backwaters, and various water sports. The Tangasseri Lighthouse, another prominent feature near the beach, is a lighthouse. The spiritual and cultural atmosphere at the beach is amazing and gives visitors fresh energy and motivation.

name: 6. Ashtamudi Lake:
info: This lake is one of our region's most frequented lakes and backwaters. Adorned with verdant water passages bordered by graceful palm and coconut trees, no finer location exists to embark upon a journey of discovery in Kollam, a destination hailed as one of the finest amongst Kollam's tourist places.

name: 7. Thenmala:
info: The Western Ghats' foothills in the Kollam district, recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, are home to Thenmala, India's first planned eco-tourism destination. The name Thenmala translates as Honey Hill. The Parappar Dam crosses the Kallada River and is located in Thenmala. Thenmala forest honey is famous for its medicinal benefits. This location offers attractions such as winding walkways, the Sway Bridge, a theatre, musical fountains, boats, and more. On a mountain railway track to the east is the 13-arched Pathimoonam Kannara Bridge. Thenmala also has Deer Park as an attraction.

name: 8. Mayyand:
info: Mayyanad is one of the top tourist destinations in Kollam since it is the centre of numerous well-known Hindu and Muslim temples and shrines. It is situated along the Arabian Sea's shoreline and the Paravur Lake's shores. It is 10 kilometres from Kollam and home to nine significant temples. The Subramanya temple in Umayanallor, which is reported to have received a blessing from Shri Shankaracharya of Kalladi, is the most significant of the nine temples there. An old mosque and numerous old churches are also available nearby. From Kollam to Mayyanad, buses run regularly.

name: 9. Kumbhavurutty Waterfalls:
info: The Kumbhavurutty Waterfall, one of the well-known tourist attractions in Kollam, located in southern India, is renowned for its crystal-clear blue waters that fall from tremendous heights. The Achankovil River contains a waterfall. The Kumbhavurutty Waterfalls, which are close to the Konni Forest Area, are among Kerala's most magnificent and stunning waterfalls. This beautiful location never fails to mesmerize tourists with its beautiful views and the beauty of the water falling from a height of 25 meters.

name: 10. Sri Mahaganapathi Temple:
info: One of the popular pilgrimage sites in Kollam, this temple is famous among worshippers as a place of devotion and spirituality. Even though Lord Siva is the temple's main god, people often call it the Lord Ganapathy Temple because it is located in Kottarakkara, 25 kilometres from Kollam. The Kottarakkara Unniappam, a rare delicacy served as Prasadam, is the temple's claim to fame. Most visitors are attracted to this centuries-old temple by its attractive architecture. Even non-Hindus are welcome to enter this temple, where the family of Shiva lives, which is one of its most amazing features.

name: 11. Thirumullavaram Beach:
info: An undiscovered beach in Kerala with golden sand surrounding crystal blue water is decorated by coconut and palm trees, creating a quiet and shaded area. The annual Karkidaka Vavubali tradition is what makes this beach so well-known. This beach, on the list of tourist attractions in Kollam, is great for morning and evening strolls while providing a stunning view of the sunsets. Swimming and sunbathing are both great activities at this beach. Near the shore lies the Mahavishnu Temple, which is worth visiting. The granite outcrop, known as the Sunday Rock, is another well-liked feature in this area.

name: 12. Shenduruny Wildlife Sanctuary:
info: Do you want to spend some time with the creatures of nature? Visit the Shenduruny Wildlife Refuge. One of the best sites to visit in Kollam is in the Western Ghats of Kerala's Kollam district. Only this wildlife sanctuary, known for its vast range of animals and plants and stunning environment, is located in Kollam. It includes bird watching, vehicle excursions, walking, and camping in the bush. The Agasthyamalai biosphere reserve includes the sanctuary, and the sanctuary is located on a 26-square-kilometre artificial lake created by the Thenmala Dam.

name: 13. Punalur:
info: Punalur, one of Kollam's most unique tourist destinations, provides a reviving experience and an Old World charm. Two words in Tamil and Malayalam are the source of the name Punalur. Punalur, which means "place of water," is named after the Tamil word "punal," which means "water," and the Malayalam word "ooru," which means "place." The iconic suspension bridge hangs over the Kallada, which runs directly through the city's centre. The "Pepper Village of Kerala" is Panalur. Shenthruni Forest, Palruvi, Courtallam Waterfalls, and the historic Pattazhi Devi Temple are some of the area's tourist attractions.

name: 14. Kakkathuruthu:
info: The Kakkathuruthu Island in Alleppey's Vembanad Lake is small and beautiful. It is also referred to as the "Island of crows." It's a beautiful place to see birds. Some unique features that make Kakkathuruthu special are coconut trees, paddy fields, toddy tapping, fish farming, coir production, and traditional Kerala cuisines like appam, puttu, crab roast, shrimp fry, duck and hog meals with fresh catch from the backwaters. Additionally, tourists enjoy the sunset and the changing colours of the sky.

name: 15. Rameshwaram Temple:
info: The Kollam temple, built in the Pandian style architecture and is believed to have been there since the 12th century, is one of the purest forms of peace and worship place which is the landmark place of traditional allure and vibrance and is full of tourists around the year. Every year in January or February, the annual temple celebration is held. One of Kollam's top tourist attractions is this one.

name: 16. Munroe Island:
info: Munroe Island, 26 kilometres from Kollam and located at the intersection of the Astamudi Lake and the Kallada River, is named after the British resident of Travancore, Colonel Munroe. Munroe Island, sometimes referred to as Mundrothuruthu, is a beautiful and majestic inland island well recognized for its unique beauty and stunning views. This undiscovered gem consists of eight islands in total, each of which is divided by a lake or a tiny waterway. By boat, Munroe Island can be reached from Pattomthuruthu and Pezhumthuruthu Islands. Twice daily boat excursions are offered to the island. It is among the best of the well-known locations in Kollam.

name: 17. Kollam Adventure Park:
info: The vast tourist area famous as Picnic Village has the 200-year-old Government Guest House, an Adventure Park, the Tourism Boat Club, the Children's Traffic Park, and the Yatrinivas. The centre of entertainment for people of all ages is next to the government guest house in the Asramam Picnic Village, also known as Adventure Park. Because of the area's picturesque backwaters, tourists may enjoy picnics, luxury boating, and the art museum in Kollam, among other tourist attractions. The adventure park's major attractions include sculptures, an outdoor gym, a mangrove forest, boating, and a British residency.

name: 18. Kottukkal Cave Temple:
info: On the Thiruvananthapuram-Kottayam MC Road, in the Kotthukkal village, is the stunning and tranquil Kottukkal Cave Temple, a rock-cut sanctuary dedicated to Lord Shiva. Kottukal refers to a carved rock, also known as Kothiya Kallu. In Malayalam, the temple is also referred to as Kaltrikkovil. There are two caverns in this temple, the larger of which contains the Nandi Bull and the smaller one, Lord Hanuman. One can observe the idol of Lord Ganapathy between these caves. The temple, a superb example of the rock-cut building common during the sixth and eighth centuries (CE), is revered by both religious worshipers and historians of design.

name: 19. Paravur Lake:
info: One of the well-known lakes in Kollam is Paravur Lake, also known as Paravur Kayal. The shimmering waters are a wonderful sight. Relatively a small lake, it is a great place for visitors to go for a day trip and enjoy the natural beauty. The mangroves that line the lake's edges increase its beauty and attraction. The Priyadarshini Watercraft Club is another prominent site in the Paravur Lake area. The most popular sports around here are swimming and surfing, followed by fishing, which needs permission from the local government. The Puthenkulam Elephant Village and neighbouring Puttingal Temple are the other top attractions in addition to the waters.

name: 20. Kottankulangara Devi Temple:
info: The goddess Durga Bhagavathy, an embodiment of Ma Parvati, is worshipped in the Hindu temple Kottankulangara Devi Temple in Chavara. Its distinctive construction, in which the temple has no ceiling above the sanctuary, fascinates tourists. At the Kottankulangara Festival, the only temple in India executes a special ritual in which males dress as women (annual festival). Many young ladies enter the temple at night in a lengthy procession while holding lit lamps, offering payasam, aravana, and iratti madhuram, as well as jewellery, silks, and other items. This special ritual is known as "Chamaya Vilakku." St. Andrews Church, Kovilthottam Beach & Lighthouse, and other attractions can be found in and near Chavara.

name: 21. Thevally Palace:
info: On the shores of Ashtamude Lake stands Trevally Palace, a location of significant historical significance. Its most distinctive feature is the palace's unique combination of Dutch, English and Portuguese architectural traditions. It will take you to the quaintness of the past. The surrounding lush green coconut plantation and palm trees give this palace's splendour a stunning look. One of Kollam's top historical attractions in this architectural marvel.

name: 22. Oachira:
info: The Oachira, a tourist destination recognized for attracting many tourists, is located on the Kollam-Alappuzha route. The famous Parabrahma temple, devoted to global awareness, is the only deity or idol at this well-known pilgrimage site, making it special. The two biggest yearly festivities are Oachira Kali in mid-June and the twelve-day Panthrandu Vilakku in November/December. The Puranas claim that this magnificent temple is among the most respected and well-known locations in Kerala or even the entire nation.

name: 23. Pathanapuram:
info: Pathanapuram is one of the important trading locations in the Kollam District. Pathanapuram, situated on the edge of the river Kallada, is one of Kollam's well-known tourist destinations. The Chandanakkudam Mahotsavam festival, held in the neighbourhood throughout February and March, is its biggest attraction. Pathanapuram is known for its industrial operations, including brick making and bamboo weaving, as well as certain livestock activities like dairying, poultry, goat, and chicken farming. The real attraction of this location is the growth of rubber and spices.

name: 24. Aryankavu Sastha Temple:
info: One of the 108 Sastha temples in the Indian state of Kerala is the Hindu temple called Aryankavu Sastha Temple. It is one of Lord Ayyappa five Sastha's significant temples in Kerala. The temple is called Ariankavu or Aryankavu because Lord Ayappa is worshipped here in his teenage avatar as Tiru Aryan. The two biggest holidays celebrated here are Mandala Pooja and Tirukalyanam in December. The mural paintings that are hung on the pillars and walls excite visitors. In addition, tourists may visit the Palaruvi waterfalls, which are located 5 kilometres from Aryankavu.

name: 25. Thomas Fort:
info: St. Thomas Fort, commonly known as Thangassery Fort, is situated on Thangassery Beach along the Arabian Sea Shores in the city of Kollam. It is a famous pepper trading hub with a long commercial tradition. The fort remains one of Kollam's most significant archaeological sites, attracting tourists to see the structure and learn more about its earlier commercial relations.

name: 26. Anandavalleeswaram Temple:
info: One of the well-known temples in Kollam is the Anandavalleswaram temple, which is dedicated to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. One of Kerala's oldest temples, it's a fantastic tourist destination.

name: 27. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Police Museum:
info: The Kerala police forces are honoured, and their history and progress are traced in the Sardar Vallabhai Patel Police Museum. The museum has a statue of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, famous as the "Iron Man of India".

name: 28. Chinnakada Clock Tower:
info: The Clock Tower is a well-known landmark in Kollam town and is situated near Chinnakada. The centre of the city of Kollam is recognized as being here. The tower faces the city's four directions and has clocks on every side, attracting tourists because of its unique colonial-era architectural style.

name: 29. Kollam Pooram - Sri Krishna Temple:
info: Every April, Sri Krishna Temple celebrates the well-known 10-day Kollam Pooram festival. The event begins with raising a flag, and the deities of local temples are taken to the Krishna Temple upon 58 gorgeously dressed elephants to offer honour to Lord Krishna. Cherupooram is the name of this ceremony.

name: 30. Rosemala:
info: Rosemala is a well-kept secret in Kerala and is kept in the charming, natural forests of the Shenduruney forests. The valley, situated in the Aryanvaku neighbourhood of the Kollam district, resembles the expanding flowers of a rose, therefore the name.

name: Help Others, Please Share
info: Splunk

name: 1. Eco Cave Garden
info: Eco Caves Garden, known for its interconnected rocky caves, hanging gardens, and musical fountains, is a collection of six animal-shaped caves. You can see a musical fountain with numerous audio-visual effects in the evening. It is situated in Nainital's Mallital district. It is one of the top Nainital tourist attractions that you can visit with family and is especially interesting to children.

name: 2. Mall Road
info: The British built Nainital's Mall Road, formally known as Govind Ballabh Pant Marg. The Nainital Mall Road connects the hill town of Mallital with the two ends of Tallital, the primary shopping, eating, and cultural centre of wonder in Nainital. There are several hotels, showrooms, department stores, and businesses on Mall Road. Restaurants and cafes are available. Mall Road is home to some of the greatest hotels and restaurants in Nainital. During the day, it is one of the busiest and most crowded locations.

name: 3. Tiffin Top
info: Tiffin Top, also known as Dorothy's Seat, is a well-known tourist attraction in Nainital. This is a wonderful picnic area to enjoy a beautiful view of Nainital. Cher, Oak, and Deodar trees cover the beautiful Tiffin Top. When viewed from here, the Naini Lake and the Kumaon hills are lovely. Tiffin Top was called for the restaurant at the top of the hill, Dorothy's Seat. On clear days, the amazing view of Nanda Devi may also be viewed.

name: 4. Nainital Lake
info: Nainital Lake, also known as Naini Lake, is a natural freshwater lake in the Kumaon town of Nainital. Naini Peak in the northwest, Tiffin Point in the southwest, and Nainital Lake in the north, all surrounded by snow-capped hills, offer spectacular vistas, particularly at sunrise and sunset. It is well known for boats, picnics, and night walks. Naini Lake, formerly a lovely lake loved by Europeans, is now a popular tourist attraction for visitors from all over the country.

name: 5. Snow View Point
info: Snow View Point in Nainital, located 2270 meters above sea level, is one of the most famous tourist spots in the region. Snow Picture Point provides a panoramic view of the milky-white Himalayas. A wonderful combination of binoculars has been put at the Snow View Point, allowing you to get up close and personal with the Himalayan ranges and their majestic peaks. A small temple with images of Rama, Sita, Lakshmana, Hanuman, Durga, and Shiva may be found if you look closely.

name: 6. Naina Devi Temple
info: Naina Devi Temple in Nainital is a popular Hindu worship destination and one of India's fifty-one Shakti Peethas. Naina Devi Temple is one of North India's most famous temples. Inside the Naina Devi Temple, the roof has two eyes representing Goddess Naina Devi, with idols of Goddess Kali and Lord Ganesha in between. The best time to visit Naina Devi Temple is during Navratri, which takes place from September to October, Shravani Mela, which takes place from July to August, and Chaitra Mela, which takes place from March to April.

name: 7. Kainchi Dham
info: Kanchi Dham, located on the Nainital-Almora route, is a small ashram and Hanuman temple. Kanchi Dham is another name for Neem Karoli Baba Ashram. This beautiful temple was established by Shri Neem Karoli Baba Maharaj Ji, a Hindu Guru. He was a devotee of Lord Hanuman and was known for performing countless miracles during his life. Sri Maa, Neem Karoli Baba's major disciple, currently oversees the ashram, which is only available to guests while she is present.

name: 8. Naina Peak
info: Naina Peak, at 2615 meters, is the highest point in Nainital. It is a major tourist attraction of the city and is covered in snow all year. There is a beautiful view from the shade of trees above it. From the top of this peak, you can see the Nanda Devi peak and the mountains of Tibet. The well-known location is one of the most popular vacation destinations in Nainital. The landscape of Naina Peak may be viewed from a variety of perspectives. Aside from trekking, guests may also ride a pony to the top of the mountain.

name: 9. Bhimtal Lake
info: Bhimtal Lake is one of India's most well-known lakes, located near the city of Bhimtal in the northern Indian state of Uttarakhand. Bhimtal Lake is the largest lake in the Kumaon region, often known as India's Lake District, and serves as a source of drinking water for the city. The lake has been given access to tourists, and various activities occur in and around it. The area around Bhimtal Lake is carefully maintained and offers a nice experience to everyone who visits. Bhimtal Lake Aquarium is on a tiny island in the heart of Bhimtal Lake's beautiful waters. The aquarium contains roughly 12 huge tanks and a variety of species.

name: 10. Astronomical Observatory
info: If astronomy is something that fascinates you and is on your wishlist, visits the Nainital Astronomical Observatory. The observatory was established on April 20, 1954. On March 22, 2004, the 50-year-old state observatory at Nainital was renamed ARIES, an acronym for Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observation-Sciences, an independent institute under the Government and Department of Science and Technology. The Aryabhata Research Institute of Observational Science is located 9 kilometres south of the city on Manora Peak, 1951, meters above sea level. Visitors to this Nainital site may observe the Moon, stars, and other celestial bodies through four powerful telescopes. Plan a time window and seek permission from the authorities before visiting this place.

name: 11. Hanuman Garhi
info: About 3.5 kilometres from Nainital. Baba Neem Karoli Ji founded the Hanuman Garhi temple in 1950 AD, which is around 1,951 meters (6,400 feet) above sea level. Along with Hanuman Ji, there are monuments of many other gods and goddesses at the Hanuman Garhi temple, the names of which are mentioned are- Lord Rama, Mata Sita, Shri Krishna Bhagwan, Radha, Lord Shiva, Maa Durga, Sai Baba, Neem Karoli Baba, Vaishno Devi, Mouni Mai, and Shani Dev, among others, are worshipped in the Hanuman Garhi temple.

name: 12. Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple
info: Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple is located in the Nainital district, at the highest point of Mukteshwar city in the Kumaon mountains, at approximately 7,595 feet (2,315 meters above sea level). Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple had a 350-year history when it was known as Lord Shiva, but it is now known as Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple or Mukteshwar Temple. To get the darshan of Lord Shiva built in Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple, you must climb around 100 stairs.

name: 13. Bhimeshwar Mahadev Temple
info: Bhimeshwar Mahadev Temple is located around 22 kilometres from Nainital, Uttarakhand. It is situated on the borders of Bhimtal Lake. People believe that Bhima, the most powerful of the Pandavas, established this temple of Lord Shiva after performing penance to Lord Shiva for his clan's name to be remembered for ages. Throughout the year, people go to the temple of Lord Shiva.

name: 14. Jim Corbett National Park
info: Jim Corbett National Park, in Nainital in Uttarakhand, was established in 1936 to save the Bengal Tiger. When Jim Corbett National Park was established in 1936, it was named "Haley National Park." After that, it was renamed Ramganga in 1952 and Jim Corbett National Park in 1956, and this national park was renamed after the hunter and naturalist Jim Corbett

name: 15. Khurpatal
info: A Khurpatal is also located near Nainital. It is 10 kilometres from Nainital. This lovely little suburb (Khera) is 1635 meters above sea level. The natural beauty of this location captivates everyone. The beautiful lake, surrounding houses, and hotels add to this beauty. Khurpat was famous for producing iron tools until the nineteenth century, but it is now famous for green vegetables.

name: How to Reach Nainital
info: Many different types of Indian food can be found in Nainital, but the most well-known dish in Raas, which is a dish composed of several dishes.

name: Famous Food in Nainital
info: Many different types of Indian food can be found in Nainital, but the most well-known dish in Raas, which is a dish composed of several dishes.

name: Best Time to Visit Nainital
info: Although tourists can visit Nainital at any time of year, the best time is during the summer, when most of the country experiences serious heat. That is why people like to visit Nainital to avoid the heat. Aside from that, those interested in seeing the snowy environment should visit Nainital between December and February.

info: Splunk

name: 1. Govind Deo Temple
info: The Govind Deo Temple also called Govind Dev Ji Temple. It is a mile away from the Vrindavan Railway Station.

name: 2. Prem Mandir
info: One of Vrindavan's largest temples, the Prem Mandir, which is also called the temple of love, is dedicated to the purest form of love of Lord Krishna and Goddess Radha. The foundation stone for the temple was laid in 2001, and the community officially opened it in 2012. This enormous temple's construction cost approximately INR 150 crores. Fifty-four acres of land make up the vast Prem Mandir property.

name: 3. Kesi Ghat
info: One of the most significant ghats in the region is Kesi Ghat, located on the Yamuna's bank. This is one of the locations that both tourists and religious adherents attend quite early in the morning. This is among the most unusual places to visit in Vrindavan since it is believed that Lord Krishna bathed in the Yamuna after killing the demon, Keshi. While the river flows in front, the enormous Madanmohan Temple at the rear gives a stunning backdrop. A boat ride is another option available here.

name: 4. Banke Bihari Temple
info: The Banke Bihari Temple, devoted to the worship of Lord Krishna, is one of the top sights to view in Vrindavan. It is a popular destination for visitors, residents and devotees. People from all walks of life frequently visit it throughout the year. One of the seven renowned temples of the "Thakur of Vrindavan" is the Banke Bihari Temple.

name: 5. Nidhivan
info: In Vrindavan, there is a lovely large garden called Nidhivan, also known as Seva Kunj. It is one of Vrindavan's most revered tourist destinations. Due to the numerous tales associated with this location, it is crowded with people all year round. People think that the Rasa Leela is performed every night in the same garden by Radha and Krishna.

name: 6. ISKCON Temple, Vrindavan
info: One of the most well-known temples in India is ISKCON, Vrindavan. One other title for this temple is the Krishna Balaram Mandir. This temple was constructed in 1975. The temple was built to inform people about the Vedic and the Gita.

name: 7. Sri Radha Damodar Temple
info: The Sri Radha Damodar Temple in Loi Bazaar, adjacent to Seva Kunj, is one of Vrindavan's most exquisite tourist destinations. A Guru named SrilaJiva Goswami built the temple in 1542. The gods revered in the Damodar Mandir were a gift from Srila Rupa Goswami Prabhupada to SrilaJiva. The idols were moved to Jaipur in 1739 after Aurangzeb's invasion, which caused major damage to this temple.

name: 8. Seva Kunj
info: Seva Kunj tells the fascinating stories of Krishan and Radha. It is said that Radharani and Krishna ji used to frequently visit this place and spend hours together. There are various sculptures of Lord Krishna and Radha, mostly on pillars of Seva Kunj, a sizable temple with a domed design. The gates of Seva Kunj are only open during the day and close at sunset. As soon as visitors arrive, they can gaze upon its Lalit Kunj and Nikunj temple, situated in the centre of the temple. Couples love Seva Kunj because it offers a spiritual perspective on the lovely relationship between Lord Krishna and Radha, making it one of the most popular places to visit in Vrindavan. In addition to residents, the region draws a sizable number of tourists from around the world.

name: 9. Pagal Baba Temple
info: The lovely and amazing Pagal Baba Temple is three kilometres away from the Vrindavan Railway Station, on the Mathura-Vrindavan Road. This is one of the most significant temples in Vrindavan. Pagal Baba, a saint, constructed this temple and devoted it to Lord Krishna. According to the legend, Sheela Nand Ji was a magistrate in the Constitutional Court of Calcutta who left his position to visit Vrindavan in search of spirituality. Since he was acting insanely, people began to refer to him as Pagal Baba. Then he subsequently got the support of his followers and constructed this exquisite temple in Vrindavan.

name: 10. Madan Mohan Temple
info: Madan Mohan Shrine, called Sri Radha Madan Mohan Temple, is the oldest temple in Vrindavan. It is 50 feet tall and situated on Dwadasa Aditya hill, which overlooks the Yamuna River, close to Kaliya Ghat. In addition to Madana Mohan, Radha and Lalita Sakhi are worshipped here. The view of Vrindavan is stunning from the temple. Lord Krishna is reported to have taken a nap at this temple following his victory over Kaliya Naag.

name: 11. Nandgaon
info: Nandgaon is a small, charming town with significant religious significance. It is located at the foot of Nandishwara Hill and is 50 kilometres from Mathura and 8 kilometres from Barsana. Hindu tourists revere the village because it is thought to be the birthplace of Shri Nandji and Yashoda Maiyya, Lord Krishna's foster parents. On top of the hill is also a sizable temple devoted to Shri Nandji.

name: 12. Shahji Temple
info: Shah Kundan Lal constructed the Lord Krishna-dedicated Shahji Temple in 1876. The name of the main deity in this place is Chhote Radha Raman. Its magnificent marble structure has the Basanti Kamra, a hallway with Belgian crystal chandeliers and exquisite murals, as well as twelve imposing spiral columns, each 15 feet tall. Tourists and religious pilgrims come to Shahji Temple to admire its stunning architecture.

name: 13. Sri Ashta Sakhi Temple
info: Lord Krishna, Radha, and their eight friends are honoured in this temple. This was the one where Lord Krishna is said to have performed his Ras Leela. This temple's design and craftsmanship are as stunning as its tenets.

name: 14. Vrinda Kunj
info: Beautiful plants and trees line all sides of Vrinda Kunj. The presence of flora only enhances the temple's splendour, elevating it to the status of one of the most popular tourist destinations in Vrindavan. You can participate in pooja, arti, and lectures from the Mahabharata while you're here.

name: Conclusion
info: Wake up to the sound of the early bells and prayers being said in the exquisite temples of the town. The stories of Krishna and Radha still strongly resonate in this location, and a mystical aura permeates it year-round.

info: Splunk

name: 1. Colombo
info: Colombo, which is situated on the country's west coast, is the capital city of Sri Lanka. This city's skyline, which is situated along Beira Lake and comes to life at night, is stunning and magnificent. There are numerous skyscrapers structures in Colombo, but the Lotus Tower, which rises 350 meters, is one of the nicest. The Lotus Tower is also regarded as the tallest structure in southern Asia. Tourists find it appealing since the building is illuminated for the festivities. While enjoying a meal at the rotating restaurant, the tourists find the location to be attractive. This city also has a few important temples that are worth visiting, such as the Buddhist temple Gangaramaya Vihara, which is not far from Beira Lake and has several impressive buildings with a blend of Indian, Chinese, and Sri Lankan architectural styles. Additionally, this city is home to Mount Lavinia Beach and its hotel, which served as the former British colonial governor of Sri Lanka's beachside mansion.

name: 2. Kandy
info: Prior to the colonial era, Kandy served as the primary capital of the Sri Lankan imperial kingdom. This city tells the tale of the country's history and experiences. Kandy, which is in the middle of Sri Lanka, is encircled by mountains that are the site of several tea gardens. The period between the 15th and the 18th centuries is referred to as the Kandian age, and it was during this time that the region reached its zenith, remaining autonomous while European forces invaded the majority of the coastal districts. The best way to explore Kandy is to learn about its history through relics and illustrations by the National Museum of Kandy itself.

name: 3. Galle
info: Galle is a city that can be reached from Colombo in about two hours via the nation's first advanced superhighways. The Galle Fort, a sizable seaside fort in this city, is a fully maintained fortified town from the 17th century.

name: 4. Adam's Rock
info: Another stunning site with a cone-shaped summit that is primarily a devotional trail is the Adams rock. Early in the morning, pilgrims make the 3-hour or so ascent to the hill's summit solely to see the dawn. It is a popular Buddhist pilgrimage path since it is said that Buddha's real footprint can be found close to the peak. However, a few assert that it is the imprint of Lord Shiva, while others assert that it is that of Adams. The months of December through May are the ideal season to visit this location.

name: 5. Jaffna
info: Spend a couple of days taking in the ambiance of Jaffna, which is off the beaten path for tourists if you happen to be in Sri Lanka's northernmost region. The temple Nallur Kovil is a brilliant option among Sri Lanka's major attractions, despite being quite packed.

name: 6. Yala National Park
info: The Yala National Park is situated on Sri Lanka's southernmost coast. The most prominent fauna here are elephants, monkeys, wild cats, leopards, and birds. This park is one of the top tourist destinations since it is home to the most leopards in the entire globe. It also acts as an excellent habitat for Sri Lankan elephants and aquatic birds.

name: 7. Anuradhapura
info: One of Sri Lanka's former capitals, Anuradhapura, among the oldest inhabited settlements in the world, is well-known for the Bodhi Tree, the remains of the Sinhala civilization, and other ancient and sacred structures that are located nearby. After being captured in the late 10th century, this majestic city of palaces, monasteries, and monuments, which had existed for 1,300 years, was deserted.

name: 8. Nuwara Eliya
info: Given that Sri Lanka is well known for its tea, the origin of tea, Nuwara Eliya, is the best spot to learn more about it. Nuwara Eliya, which is at the height of 1,900 meters (6,100 feet) and has a temperate atmosphere, is where the majority of the nation's tea is produced.

name: 9. Sigiriya
info: The enormous rock that has a distinctive structure and thus attracts visitors is situated in the island's center, close to the town of Dambulla. This is among the major sites to explore in Sri Lanka if one likes art, architecture, and history.

name: 10. Bentota Beach
info: The well-known and attractive Bentota beach is situated on the Southwest coast, 65 kilometers from Colombo. This is the ideal location for one to explore in Sri Lanka if they are seeking to relax in the warm sun or are up for some daring water activities like snorkeling. Bentota attracts visitors due to its breathtakingly picturesque sundown. Visitors can take a plunge in the warm water or enjoy a boat trip on the river. The ideal months to visit Bentota Beach are from October to March since these are the best months for participating in water sports.
