name: 1. Pokhara
info: This city is known as the 'Tourist Capital of Nepal'. In this Himalayan country, it is the second-largest city. The Lakeside Pokhara and Old Pokhara, which are also the city's economic centres, have a variety of exquisite medieval temples that create a lovely contrast in the city. Pokhara is a famous trek spot for adventure seekers. The old Pokhara has many shops from where tourists can buy famous woodwork, handicrafts, and woolwork items. The Tibetan Mini Market is a famous market in Pokhara.

name: 2. Janakpur
info: It is thought that Goddess Sita was born in Janakpur. The City of Ponds is another name for this place. There are more than 70 ponds in Janakpur. Here, visitors can learn more about the Ramayana, which is a famous and revered Hindu epic. This city is situated in Nepal's Terai region. The Ram Janaki Temple is Janakpur's major tourist destination. The good weather, the lavish and colourful festivals celebrated throughout the year, the magnificent temple architecture, and the friendly residents make Janakpur a popular destination for tourists and pilgrims.

name: 3. Chitlang
info: This is an ancient Newar-dominated village in Nepal. This historic village is encircled by the Chandragiri hills. The best hiking location from Kathmandu is Chitlang. More than 100 different bird species are found here and making it an ornithologist's paradise. A small antique temple with historical remnants is situated on the main road. The town's hiking paths and cable car offer not only challenging adventures but also magnificent views of the valleys and mountains nearby.

name: 4. Nagarkot
info: It is only 28-kilometre from Kathmandu. Nagarkot is a beautiful hill station. Nagarkot's area provides breathtaking views of eight Himalayan Ranges. For serenity seekers, hikers or adventure seekers, it is heaven. To experience a real nature vacation on a budget, this place offers many affordable homestays.

name: 5. Kathmandu
info: Nepal's capital and most popular tourist destination are Kathmandu. Kathmandu has golden pagodas, ancient temples, fascinating villages and natural beauty. The meeting point of the Vishnumati and Bagmati rivers is in Kathmandu. Kathmandu has many shops from where tourists can buy famous Nepali paper prints, handicrafts, and carpets. The best place to start exploring Nepal is Kathmandu.

name: 6. Bhaktapur
info: One of the 3 mediaeval towns in the Kathmandu Valley is Bhaktapur. This city is frequently referred to as Bhadgaon and Khwopa and has a combination of Buddhist and Hindu residents. This city is nearly 12 kilometres from Kathmandu. This town is split into 3 squares, each of which contains numerous temples and other religious buildings. Visitors must pay an NPR 1500 entry fee in order to enter this town. This fund is used for the maintenance of Bhaktapur's temples.

name: 7. Patan
info: The third-largest city in Nepal is Patan. The present name of this town is Lalitpur. Both names of this town derived from the Sanskrit word "Lalitapattan". The Durbar Square in Patan is home to numerous monuments, temples, and palaces. There is a "Patan museum" at Durbar Square as well. This town is a traditional hub for handicrafts and a famous place to buy Buddha statues, traditional jewellery and masks. There is a shrine of the god Krishna in this town, and this shrine architecture is inspired by the Buddhist Dharma-Chakra philosophy.

name: 8. Birgunj
info: This city is located close to the Bihar's border. It serves as a key entrance point for Indian products trade. Ghadiarwa Pond is a well-known tourist destination in Birgunj. It is a favourite hangout place for youngsters in Nepal.

name: 9. Dharan
info: Dharan is a beautiful city situated near India's southeast border. The entrance to the Mahabharata Hills is at Dharan. It is a multi-cultural city and also the football centre of Nepal. It is a well-known tourist destination in Nepal because of its breathtaking natural scenery and interesting activities like trekking, picnicking, hiking, golf, night parties, etc.

name: 10. Lumbini
info: The birthplace of Lord Buddha is the city of Lumbini. People from all around the world travel to this centre of Buddhism to practise yoga, find inner peace, study the scriptures, trek, and meditate. The meaning of "Lumbini" in Sanskrit is "The lovely". Every monastery has a unique architectural style with a lovely exterior and paintings. Many nations have monasteries in Lumbini, including China, Japan, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Germany, and France. The most significant and spiritual site in the area is the Mayadevi Temple. It houses the real birthplace of Lord Buddha.

name: 11. Bandipur
info: Bandipur is known for its pristine beauty and friendly people. Bandipur is a lovely town located atop a hill in the Himalayan foothills. Bandipur is among the most picturesque towns in Nepal since it has managed to preserve its distinctive history and culture over time in addition to its natural beauty. The town is known for its breathtaking countryside walks and local sports, including rappelling, biking, mountain climbing, trekking, and hiking, as well as its cafes, restaurants, and hotels. Bandipur also offers a breath-taking view of the Himalayas. Tourists can experience tranquillity in the town away from the hectic pace of the city by exploring the historic temples or walking through the beautiful backstreets.

name: Best Time to Visit Shimla
info: Shimla is at its most enjoyable in around March and June, when temperatures vary from 15 to 30 degrees Celsius. The winter season of November to February is the ideal time to see snowfall in Shimla. It is the perfect time to enjoy snow-covered sports like ice skating and discover the area. Shimla experiences rising tourists throughout the year, except for the monsoon season from July to September.

name: Famous Food of Shimla
info: Shimla is one of India's most stunning hill towns and is a must-visit location when planning a trip to Himachal Pradesh. In addition to all these things, Himachal Pradesh's capital city is renowned for its delectable Himachali food, a delicious fusion of Tibetan and Punjabi food. In Himachal, most of the diet comprises wheat bread, lentils, pulses, rice, and red meat. The food is primarily nutritious as well as rich and flavorful. Shimla offers a wide variety of delectable cuisine, from street sellers to fine restaurants and traditional cafés.

name: Way To Reach Shimla
info: The capital of Himachal Pradesh, Shimla, is one of the most stunning tourist spots in the nation and is home to many magnificent landmarks. Shimla is so unique that visitors rush to all the hill towns all year, making it impossible to escape the crowds. The first thing that comes to mind while planning a trip to Shimla is how effortlessly Shimla can be accessed by air, rail, and road.

name: 1. Junagarh Fort
info: Raja Rai Singh constructed Junagarh Fort in 1593. The fort's structure is made up of palaces and temples. The exquisitely designed gardens, lawns, and windows draw visitors' attention. The Zenana quarters are a popular attraction here because of their stunning designs of incredible creativity.

name: 2. Karni Mata Temple
info: Karni Mata Temple is a famous place of worship in Bikaner. This Temple is famous for its huge population of rats, which remain permanent inhabitants. The sanctuary dates back to the 15th century and is dedicated to Karni Mata, Goddess Durga's incarnation.According to legend, Karni Mata's son died after drowning in a pond from which he intended to drink water. Then, Karni Mata asked Yama, the god of death, to revive her child. At first, he refused, but afterward, he relented. He said that her son and all of her male children would be reincarnated as rats.

name: 3. Gajner Palace
info: Gajner Palace is among the most visited tourist attractions in Bikaner. It is a lakeside palace with a sanctuary adjacent to it. The palace was erected by Maharaja Ganga Singh Ji, an earlier ruler of Bikaner province. Gajner Palace was used for hunting purposes and was a holiday lodge in the past times. It has now been converted into a heritage hotel.The red sandstone structure is a perfect example of skillful craftsmanship. Beautifully sculpted and intricately designed pillars, jharokhas, and screens are prime features of the palace.

name: 4. Lalgarh Palace
info: Another architectural marvel within Bikaner is the Lalgarh Palace. The marvelous palace was constructed under Maharaja Ganga Singh. The palace has been modified into an opulent hotel and is a great spot to spend your time. The lavish Rajputana design, paired with the exquisite interior design, draws guests to this place.

name: 5. Rampuria Haveli
info: Havelis of Bikaner are not only an aesthetic delight but a wonderful illustration of the exquisite aesthetics that our forefathers had entrusted to us. They are stunningly beautiful. The wealthy merchants of Bikaner built Rampuria Havelis over about a hundred years. The Havelis of Bikaner take us back to the ancestral times. These Havelis are one of the top places to visit in Bikaner within a single day. And when you see the awe-inspiring splendor and beauty of its architecture, it feels like you are transported back by many years.

name: 6. Bikaner Camel Festival
info: Bikaner's Camel festival is an annual event that draws many visitors to the beautiful sands in the Thar Desert. The festival is organized by the Department of Tourism (Rajasthan) and is a tribute to the sturdy desert animals, specifically the camel.

name: 7. Bhandasar Jain Temple
info: One of the two of Bikaner's most renowned Jain temples, Bhandasar Temple is considered one of the most beautiful places to go to in Bikaner. It is decorated with yellow stone carvings as well as vivid paintings. The inside of the Temple is remarkable, with the murals on the wall and the pillars. The walls are decorated with beautiful floral arabesques of 24 Jain teachers.

name: 8. Royal Cenotaphs, Devikund Sagar
info: The top destinations to visit in Bikaner surely contains this name- Devi Kund Sagar. It is a well-known place since it is the cremation site of people of the ruling family of Bikaner following Jet Singh, the great-grandson of Rao Bikaji. The cenotaphs have been erected as a token of tribute to them. There is a pond with royal cenotaphs of the Bikaner dynasty rulers ranging from Rao Kalyan Singhji through Maharaja Karni Singh, on either side; Cenotaphs or chhatris of 22 Cities belonging to the family of royals before Maharaja Gaj Singh. His cenotaph is also present.

name: 9. Gajner Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Gajner Wildlife Sanctuary is a fantastic spot to experience the natural habitat and wildlife. The sanctuary is home to a variety of animals, such as Chinkara (Black Buck), wild boar, Nilgai, Antelopes, and many more. It is one of the most popular Bikaner tourist spots and is situated at a distance of 32 kilometers from Bikaner.

name: 10. Sadul Singh Museum
info: Sadul Singh Museum is among the most important historical sites to see in Bikaner. It was established in 1972. The museum features an amazing collection of Georgian paintings, hunting trophies, and other rare artifacts.

name: 11. G. Road
info: Another worth-visiting place in Bikaner is the M.G. Road, also known across the nation by the name Mahatma Gandhi Road. It is among the top locations in Bikaner to go on a shopping spree.

name: 12. Camel Safari
info: Camel safaris in Bikaner have become a major tourist attraction since it enables you to traverse the gorgeous sand dunes of the Thar Desert sitting on the back of the 'king of the deserts'-the camel. The region has extreme temperatures during the winter months and summer. Safaris tend to happen near sunrise and sunset as the sand is comparatively cooler. Bikaner is an old city, with numerous structures and temples serving as reminders of the transitions that have occurred through history and how the families adapted to them. Safaris are a wonderful experience that you should definitely take if you visit Bikaner. There are a variety of packages to go on safaris to suit your needs.

name: 13. Sursagar Lake
info: One of the best tourist destinations in Bikaner that you should definitely check out is Sursagar Lake. It is an artificial lake that was built under Maharaja Sur Singh during his reign to alleviate water shortages. Sursagar Lake is one of the most popular sights in the city.

name: 14. Laxmi Niwas Palace
info: This palace stands as an epitome of opulence and grandiosity. It was built between 1898 and 1902 by Sir Samuel Swinton, a British Architect. It was the former place of residence of the king of Bikaner, Maharaja Ganga Singh. But now it has been transformed into a luxurious hotel. Having 45 deluxe rooms and 12 royal suites, it has an Indo-Saracenic architectural style. There is a garden that regularly hosts puppet shows and musical performances for the guests. One can also find a museum that depicts the various aspects of the lives of Rajputana Kings. It is truly a great place to stay!

name: 1. Devikulam Echo Point, Munnar
info: Devikulam, a hill station around 7 kilometres from Munnar that is recognized for its lovely natural environment, is one of the top Tourist attractions of Munnar. The place has a beautiful and enchanting lake, the Sita Devi Lake. Here, tourists come every year to enjoy the tranquillity and serenity of the lake, offering its seekers the option for activities like boating and Fishing.

name: 2. Anamudi Peak
info: The beautiful mountain needs no introduction as it resembles an elephant; hence it is called Anamudi Peak. Standing at around 2700 meters, it is one of South India's highest peaks and beautiful scenery. To your knowledge, Anamudi means "Elephants forehead" in the local language, which is why this mountain is named Anamudi Peak.

name: 3. Rose Garden
info: Munnar's Rose Garden is spread across 2 acres of land and is packed with various flora, spices, and crops.

name: 4. Marayoor Dolmens
info: Experience the captivating allure of Marayoor Dolmens in Munnar, where history unfolds. Nestled amidst the picturesque landscapes of Munnar, these extraordinary ancient stone structures stand as silent witnesses to the passage of time, spanning thousands of years. As you enter this realm of antiquity, a sense of wonder envelops you, and you are transported back to a bygone era.

name: 5. Tea Museum
info: Entertain and compel yourself with the best tea as your wish and add flavours and taste with the iconic idea of the Tata tea museum. The museum offers specific iconic methods to bring together the taste of essence and the breathtaking flavour of the tea. This museum is iconic as it only provides tea as its product or showcase and entails the comers' stories of different times.

name: 6. Mattupetty Dam
info: Mattupetty Dam, situated in the enchanting town of Munnar, is a highly sought-after tourist attraction. Nestled amidst majestic hills, this picturesque Dam offers breathtaking views that leave visitors in awe. It serves as a remarkable sight and provides various recreational activities to enjoy. Visitors can partake in exhilarating water sports such as water scooters, jet skis, and speed boats, adding excitement to their visit.

name: 7. Carmelagiri Botanical Garden
info: Munnar's Carmelagiri Botanical Garden is a popular tourist attraction. To enter, you must first obtain a ticket. This is South India's largest cactus garden. You may view several types of trees and plants here. You may view several species of cacti here. You may also view handcrafted cacti. Many plants with patterns may be seen here, which are pretty lovely.

name: 8. Attukkad Falls
info: Attukkad Falls is a popular natural tourist attraction in Munnar. A beautiful waterfall is what you'll find when you arrive here. This waterfall cascades over the rocks and is visually appealing. You can view the gorgeous surroundings all around the waterfall. Here you may view various little waterfalls that run in multiple directions. Lovely tea gardens may also be found here.

name: 9. Nayamakada Waterfall Munnar
info: In Munnar, the Nayamakada Waterfall is a well-liked natural tourist destination. This waterfall is truly breathtaking.

name: 10. Kundala Dam in Munnar
info: Kundala Dam in Munnar is a scenic marvel nestled amidst Kerala's breathtaking landscapes and tourist places. With its panoramic views, serene ambience, and pristine surroundings, Kundala Dam is a must-visit tourist place for nature enthusiasts. Located just a few kilometres from the town centre, the Dam offers easy accessibility for tourists.

name: 11. Eravikulam National Park
info: Eravikulam National Park is a breathtaking wilderness nestled in the scenic landscapes of Munnar, Kerala. Known for its rich biodiversity and stunning vistas, Eravikulam National Park offers a remarkable experience for nature enthusiasts and wildlife lovers. With its diverse flora and fauna, including the endangered Nilgiri Tahr, this park is a haven for ecotourism and adventure.

name: 12. CSI Christ Church
info: The CSI Christchurch is a significant landmark in the Munnar district. It is a Christian religious site. This church is both lovely and historic. The Britishers erected this chapel in 1910. This church is designed in the Gothic style and is quite beautiful. You'll find this church in the centre of the Munnar Hill resort. Christ Church is constructed of limestone. Outside the church, you may see several graveyards.

name: 13. Blossom Hydel Park
info: Blossom Hydel Park is a popular tourist attraction in Munnar. A lovely park may be found here. This park is loaded with colourful flowers. There are other animal statues to be found. There are statues of elephants, zebras, giraffes, and lions that are both gorgeous and lifelike. Inside the park, you can also visit the fish house, which houses several varieties of fish. There is a little pond nearby where you may see lotus blossoms. There is a watch tower nearby from which you may visit the magnificent view. This park charges a fee to access. More adventure activities are available here, which is a lot of fun.

name: 14. Pothamedu View Point
info: In Munnar, Pothamedu View Point is a well-known tourist attraction. The lovely view of Kanan Dewan Hill can be seen from here. From here, you can view the rather beautiful tea gardens. Tea, coffee, and spice farms may be seen here. You may also watch a lovely sunset if you come here. This location is terrific.

name: 15. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary
info: Dr. Salim Ali, often known as the "Birdman of India," founded the Dr Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary, one of Munnar's main attractions. It has a 25 sq. km. area in the Western Ghats' foothills. It is asserted that this area, also known as the Thattak Bird Sanctuary, has peninsular India's richest bird habitat. The crimson-throated barbet, sunbird, bee-eater, night heron, black-winged kite, and other birds may be found here. Bird watching may become addicting. There is no going back once you've seen this beauty. You desire to see more.

name: How to Reach Munnar
info: If you are flying to Munnar Hill Station, please be aware that the town does not have an airport. If you prefer to fly, the closest airport to Munnar is Cochin International Airport, which is around 110 kilometers away. You may use this to get to Cochin and then take a local bus or taxi to Munnar.

name: Famous Local Food of Munnar
info: Munnar Hill Station attracts visitors with delicious meals. Idli, Vada, Sambar, and Banana Chips are the most popular local foods here. In addition, the cardamom tea served here is delicious. After eating the native dish, you'll be licking your fingers.

name: Best Time to Visit Munnar
info: Before going on your vacation to Munnar Hill Station, you must determine the best time to visit Munnar. We believe the best time to visit Munnar is between June and September. Even if you wish to avoid the rain, this is the most fantastic time to visit Munnar.

name: 1. Bhangarh Fort
info: Bhangarh fort is located amidst the Aravalli range, and it falls on the border of Sariska reserve. This Fort city is famous for its historical ruins and the legends of ghosts. Bhangarh is popularly viewed as one of the spookiest places in the entire country. Bhangarh Fort is a 17th Century fort located in Rajasthan's Alwar district. Bhagwant Das constructed it in honour of the son of his Madho Singh I. Later on, Madho Singh named this fort 'Bhangarh' after his grandfather's name- Man Singh or Bhan Singh.

name: 2. Bala Quila Fort
info: Bala Quila Fort, also known as the Alwar Fort, is located in the Aravalli ranges. Its construction took place in the 15th Century under Hasan Khan Mewati. Since then, it has been administrated by various kingdoms, including the Marathas, the Yadavas, and the Kachwaha Rajputs. 'Bala Quila' translates to 'Young Fort'. The only metalled road connecting the fort to the city of Alwar is the 'Laxman Pole'. Silver pages in history declare that Pratap Singh, the founder of the Alwar state, could only enter the Fort via this route.

name: 3. Siliserh Lake Palace
info: Siliserh Lake Palace is situated on the border of Siliserh lake, a serene water body overlooking the mountain range of Aravalli. This impressive tourist attraction is spread over an area of 7 square kilometres. Alwar was once a Rajput state that was previously named Mewat. This stunning palace was built in 1845 by the ruler of Alwar, Maharaja Vinay Singh, along the banks of Siliserh Lake for his beloved wife, Shila. This Palace was initially constructed as a lodge for the royal family for hunting purposes and for residing. Later, it was transformed into a palace.

name: 4. Sariska National Park
info: Sariska National Park, or the Sariska Tiger Reserve, is spread over an area of 881 square kilometres, covered with deciduous forests, cliffs, grasslands and rocky landscapes. In the past, the Maharaja of Alwar used this place as his hunting ground. After the enactment of the Wildlife Protection Act in 1972 and Project Tiger in 1973, this region was declared a Wildlife Sanctuary in 1958 and a National Park in 1982. It is mainly home to the endangered species of Royal Bengal Tigers. Still, a variety of other animals, including leopard, sambhar, chital, nilgai, four-horned antelope, hyena, and jungle cats, can be found here. Out of the total 211 bird species that have been recorded in reserve, 120 are residents, 73 are migrants, and 18 are considered to be vagrants. Peafowl, white-rumped vulture, grey francolin, Aravalli red spurfowl, painted spurfowl etc, make up the avian population of this region.

name: 5. Moti Dungri
info: The water of communal hatred has not yet infiltrated the soil of this place. It is one of the rare shrines in India where Hindus and Muslims worship together. On the one hand, is the Sankat Mochan Vir Hanuman Mandir, and on the other, Sayyed Darbar. There is no wall separation between the two. One can hear the air filled with soothing Bhajans on Thursday mornings while the evenings mesmerise everyone with Qawwalis. The fragrances of camphor, ghee and lobaan are infused together. The unfurling of Saffron, Green and Tricolour flags together reminds everyone of how there is strength in unity. It is indeed a delightful sight!

name: 6. City Palace, Alwar
info: This magnificent Fort was built in the 18th Century and is located at the foothills of the Aravalli mountains, just below Bala Quila. The architecture here is a blend of Rajput and Mughal designs. An artificial lake is located near City Palace. Maharaja Vinay Singh constructed it in 1815. Vinay Vilas Mahal is home to an elevated pavilion shaped like a door which illustrates the Rajput kingdoms' pride and honour.

name: 7. Hill Fort-Kesroli
info: Kesroli Hill Fort was constructed in the 14th Century by Yaduvanshi Rajputs. Since then, it has been conquered by Mughals, Jats and finally, the Rajputs. The Fort is now a 31-room heritage hotel with turrets, ramparts and beautiful verandahs. The Neemrana group of hotels manages it. Being one of the best heritage hotels in India, this is surely an amazing destination for a weekend getaway and more. The Rajasthani décor in the rooms would transport you to the royal times, giving you princely vibes. Also, the place offers you a beautiful garden where you can sit and relax, enjoying the charm of the Palace. There is a terrace pool with sundecks from where you can have the most exotic view of the surrounding mustard fields and Aravalli hills.

name: 8. Vijay Mandir Palace
info: Maharaja Jai Singh Prabhakar built this Palace in 1918 as his royal residence. His passion for art and architecture is evident in this splendid Palace. It is situated at a distance of approximately 9 kilometres from the centre of Alwar city. Comprising 105 rooms which are well-ornamental, this Palace is surrounded by flourishing green gardens and a picturesque lake. There is a Sita-Ram Temple on the palace premises that devotees visit throughout the year. However, it remains the most crowded at the time of Ramnavami. The total time to explore this place is about 1-2 hours. Although there is no entry fee, one needs prior permission from the Maharaja of Alwar, who resides in New Delhi.

name: 9. Rani Moosi Ki Chhatri
info: It is Raja Bakhtawar Singh and Rani Moosi's cenotaph. With its graceful sandstone formations and canopies made of white marble, it sets a wonderful example of 19th-century Rajputana architecture. It was built in 1815 by Vinay Singh as a tribute to the late king and his queen. The tomb is named after the queen probably because she committed 'Sati' (self-immolation) on her husband's pyre, which was considered heroic and brave in those times. However, the practice of 'Sati' was abolished later.

name: 10. Tomb of Fateh Jang
info: The tomb of Fateh Jang or Fateh Jang ki Gumbad was constructed in 1647 by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of Fateh Jang, a minister at his court. We all know the splendid monuments built by Shah Jahan during his thirty-year as the Mughal Emperor, including the Taj Mahal, Red Fort and Jama Masjid. His immense love for architecture, detail and design can be seen in the Tomb of Fateh Jang. It speaks highly of his virtuosity.

name: 11. Sarafa Bazar
info: Obsessed with intricately-designed Rajasthani jewellery? We have the perfect place for you- SARAFA BAZAR. The marketplace is well-known as a hub for special pieces of jewellery, including diamonds, semi-treasured stones, and treasured stones. For all of you who like to level up your style by pairing your clothes with accessories, especially jewellery, Sarafa Bazaar is one of the key locations to look at in Alwar. The market road is dotted with several showrooms where affordable, and good-quality jewellery can be easily found. The market is open from 11 a.m. to 9.30 p.m.

name: 12. Garbhaji Waterfalls
info: There is rarely anyone who doesn't love waterfalls, and finding waterfalls in Rajasthan is even rarer. Garbhaji waterfall is an exceptional sight located at a distance of 15 kilometres from the city centre of Alwar. Surrounded by forest and set in the lap of Aravalli Canal, this is truly a naturally serene place. The mesmerising cascade of bubbling water tumbling through rugged terrain beneath several boulders into a clearing is a sight to behold and speaks for itself. Garbhaji Falls is a perfect getaway for those looking for romance amidst nature and an ideal place for families to have picnics and relax and unwind. Frequented by photographers and nature lovers, this dazzling waterfall attracts tourists from places far and wide.

name: 1. Manali
info: One of Himachal's most well-known hill stations, Manali, offers breathtaking vistas of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges, which are mostly always covered in snow. For a long time, young people looking for work have made Manali a favorite destination. These individuals choose Old Manali for its tranquil cafés, reliable Wi-Fi, little restaurants, and handy shopping. Several accommodation facilities and dormitories provide reasonably priced dorm beds for extended stays.

name: 2. Shimla
info: As the "Queen of Hills," Shimla, a major tourist attraction in the north-western Himalayas, is frequently referred to. With remarkable neo-gothic buildings surrounded by thick forest and breathtaking views, it still exhibits the vibrant colonial history that gave it a distinct personality from the rest of India.

name: 3. Goa
info: One of the most well-known and beautiful places to visit in India, the renowned gorgeous party venue is not to be missed. Please visit most of Goa's stunning beaches while you're in Goa; and it is the smallest state in India.

name: 4. Varanasi
info: The oldest continuously inhabited city in the world and the spiritual heart of India is Varanasi, often referred to as Kashi (City of Life) and Banaras. It is one of Hinduism's 7 holy sites. Along the western bank of the Ganges, a labyrinth of tiny streets makes up the medieval city of Varanasi. If you want to grasp the spirit of Hindu devotion, you should travel to Varanasi. Visitors to this city in Uttar Pradesh would never forget their experience walking along the Ganges ghats.

name: 5. Darjeeling
info: The old summer capital of India under the British Raj, Darjeeling, has developed into one of the most popular hill resort areas across the country. This charming hill town in West Bengal is the perfect place for an enchanting honeymoon. Due to its height of 2,050 meters above sea level, Darjeeling experiences pleasant weather all year round.

name: 6. Leh-Ladakh
info: On October 31, 2019, Ladakh was made a union territory and was once a part of the state of Jammu and Kashmir. Ladakh is the coldest desert in the world, with breathtaking views. In Ladakh, rafting and mountain trekking are common sports. Leh Ladakh cannot be reached by road during the winter. The only means to get there is via plane, and the route is closed from October to May. The Chadar trek on the ice of the Zanskar river takes place from January to the end of February.

name: 7. Nainital
info: The lovely hill town of Nainital is located in the Uttarakhand region at the base of the Kumaon highlands. It is the most well-known hill station in North India and is located near Dehradun and Delhi. Nainital is a fantastic weekend retreat from Delhi and the surrounding areas. Due to its wonderful all-year-round environment, Nainital is a preferred hill station for families, couples, and even lone travellers. It is suitable for a two-day visit and is accessible by car from neighbouring major cities. The Naina Lake, located in the middle of Nainital with Thandi Sadak and Mall Road on each side, is direct across the street from the bus stop.

name: 8. Gangtok
info: The Sikkim state's capital, Gangtok, is among India's most alluring hill towns. It is gorgeous, deliciously boisterous, and enveloped in clouds. From mid-March until mid-May, the wild rhododendrons blossom, turning the surroundings into vast fields of vibrant carpets. On clear days, the town, located at 1650 meters above sea level, provides breathtaking views of mountain Kanchenjunga. For campers and hikers traveling over the Himalayan Mountain ranges, Gangtok is a popular stop.

name: 9. Mumbai
info: Mumbai, the capital of the Indian state of Maharashtra, is a stunning contrast of chaos and promise, grace and squalor, modernity and tradition. Mumbai is one of the nation's major art, culture, and theatre centers. It is a vibrant, multicultural metropolis. Mumbai, formerly known as Bombay, is considered the City of Dreams and is a wonderfully merged melting pot of different cultures and lifestyles.

name: 10. Delhi
info: India's capital, Delhi, is a cosmopolitan city that includes modern New Delhi and medieval Old Delhi. With everything from historic landmarks to bustling shopping centers, a large network of modern public transport systems, and the Delhi University campus. Delhi is renowned as a city with a heart. The Akshardham Temple, The Lotus Temple (also known as the Bahai Temple), and the ISKCON Temple are just a few of the city's prominent temples.

name: 11. Kodaikanal
info: One of India's most well-liked honeymoon destinations is Kodaikanal in Tamil Nadu. Kodaikanal's name translates to "the gift of the trees." a waterfall, mist-covered manicured cliffs, and a wonderful climate come together in Kodaikanal, a lakeside coastal town in Tamil Nadu, to create the ideal setting for a restful vacation.

name: 12. Lonavala
info: Nestled in the Sahyadri range of the Western Ghats, close to Pune and Mumbai, Lonavala is the most well-known hill station in Maharashtra and the spot to visit during the rainy season. Due to the number of waterfalls, lakes, and hills in the region, it is a well-liked location for camping, hiking, and other adventurous activities.

name: 13. Coorg
info: Coorg, often referred to as Kodagu, is Karnataka's most prosperous hill station. It is famous for its stunningly beautiful surroundings and abundant foliage. The beauty is complemented by forest-covered slopes, spice, and coffee plantations. Cover the picturesque towns of Virajpet, Kushalnagar, Gonikoppal, Pollibetta, and Somwarpet on tour to Coorg, and experience the unique idea of "homestays" to make your journey more unforgettable! Madikeri is the region's hub, with all transit routes branching out from here.

name: 14. McLeodganj
info: Mcleodganj, situated in the Kangra district, is an ideal hiking destination near Dharamshala. The town combines Tibetan and British culture and is renowned for its hiking. It is well known around the world as the residence of the Dalai Lama and is often called Little Lhasa. McLeod Ganj is a delightful village in upper Dharamsala. Nestled among breathtaking hills and abundant vegetation, it is steeped in a Tibetan influence, thanks to its many Tibetan residents. It is one of the most captivating scenes in all of Himachal Pradesh, attracting many visitors annually.

name: 15. Pachmarhi
info: A UNESCO Biosphere Reserve home to leopards and bison, Pachmarhi is Madhya Pradesh's only hill station and the highest point in the state. It the at an elevation of 1,067 meters and is known as the "Queen of the Satpura Range."

name: 16. Jodhpur
info: Jodhpur, also known as "The Blue City" due to its blue walls and residences, Jodhpur is the second-largest city in Rajasthan and the former capital of Marwar; it is the state's second-largest metropolis. Jodhpur is famous for its temples, lakes, and refreshment, but its main attraction is the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort.

name: 17. Jaisalmer
info: Jaisalmer is one of the most sought-after tourist destinations in Rajasthan, India's westernmost state. With its golden dunes, castles of golden honey sandstone, and lakes, this state is often called the 'Golden City.' Jain temples, Havelis, and numerous lakes make Jaisalmer a magical destination. For a spectacular experience, ride a camel into the desert and camp beneath the stars.

name: 18. Chennai
info: The city of Chennai, formerly known as Madras, is the capital of Tamil Nadu, a state in southern India as one of India's four metropolitan cities, this capital of the south has a rich cultural background that perfectly complements its urban lifestyle. Chennai combines a lively atmosphere with a rich tradition on the Coromandel Coast of the Bay of Bengal.

name: 19. Munnar
info: Munnar is a hill station in Kerala's Idukki district that is popular among tourists. Munnar is known for its tea gardens, lush foliage, and misty blankets that create natural lookout locations. It is one of the world's most popular and frequented tourism locations, located at 1600 meters in the Western Ghats.

name: 20. Hampi
info: One of Karnataka's most treasured sites is Hampi, which is calm and full of history. The map of Hampi was crafted in such a way that it is today acknowledged as one of God's gifts to humanity, even though a succession of monarchs governed the Vijayanagar empire. Temples may be found all over the place, and each is unique in terms of its architectural design, historical significance, and myths. Hampi, renowned as a hippie's paradise, is only dry in terms of its weather.

name: 21. Wayanad
info: Wayanad's pleasant climate all year round makes it the perfect place to escape north India's oppressive heat. Although it has mild temperatures, this place also has vast plantations, misty mountains, and untouched woods. Several tourist attractions may be found in Wayanad, which is frequently referred to as the "spices garden of India," in addition to vast orchards of various spices, including cardamom, black pepper, star anise, fenugreek, black cumin, and others. The perfume of the coffee plantation, the organic fruits and vegetables, the waving paddy fields, and the lush spice orchards add to the region's characteristic scent.

name: 22. Mount Abu
info: Mount Abu, renowned as the only hill town in Rajasthan and a significant Jain pilgrimage site, is a perfect location to escape the summer heat. At the same time, the experience is enhanced by being in a devout spiritual environment.

name: 23. Amritsar
info: Sikhs see Amritsar as the holiest city globally, not only in India. The city's name is derived from the holy lake, also known as "the holy pool of nectar," which surrounds the city's well-known Golden Temple. Being one of the major cities in Punjab and having a direct connection to the National Highway that links it to other cities like Ambala, Chandigarh, Delhi, and Patiala makes it quite easy to get to Amritsar.

name: 24. Pushkar
info: Pushkar is an essential pilgrimage site for adherents of the Hindu and Sikh religions since it is home to hundreds of spectacular temples, including the sole "Lord Brahma Temple" in the whole world and multiple gurudwaras. It is located on the shore of Pushkar Lake, in the western Aravalli Range, about 10 km away from the Rajasthan city of Ajmer. Pushkar furthermore has extremely hot summers, serene, enjoyable winters, and mild monsoon showers due to its placement in the barren desert state.

name: 25. Auli
info: Auli is a hill town in the Garhwal area of the Uttarakhand state of India. The region's physical features effectively produced its name, Auli, which means "meadows." The hill station is perched on hills and has expansive, aesthetically beautiful meadows. Auli is praised as a place where nature manifests itself in all its magnificence and beauty. It provides a lovely view of the local hills and is rich in natural possessions.

info: Due to the numerous Mughal-era structures in Agra, including the Taj Mahal, the Agra Fort, and Fatehpur Sikri, all of which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites, it is a major tourist destination in North India. The city of Agra's tourist attractions speaks eloquently about its rich heritage and culture. The city is well known for its historical landmarks, architecture, and atmosphere of the Mughal era. Since Agra is a part of the Golden Triangle circuit that includes Delhi and Jaipur, visitors to the north frequently visit all three cities simultaneously.

name: 27. Yelagiri
info: Yelagiri is a charming hill town close to the Vaniyambadi Tirupattur road in the Vellore district of Tamil Nadu. A magnificent green valley, eye-catching orchards, and flower gardens make up the gorgeous Yelagiri Tour.

name: 28. Pondicherry
info: The southern state of Tamil Nadu borders Pondicherry, one of India's seven union territories, sometimes known as "Pondy" but also occasionally as Puducherry. A beautiful destination that offers the best of both cultures, this former French colony is the ultimate marriage of French architecture with traditional Indian sensibilities.

name: 29. Jaipur
info: In the 18th century, Sawai Jai Singh founded Jaipur, the biggest city and the capital of Rajasthan. It is a popular tourist site that is a significant component of the well-known Golden Triangle tourism circuit and is 268 kilometres from New Delhi.

info: Dalhousie, a well-known Himachal Pradesh hill resort, provides views of the snow-covered peaks of the Dhauladhar range. Dalhousie is home to waterfalls, verdant woodlands, and meadows. Scottish and Victorian architectural styles in churches remind them of their colonial heritage. In 1854, the British colonists established the Lord Dalhousie Valley, which carried his name and was one of their favourite summer getaway locations.

name: 3. Mon
info: Mon, one of Nagaland's top tourist destinations, is renowned for its pleasant setting. name: 4. Mokokchung
info: Mokokchung, which is home to the Ao tribe, is frequently referred to as Nagaland's brightest and most attractive area. Longkhum, one of its locations, is well acclaimed for being a heaven for those who love the outdoors. name: 5. Wokha

info: Khonoma Green Village, one of Nagaland's most undisturbed landscapes, is the product of consistent ethical living. Each home we will see here has been completely handmade using only crude ingredients that have been recycled or come from the earth. It is a place where the Angami community lives off of farming, spinning, and handlooms to provide for their daily needs. This place has flourished and is now a model and fantastic illustration of sustainable development for future generations.

name: 7. Benreu
info: Benreu is completely quiet and isolated in the Peren town of Nagaland. It is an undiscovered community, 20% of its residents being animals and the natural world. It is one of the top traveller destinations in Nagaland to visit if one wants to travel completely off-road and experience ultimate seclusion.

info: In the Kiphire region, Meluri is a little, charming village en route to Mount Saramati. This region is widely known for its hunters and their hunting expertise. name: 1. Berijam Lake in Kodaikanal

The peaceful waters of the 59-acre Berijam Lake are so clean that Periyakulam, a small city in the valley below Kodaikanal, relies on it as its primary supply of drinkable water.

info: All visitors and people like visiting Bryant Park. It is among the top Kodaikanal tourist destinations. info: Vaigai Dam's stunning scenery is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The plains, deep valleys, and hills are breathtakingly beautiful from The Green Valley View. The valley is best viewed between 10:00 am and 3:00 pm; as the day wears on, the valley fills with mist and is difficult to see clearly.

name: 5. Kodaikanal Lake in Kodaikanal
info: The town of Kodaikanal is in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul district, and Kodaikanal Lake is an artificial body of water there. Kodai Lake is another name for Kodaikanal Lake. The star-shaped lake is bordered by the verdant hills of the Palani Hills range in the northwest, which serves as the lake's primary watershed. The lake has an average depth of 3.0 m and is 2285 meters above sea level. The distance from Kodai Bus Stand to the lake is 3 kilometres. British and early American missionaries created the lake.

info: Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris area, 12 kilometres from Coonoor, lies the Dolphin Nose Viewpoint, a popular tourist site. More than 1,550 meters above sea level, 10 kilometres from Coonoor, lies Dolphin Nose, a fantastic viewing location. One of the top Kodaikanal tourist destinations is it.

name: 7. Solar Observatory in Kodaikanal
info: Palani Hills' Rose Garden is close to Kodaikanal Solar Observatory. The Kodaikanal Solar Observatory was built to make it useful for researching solar activity. Numerous national and international conferences are held there, and it is only open during the day. The Kodaikanal Solar Observatory is free to visit.

name: 8. Thalaiyar Falls in Kodaikanal
info: Rat Tail Falls, also known as Thalaiyar Falls, is situated on the Manjalar River. It is the sixth-highest waterfall in India and the tallest in Tamil Nadu at 975 feet. At Dum Dum Rock, the park features a viewing tower from where you may enjoy stunning views of the waterfalls and Manjalar Dam. The waterfall is close to a hiking track. The settlement of Perumal Malai lies 9 kilometres upstream of the river water spring.

name: 9. Bear Shola Falls in Kodaikanal
info: Bear Shola Falls is a well-loved picnic location in the area and is about 2 kilometres away from Kodaikanal Lake. However, nowadays, couples, nature lovers, and adventure seekers all like Kodaikanal's beautiful and tranquil waterfall.

name: 10. Pillar Rocks in Kodaikanal
info: The Pillar Rocks is near Kodaikanal. The location is so named because it contains three vertically positioned boulders that rise 400 feet above the ground, making it a lovely picnic area for couples and families with young children. On these rocks previously stood the "White Cross," David Gayle's magnificent love song. Proof of a wonderful love tale.

name: 11. Devils Kitchen in Kodaikanal
info: The Devil's Kitchen is a natural heritage site and cave network in Kodaikanal. Before becoming popular, only pedestrians came to this location. It rose to fame after being used as the location for the 1992 Tamil film "Guna." Even in the summer and winter, this valley is covered in a heavy layer of clouds. Tourists must walk 400 meters from the main entrance to the summit.

name: 12. Pine Forest in Kodaikanal
info: The Kodaikanal Pine Forest is a lovely location to see in Kodaikanal, which resembles a painting. The entire environment is apparent due to its appealing hues. name: 13. Perumal Peak in Kodaikanal
info: Among the Kodaikanal tourist attractions, Perumal Peak has an undiscovered past. Locals here think that although this peak has been inert for a thousand years, it was once an active volcano. Because it is the mountain's highest summit, tourists also like visiting it. People who love adventure travel come to this location and enjoy motorcycling.

name: 14. Shembaganur Museum in Kodaikanal
info: Kodaikanal tourism destination one of the sites to see in this area is the Shembaganur Museum. Here, you may observe more than 300 animals, butterflies, plants, and more. Its broad past includes ethnography, handicrafts, flora, and animals. It also contains a large garden with a variety of flower species. About 6 kilometres separate this tourist destination from Kodaikanal Lake. Except on Thursdays, it is open every day from 10 to 11:30 and 3 to 5 pm.

name: 15. Kukkal Caves in Kodaikanal
info: The Paliar tribes were said to have found refuge in the Kodaikanal Kukkal Caves. The many artworks that decorate the cave's interior walls prove that the tribalists formerly lived there. This location is on the mountain range's highest summit. Tourists can visit from 10 am to 5 pm.

name: How to Reach Kodaikanal
info: By taking a flight, train, or bus, you may get to Kodaikanal easily.

info: Visitors to Kodaikanal Hill Station may enjoy really tasty meals. The renowned local food is something you must try once. info: Sim's Park is the best in the famous hill station of Coonoor, Tamil Nadu, 4 km from Coonoor Railway Station. It is a popular tourist spot in Coonoor. Sim's Park was created by JD Sims and Major Murray in 1874 and is a unique park combined with a botanical garden. It was built using the land's natural features.

name: 2. Droog Fort
info: One of Coonoor's most incredible spots to go hiking is Droog Fort, which draws visitors with its remains. Here, a single wall and a watchtower stand with great dignity to attract people worldwide.

name: 3. St. George'S Church
info: St. George's Church, a well-known gothic structure in Coonoor, is renowned for its art collections and rich interiors. At significant events, such as regional or national celebrations, this Church seems active and busy.

name: 4. Law'S Falls
info: The following on the list of popular tourist attractions in Coonoor is Law's Falls. The falls are breathtaking and draw tourists from all around the world. This waterfall is approximately 180 feet tall and has a water pool at its bottom.

name: 5. Rallia Dam
info: The Rallia Dam is a stunning, tranquil escape in the Nilgiris, near Coonoor, where you must hike for at least one kilometre. It provides a delightful and captivating view of the natural surroundings and is home to several fantastic bird species. The dense forest around you makes you fall in love with this location. Spend some time riding the Heritage Toy Train and seeing the Highfield Tree Factory.

name: 6. Dolphin'S Nose
info: Among the major tourist attractions in Coonoor, Dolphin's Nose is the ideal location to get a 180-degree glimpse of the natural beauty around. You could quickly see Catherine Falls flowing out somewhere in between while you are focusing on the greenery spreading apart. Tea gardens in all shades of luxuriant green completely enclose the road to the Dolphin's Nose. As you advance to this step, the fragrance of fresh, sensitive tea leaves will surround you.

name: 7. Lady Canning'S Seat
info: Another stunning location for hiking, photography, and more, especially for all history lovers, is Lady Canning's Seat of Coonoor. It is a historic home in Coonoor and offers a captivating view of the mountains and beautiful green valley surrounding it.

name: 8. Ketti Valley
info: The beautiful Ketti Valley is located on the Ooty-Coonoor route and is referred to as the Switzerland of South India. This valley, the second-largest populated valley in India, provides beautiful scenery of the lush, green surroundings and the surrounding blue mountains.

name: 9. Lamb's Rock
info: Lamb's Rock is fully encircled by large mountain ranges and rises considerable distances above the level of the neighbouring sea. It would be best if you went on an adventurous hike through the spectacular scenery to get to Lamb's Rock from the bottom.

name: 10. Hidden Valley
info: Most Coonoor travellers have not yet visited Hidden Valley, one of the untraveled routes. It is regarded as one of God's most exquisite creations, offering fantastic views.

name: 11. Wellington
info: If making a list of Coonoor's must-see attractions, don't forget to include Wellington. It is among the most lovely and tranquil locations in South India, and it is a military community with an army facility and many homes of British design.

name: 12. Catherine Falls:
info: In Tamilnadu's Nilgiris area, Catherine Falls is a stunning waterfall close to Kotagiri. It is one of the most splendid waterfalls close to Bangalore and the second-largest waterfall in the Nilgiris. It is also one of Coonoor's most popular attractions.

name: 1. Udayagiri Fort in Kanyakumari
info: The Udayagiri Fort is 14 kilometres from Nagercoil town, located between the passes of the Thiruvananthapuram-Nagarcoal National Highway. King Marthanda Varma erected this famous Fort, De Lannoy's Fort, throughout his tenure. In this Fort, you may view De Lannoy's tomb together with those of his son and wife. Additionally, within the Fort, it is possible to view where firearms are created. In the Fort, there is also a Nature Park, which attracts visitors with more than 100 different tree species and animals, ducks, and birds. So make sure you include this tourist destination in your list to enjoy its beauty and calmness.

name: 2. Kanyakumari Beach in Kanyakumari
info: Besides being an excellent site for a camping trip, Kanyakumari Beach is also a place of worship. It is located near the southernmost point of peninsular India. The morning and evening views of Kanyakumari Beach are magnificent. Many people used to gather here to view this beauty, especially during full moon day, which mostly happens in April. Kanyakumari Beach is a gorgeous spot to watch out as the waters of the Bay of Bengal, Arabian Sea, and the Indian Ocean used to converge here. This beach is well known for its vibrant and bright sands.

name: 3. Kanyakumari Temple in Kanyakumari
info: One of the primaries draws to this city is Kanyakumari Temple. Kanyakumari Bhagavathiamman Temple is another name for it. The Pandya dynasty rulers initially constructed the Kumari Amman Temple in the eighth century, and the Vijayanagara, Chola, and Nayaka emperors later restored it. As per legend, it is said that because Goddess Kanyakumari and Lord Shiva's marriage didn't happen, the Goddess decided to remain a virgin. The rice and other grains intended for the wedding are thought to have been left undercooked and turned into stones. Even today, grains-shaped rocks are still visible. So if you are a follower of God and willing to explore the related sites, this is the most important place to explore.

name: 4. Gandhi Mandapam in Kanyakumari
info: Gandhi Mandapam is a monument created in 1956 to honour the outstanding national leader. Before being buried in the sea, our nation's Father, Gandhi's ashes were held here. After the leader passed away, his cremated remains were partitioned among 12 urns and dispersed across the country so that people could pay their final respects to this significant figure. Due to Gandhi's connections to Kanyakumari, building a monument there in his honour may have been necessary. One of the most revered locations to visit in Kanyakumari is Gandhi Mandapam. The monument's centre pillar, which stands 79 feet tall and represents the Mahatma's age at the time of his assassination, is what makes it unique. So make sure you include this tourist destination in your list to pay tribute to our nation's father here.

name: 5. Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari
info: Swami Vivekananda, a follower of Sri Ramakrishna Paramahansa and the founder of the Ramakrishna Mission, is honoured at the gorgeous Vivekananda Memorial Rock. The red and blue granite that makes up the Vivekananda Rock Memorial was erected between 1963 and 1970. Vivekananda Mandapam and Sripada Mandapam are the two primary buildings that make up the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. On the Shripada Parai, which has Kanyakumari Devi's imprint, is where the Shripada Mandapam is located. It is thought that Swami Vivekananda utilized this location for meditation. So if you admire Swami Vivekanand for any reason, you should surely visit this place to learn a few more about him.

name: 6. Kamarajar Manimandapam in Kanyakumari
info: In honour of Sri Kamaraj, the previous Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu and a leader in the country's struggle for independence, Kamarajar Manimandapam was constructed. Near the Mahatma Gandhi Memorial, Kamarajar Manimandapam is also located. On the exact spot where his ashes were placed, a monument was erected so that people could pay respects to him by remembering him. The general public referred to Shri Kamarajar as "Black Gandhi." So, people visiting Kanyakumari should explore this place to know more about the former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu.

name: 7. Tiruchendur Temple in Kanyakumari
info: Around 80 kilometres from Kanyakumari, 60 kilometres from Tirunelveli, and 40 kilometres from Tuticorin, the Tiruchendur Arulmigu Subramanyaswamy Temple is situated in the town of Tiruchendur. The second home of Lord Murugan is this temple, also known as Santhilandvar. The place where the Tiruchendur Murugan Temple is located is a hill known as Chandana Hill. After killing the monster Sorapadma, Lord Murugan is said to have worshipped Lord Shiva here. So if you are a follower of God and willing to explore the related sites, this is the most important place to explore.

name: 8. Our Lady of Ransom Church in Kanyakumari
info: The Kanyakumari region of Tamil Nadu is home to the well-known Catholic church known as Our Lady of Ransom, which is named after Mother Mary. The church was built in the Gothic style around the fifteenth century. Beautiful wood sculptures of the twelve disciples, angels playing stringed instruments, and Mother Mary being crowned may be seen on the walls and ceilings. This church seems in its entire splendour when lighted up every night. One of Kanyakumari's top architectural attractions is the Our Lady of Ransom Church. It is among the top tourist destinations in Kanyakumari. So make sure you include this tourist destination in your list to enjoy its beauty and calmness.

name: 9. Vattakottai Fort in Kanyakumari
info: In Tamil Nadu, Vattakottai fort lies at the southernmost point of India. The former Kingdom of Travancore constructed it in the 18th century as shore protection and barracks. The Fort is mainly built of granite stones, and presently a portion of it even reaches the sea. The Indian Archaeological Department has just completed a significant renovation of the Fort, which is now designated as a tourist spot. The massive Fort became a popular tourist site because of its historical significance and breathtaking surroundings. This location is enthralling due to the gorgeous highlands of the Bay of Bengal on one side, the Western Ghats on the other, and beaches fringed with brilliant black sand. Buses to and from the Fort run regularly thanks to Kanyakumari Road Transport Corporation.

name: 10. Thiruvalluvar Statue in Kanyakumari
info: The Tirukkural, early Tamil literature on religion and morality, was written by the writer and philosopher Valluvar and is honoured by the 133-foot-tall Thiruvalluvar Statue. Construction of the monument started in 1990 and was devotedly pursued until 1999, when it was managed to finish. The statue is now India's 25th highest statue. It is a landmark of significant cultural significance and one of the most visited attractions in Kanyakumari. The figure is close to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and is accessible from the coastline by boat services.

name: 11. Thirparappu falls in Kanyakumari
info: Thirparappu Falls, located around 55 kilometres from Kanyakumari, are spectacular. This 50-foot-tall artificial waterfall is artificial, and it combines many streams of water pouring from above to create a magnificent water pool below. A nature lover's heaven, the waterfalls are covered with dense green vegetation and local wildlife. You can photograph the fascinating scenes of the icy waterfalls plunging to the ground. It's the ideal location for a family holiday or a picnic with family members and friends. So explore this beautiful natural sight without fail. It will surely leave you surprised and will call you back after some time.

name: 12. Thanumalayan Temple in Kanyakumari
info: An important Hindu shrine called Thanumalayan Temple may be found in Tamil Nadu's Suchindram district of Kanyakumari. Even though the shrine is currently located in Tamil Nadu due to the community of Kanyakumari merging with Tamil Nadu, it is one of the 108 Shiva temples treasured by Kerala Hindu tradition. Trimuthis are honoured in the ancient shrine known as Thanumalayan Temple, often referred to as Sthanumalayan. With inscriptions from the ninth century, the stunning temple underwent renovation in the seventeenth century. The melodic pillars of the temple, which show off the artisans' construction ability, are its primary draw. There are four 18-foot-tall pillars, one of which is built of granite stone. The many temple pillars also include themes from the Mahabharata and Ramayana. So make sure you have this tourist destination on your list to enjoy its beauty and calmness.

name: 13. Padmanabhapuram Palace in Kanyakumari
info: A palace from the Travancore era, Padmanabhapuram Palace is situated in Tamil Nadu's Kanyakumari district. The distance to Kanyakumari City is roughly 39 kilometres. The administration of the nearby state of Kerala owns, runs, and maintains the palace. The old Hindu kingdom of Travancore, also known as Kalkulam Palace, had its capital in Padmanabhapuram. The Padmanabhapuram Palace said to have been constructed in the 16th century, is the repository of several rare antiques and artefacts. The grandeur of the palace itself, decorated with wonderful handcrafts and patterns, makes it a beautiful location. So, individuals looking for some ancient buildings to explore can reach out to this place to enjoy its stunning architecture and surroundings.

name: 14. Tsunami Monument in Kanyakumari
info: The monument was constructed in honour of all who suffered in the tragic massive earthquake that occurred on December 26, 2004. The two-arm, 16-foot monument is situated close to the city's southern boundary. The light is blazing on the right hand, and a vast blue wave stops it with the left hand to keep it from going out. This monument is undoubtedly a must-see location since it stands for bravery and perseverance in the face of adversity. From November through March, you may visit this place. You should include this place in your tourist spot list and make sure you pay tribute there to those people who were killed.

name: Best Time To Visit Kanyakumari
info: Since the climate is quiet and comfortable from October to February, it is the perfect time to visit Kanyakumari. The optimum time to take in dawn, dusk, and ocean activities at this place is this time. Maximum temperatures in Kanyakumari range from 20 to 35 ° in the summer, 24 to 31 degrees during the monsoon, and 17 to 32 degrees in the winter. Preferably go between October and February if you plan a trip to Kanyakumari.

name: Local Food In Kanyakumari
info: The heart of outstanding South Indian cuisines is Kanyakumari. The cuisine of Kanyakumari used to be flavorful, fiery, and refreshing. It is recognized for its seafood and traditional South Indian cuisines like dosa and idli. Somiya, Kothu, Banana Chips, Appam, and Marwaji Kilangu with fish are some of the delicious local foods of Kanyakumari. You must try it if you are visiting Kanyakumari.

name: Way To Reach Kanyakumari
info: Trivandrum International Airport, which is 67 kilometres from Kanyakumari, is the closest airport to the city. It has good air connections to certain Gulf nations and the major Indian cities. To get to this airport, there are several significant Indian airlines. In addition, several buses operated by Kanyakumari Road Transport travel to Kanyakumari from Tamil Nadu, Trivandrum, Chennai, and Bangalore. You may also take the Kanyakumari Express to get here from Bengaluru and Mumbai. You may take a cab from Kanyakumari, a significant railway station, to reach Kanyakumari city.

name: 1. Tawang
info: It is renowned for its several significant and stunning monasteries. Tawang is a lovely town that is also pronounced Dawang. Its beautiful scenery makes your journey beautiful. Tawang Monastery is the most well-known and most revered among Buddhists.

name: 2. Ziro
info: Ziro is a haven for those who want peace. The small town Ziro is located in Arunachal Pradesh. It is home to the Apa Tani people and renowned for its pine hills and rice farms. Ziro has pleasant weather all year, which makes it pleasant to travel during the year.

name: 3. Namdapha National Park
info: It is the country's third-largest national park in terms of area. This park is a treasure for those people who love wildlife. The park is famous for its vibrant bio-diversities; the park is the house of endangered animal and plant species in the country. Visitors can see animals like the Clouded Leopard, Snow Leopard, Tiger, and Leopard in this area. This national park offers a stunning view of the adjacent peaks. It is an ideal place for relaxing as well as for some walking and trekking activities. Travelers can enjoy exciting elephant safaris while exploring the park's lush natural greenery.

name: 4. Roing
info: Roing is one of the most renowned tourist destinations because of its deep gorges, furious rivers, numerous waterfalls, peaceful lakes, snow-capped mountains, and archaeological sites. It is a natural paradise with lakes and mountains.

name: 5. Itanagar
info: It is a natural paradise. It is situated between two hills. Itanagar is well known for its festivals, diverse wildlife and plants, educational sites, and historical monuments. Itanagar is undoubtedly one of the top destinations to visit in Andhra Pradesh due to its attractive scenery and number of sites to explore.

name: 6. Bomdila
info: Bomdila is a small town that offers a glimpse of the local customs and culture. Visitors enjoy the town's beautiful natural surroundings, including the apple orchards, valley, snow-covered hills, and stunning environment. Temples of both Buddhism and Hinduism are found here. Bomdila offers the visitors opportunity to experience the wildlife, culture, and tradition, as well as the wonders of nature, all in one location. It is undoubtedly among the top tourist destinations in Arunachal Pradesh.

name: 7. Bhalukpong
info: Bhalukpong is located along the Kameng river's banks. Bhalukpong offers visitors the opportunity to experience wildlife, and a variety of activities complement the surrounding environment. The town has become more attractive to the Kameng river, which flows through the nearby forest. Visitors can enjoy camping, fishing, hiking, and other outdoor activities in Bhalukpong.

name: 8. Anini
info: Clouds come down and touch the ground at Anini. Anini is the perfect place to go for a fantastic vacation because of the nice climate and the stunning splendor of pristine nature. It is breathtaking to see Anini's lush landscape covered in white fog; everyone must see this scene at least once in a lifetime. Trekking is the greatest way to experience the magnificence of the local wildlife and the beauty of nature. For the Arunachal Helicopter Service, Anini is the main stop.

name: 9. Tirap
info: The Tirap is situated in the southeast of Arunachal Pradesh. Tirap never fails to amaze its visitors with flowing rivulets, green and colorful orchids, and the pure air that calms the restless mind. Tirap is a hidden treasure for nature lovers and adventurers who enjoy hiking, camping, and other outdoor activities in the midst of the forest.

name: 10. Mechuka
info: Arunachal Pradesh's Mechuka is well-known for its diverse tribes and surrounding natural beauty. Mechuka is a well-known tourist site because of its historical and religious significance. It is one of the North East's best scenic locations. Mechuka is also known as Menchukha. Men-chu-kha translates as "medicinal water of snow," where "men" stands for medicine, "chu" for water, and "kha" for snow, while "kha" can also mean "mouth."

name: 1. Subhash Baoli
info: Named after the Subhash Chandra Bose, a freedom fighter, this tranquil location in Dalhousie is an ideal spot to witness the natural beauty and relax in the calm environs. This place is a spring known to possess medicinal properties, and many people say they have treated and cured the health of Subhash Chandra too. Visitors can pay tribute to the freedom fighter here and enjoy an evening walk and picnic. The snow-dusted hillock catches the eye along the spring that cascades into a frosty stream.

name: 2. Garam Sadak
info: It is a route in the Dalhousie that link Gandhi Chowk with Subhash Chowk and is amongst the undiscovered locations to explore in the small town. Visitors can enjoy the valley's picturesque view from the Thai road fringed with tall trees and luxurious greenery. Wandering around in this place is considered the most touristy thing to do in the town. In addition, visitors will be able to see extraordinary Tibetan Rock Paintings sculpted on the walls on the wayside.

name: 3. Panchpula
info: Panchpula is a preferred picnic area in the town, placed 3.5 KM far away from the shopping market, Gandhi Chowk. Surrounded by a blanket of pine and deodar trees, it is famous for the Saptdhara waterfalls, which is the Ganji Pahari trek's starting point. A Samadhi or monument is also erected nearby this place to memorialize Sardar Ajit Singh (martyr Bhagat Singh's uncle), a rebellious and revolutionary.

name: 4. John's Church
info: St. John's Church was built back in 1863 and is the oldest church in the town. This church is a perfect mix of history and beauty and is considered one of the best attractions to explore in Dalhousie. It is quite popular amongst photographers due to its beautiful construction. On Sunday, various locals and visitors assemble at this church to witness the performance of the Sunday Service. As this place is also a reminder of the British rule in the region, it is admired by history lovers. In addition, the church showcases architecture embellished with glass paintings of St John the Baptist together with St Peter.

name: 5. Gandhi Chowk (Mall Road)
info: GPO or Gandhi Chowk is a place in Dalhousie to enjoy a shopping tour and is a mall road in this small town. Visitors can buy traditional handicrafts from local markets and take gifts for themselves and their loved ones. The Himachal Handloom Industry Emporium and the Tibetan Market are among some of the famous shops at Gandhi Chowk from where one can buy memento, woolen clothes and much more.

name: 6. Ganji Pahari
info: Ganji Pahari in Dalhousie offers its visitors an astounding view of snow-topped peaks. One has to trek to reach the peak that begins from Panchpula, and as this trek is easy to moderate, anyone can do it. Also named Bald Hill, Ganji Pahari is popular for its complete absence of vegetation on the hillock. Tourists can plan their winter trip to see a thick blanket of snow covering this hillock. Explore Ganji Pahari during dawn or sundown for the best experience.

name: 7. Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary
info: Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary has a wide range of luxurious meadows, thick deodar foliage, freshwater streams and more, making it a must-visit tourist attraction in the town for wildlife admirers. Kalatop means "black cap", which refers to the black forest enwrap in this wildlife sanctuary's highest summit. Various trekking and hiking trails are available inside the sanctuary, which makes up for a refined nature walk.

name: 8. Satdhara Falls
info: Surrounded by astounding views of the Chamba Valley, Satdhara Falls is considered one of the best attractions to explore in Dalhousie. The luxuriant green pine and deodar trees are worth witnessing, and the cool breeze caressing the face makes one feel refreshed. It is believed that this place contains mica, which is popular for its medicinal properties in treating and curing skin diseases. If one wants to go out for a peaceful nature stroll, then this is an ideal location for them. Additionally, the fragrance of flowers will vanish all the visitors' worries and hypnotize them with its charm.

name: 9. Chamera Lake
info: Chamera Lake is one of the great destinations to explore in Dalhousie and to enjoy a fun day out. It is a popular picnic spot for families and couples who wants to spend some quality time together. One can even enjoy some water activities here for an unforgettable time. Placed at an elevation of 763 meters above sea level, the lake is enveloped by dedodar conifers and snow-topped mountains. For a passionate photographer, Chamera Lake is amongst the inescapable locations in the town.

name: 10. Khajjiar
info: Also referred to as "Mini Switzerland of India ", Khajjiar is a small town positioned at a distance of 20 km from Dalhousie. This place has a plentiful natural beauty that draws the attention of travelers from everywhere. Visit a small lake in the midst of grassland and click photos for memories. Visitors can get involved in fun activities like paragliding and create thousands of memories that will last evermore. The nine-hole golf course is the most popular part of Khajjiar, placed in the centre of luxurious greenery. For a great experience, travel here during winter to play in snow.

name: 11. Chamba
info: Chamba is a Himalayan town in Himachal popular for its alluring prehistoric shrines, caves and monuments. It is a haven for a history enthusiast. Placed at an elevation of 996 meters, it sits on the Ravi River's banks. Few people know that Chamba is an unconventional place that provides natural beauty and tranquil environs. Also, not known by many, it is the campground for several camps in the great Himalayan ranges.

name: 12. Dainkund Peak
info: With the scenic views of snow-topped peaks and pleasing valleys, Dainkund Peak is amongst the most popular tourist attractions to explore in Dalhousie. Located at an elevation of 2755 meters above sea level, it is the highest point of this attractive hill town. Trekking to this peak is quite easy whether one is with family or in a couple. Visitors can follow the pathway laid with tall deodar trees and colorful flowers and get to the peak to enjoy a panoramic view of valleys and hills.

name: 1. Pandava Caves:
info: One of the most prominent sights in Pachmarhi is a series of five stone temples surrounded by naturally occurring gardens and crudely carved columns and pillars. These beautiful caverns are veiled in various legends from many historical periods. They were last hewn by Buddhist monks who utilized them for meditation since the natural way greatly helped them.

name: 2. Bee Falls:
info: Imagine huge amounts of water falling gracefully from a height in the middle of a beautiful forest. One of the most well-known attractions in Pachmarhi is Bee Falls, and after you've descended the many stairs and arrived at the waterfall, it's impossible not to be in awe of it. Around the fall, you can discover little sellers sending snacks and tea. You may not only relax and enjoy the scenery, but you can also dive into the natural freshwater pool and enjoy a swim.

name: 3. Satpura National Park:
info: This national park is located in Madhya Pradesh's Hoshangabad district and is spread out over the Satpura Hills. The Sanskrit word "Satpura," which means "seven hills," was given to the chain of hills in the central Indian highlands. It is a 524 square kilometre region that is a component of the Pachmarhi Biosphere Reserve.

name: 4. Mahadeo Hills:
info: Mahadeo Hills is located on the northern border of the Narmada basin, separating it from the Wardha and Wainganga rivers. The hills generally run east to northeast, with the northern slope mild and the southern side steeply dropping down suddenly.

name: 5. Handi Khoh:
info: The 300-foot-high sheer rock creates the best ravine in the nation. Handi Koh is surrounded by thick forests and flowing waters, and mythical tales are related. It is said to have previously been a large lake, but the wicked snake protecting it was killed by Lord Shiva's fury, and the lake was reduced to a little pot (Handi). It is one of the most beautiful sights in Pachmarhi to visit because of the beautiful nature and enjoyable journey.

name: 6. Dhupgarh:
info: Tourists will be impressed by the view from the top of this mountain, which is the tallest in the Satpura mountainous region. The summit provides views of the smaller Satpura mountains and Vindhya mountain and the top view of the water flowing.

name: 7. Priyadarshini Point (Forsyth Point):
info: The name Forsyth Point derives from the year 1857 when Captain Forsyth made the discovery. It's amazing to see hills layered on top of one other and covered with clouds and mist. One of the few tourist attractions in Pachmarhi that can offer such breathtaking beauty is Priyadarshini Point.

name: 8. Rajat Prapat (Silver Fall/Big Fall):
info: Rajat Prapat seems to be a silver strip that plunges into the forests as it descends an about 350-foot-high cliff. To view the fall from one end of the mountain, you must first trek uphill for a short while. Once you reach the top, you will see the stunning Satpura hill range in the distance, with the fall being surrounded by greenery. Rajat Prapat is one of the wonderful places to visit in Pachmarhi.

name: 9. Chauragarh Temple:
info: Chauragarh Temple is located at the top of Chauragarh, nestled between a lush valley and undulating trees. The respected shrine is known as Chota Mahadeo, devoted to Lord Shiva, and is another name for this temple. It is not simple to get there since one must climb a route of around 1250 steps, but if you do, you will undoubtedly be rewarded with the greatest surrounding views. Visit one of Pachmarhi's holy sites to capture beautiful scenery photos with your camera.

name: 10. Jata Shankar Cave:
info: The cave has stone structures that resemble Sheshnag, a mythical Hindu serpent with one hundred heads, and it is believed that Lord Shiva protected himself there from Mahisasur, another mythical figure.

name: 11. Apsara Vihar Waterfall:
info: A picnic with friends and family would be the perfect activity at this beautiful waterfall and pool. It is a well-liked attraction in Pachmarhi that will have you fascinated with the site for hours. After a 10-minute downhill hike to get there, you may satisfy your hunger at the stalls selling snacks and tea. People may be seen diving and taking dips in the tiny pool, which gathers the chilled water from the fall. The people gave the pool the name Apsara Vihar because they frequently observed English ladies swimming there while the British ruled the country, who looked to them like fairies.

name: 12. Pachmarhi Catholic Church:
info: On Sunday mornings, you may go there for prayer and church. It's a tranquil haven. This church only opens on Sundays since there aren't many Catholic families living in or around Pachmarhi. The church's attractiveness is defined by its old-world aesthetics, tinted windows, neo-gothic altar, and far-off ceiling.

name: 13. Reechgarh:
info: Visitors experience the excitement of traversing a fissure by changing the path of their body, which opens to a landscape into the forests at Reechgarh. When you look at the top of these two rocks, this ridge between them stands out and is wider towards the bottom. About 400 meters of the gap are divided by a dangerous, uneven, congested walkway. It feels amazing to have completed the ridge that leads to the mountain's opposite side. It is one of the Pachmarhi attractions that are most frequently suggested. Visitors will need sturdy footwear to climb a few stones and rocks. The cold air that flows through the tunnel mesmerizes people the most.

name: 14. Vanashree Vihar (Pansy Pool):
info: Visitors may enjoy some boating for a few hours on this beautiful little lake. The major attractions of this location, where visitors may enjoy snacks with a view of the lake, are the nearby restaurants and cafés. Vanashree vihar is the perfect getaway location for a breezy evening.

name: 15. Duchess fall:
info: Duchess fall is one of Pachmarhi's most stunning waterfalls and attracts huge crowds of visitors each year. After a ten-minute difficult downhill journey, an impressive view of a waterfall and the calming sound of the water roaring as it falls from a height may be yours.

name: 16. Gupt Mahadev:
info: One of the oldest Gupta temples and the biggest attraction of Pachmarhi is the cave temple known as Gupt Mahadev. It is a Shiva-honoring cave that is 40 feet long. Gupt Mahadev, also known as Chhota Mahadev, is situated 13 kilometres from the Pachmarhi Bus Station in the Mahadev hills. One of the oldest Gupta temples in Pachmarhi and a prominent attraction there is Gupt Mahadev, a cave temple. The 40-foot-long Gupt Mahadev cave is devoted to Lord Shiva. In this temple, people worship an avatar of Lord Ganesha and the Shivling.

name: 17. Ramya Kund:
info: Ramya Kund is a natural lake in Pachmarhi, Madhya Pradesh. It is among the popular tourist attractions in Pachmarhi and is situated about a kilometre ahead of Reechgarh. Ramya Kund, also called Irene Pool, is a gorgeous natural pool and one of Pachmarhi's less-visited destinations. Despite all the movement, it is easy to see the pool's bottom, and the water doesn't reach higher than the waist in most areas. It's the ideal location for some leisurely time spent in the cold sea.
