name: 1. Disneyland:
info: One of the most well-known and greatest locations to visit in Paris is Disneyland, a vivid, colourful, happy, and always busy amusement park. Both children and adults like visiting Disneyland in Paris. One of the most popular tourist destinations in Paris, formerly known as Euro Disney Resort, is recognized for its incredibly entertaining attractions, shows, animated films, rallies, and thrilling opportunities to interact with your favourite characters.

name: 2. Eiffel Tower:
info: The Eiffel Tower, the most recognizable landmark in Paris, was built for the 1889 World Exposition and towered an astounding 300 meters above the city. You may take the view from the top of the tower and see Gustave Eiffel's private apartment on exhibit after taking the elevator there.

name: 3. The Louvre:
info: The sleek glass pyramid at the entrance of the Louvre, the most popular museum in the world, is its defining feature.

name: 4. Notre-Dame Cathedral:
info: Built in 1163, the Notre Dame Cathedral (also known as Notre Dame de Paris) is a Gothic cathedral with mesmerizing architectural details, including rose windows, magnificent statues, and Gothic woodwork.

name: 5. Arc de Triomphe:
info: It is one of Paris' most iconic sights in Paris. The Arc de Triomphe (Triumphal Arch), the most famous and recognizable triumphal arch in the world, is situated at the western end of the well-known Champs-Élysées.

name: 6. Montmartre:
info: Montmartre is most known for its creative community, a significant hill northeast of Paris. Some well-known painters, such as Monet, Picasso, and Renoir, stayed during the Belle Époque.

name: 7. Sacré:
info: One of Paris's most beautiful tourist destinations is the Sacré-Coeur Basilica, also known by its common name. It is located on Montmartre's highland. This basilica, which has Romano-Byzantine characteristics, is of great spiritual importance. The entryway, arches, and walls feature nationalist elements, even if the meditation garden and the fountain are excellent for tranquillity and mental serenity. Inside the basilica, the use of cameras is strictly prohibited.

name: 8. Palace Of Versailles:
info: One of the most well-liked world heritage sites and interesting places to visit in Paris is the Palace of Versailles, constructed as a symbol of French Supremacy. This enormous and magnificent building includes beautiful gardens, a unique design, a stunning terrace, and a wonderful collection of Renaissance-era artwork. This breath-taking location has been designated a World Heritage Site for thirty years. This is also regarded as one of the shining examples of 17th-century French painting. The palace now has approximately 2,300 rooms, each uniquely designed. It's difficult to miss the palace's magnificence.

name: 9. Palais Garnier:
info: Previously known as Salle des Capucines, the Palais Garnier is a historic opera theatre in Paris. This was the main location of Paris Opera, a famous ensemble of opera performers in the city, also famous as Opéra Garnier. Currently, it mostly presents mesmerizing ballet performances. The main entrance, steps, stage fly tower, grand foyer, and pavilions all include exquisite and entrancing woodwork carvings, paintings, and artwork, which make Paris a popular tourist destination.

name: 10. Quartier Latin:
info: The most popular tourist destination in Paris is Quartier Latin, situated on the Seine shores. There are numerous prestigious educational institutions, including the Schola Cantorum, Ecole Polytechnique, Ecole Normale Superieure, and Ecole des Mines de Paris. The private landscape park known as Luxembourg Park, located around the Senate Building and Palais du Luxembourg, is noted for its lovely fountains. Numerous sporting events, notably the France Tennis Championship, are held on the grounds.

name: 11. Moulin Rouge:
info: The Moulin Rouge, a historical and traditional cabaret establishment at the foot of the Montmartre highland, is where the French Cancan originated. Previously a venue for courting dances, Moulin Rouge is today a lavish cabaret establishment with lovely decorations. Of course, it's also one of the fascinating tourist destinations in Paris. It's one of the nicest places to visit in Paris at night because of the brightly illuminated structure, hot music, and romantic ambience. Additionally, if you're looking for interesting spots to visit in Paris, France, Moulin Rouge may be at the top of some tourists' lists.

name: 12. Musee D'Orsay:
info: One of the most well-known museums in Paris is Musee d'Orsay, which houses some great sculptures and works of art. Here, famous works by artists including Berthe Morisot, Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres, Eugène Carrière, and Johan Barthold Jongkind are shown for tourists. Many people interested in art, culture, and history visit this place. And undoubtedly one of the most well-known tourist destinations in Paris.

name: 13. Pont Alexandre III Bridge:
info: According to many, this bridge is among the most beautiful on the entire globe. It was built in 1896 and linked the Champs-Élysées with Les Invalides. It was constructed for the Exposition Universelle de 1900, which also witnessed the debut of the most powerful microscope in the world, radio, escalators, talking movies, and other technological innovations. It honours the partnership between Russia and France in 1892 and bears the name of the Russian Tsar Alexander III. Due to his ability to speak the language like a native, the Tzar was well-liked in France.

name: 14. Louis Vuitton Foundation:
info: The Louis Vuitton Foundation, owned by the LVMH group, focuses on advancing art and culture. It is one of the sites in Paris that you must see, not just for the fancy label but also for the amazing design. It is one of the destinations you shouldn't miss out on when visiting Paris and is located on Mahatma Gandhi Avenue.

name: 15. Le Manoir De Paris:
info: Do you find the concept of haunted houses appealing? You'll like Le Manoir de Paris if that's the case. With a surface area of 1000 m², it is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Paris at night. 14 Parisian legends, most of which are based on actual events, are brought to life by the 30 artists here. The visitor can pick from one of five levels of fright in each of the 23 rooms' horror stories. To the collection of "horror" things, three animatronics, a violent dog, and a garish gargoyle have been added.

name: 16. Musée Jacquemart-André:
info: This privately administered museum is located in Paris's 8th arrondissement. It is a part of the Institut de France, and the museum was designed in 5 parts by the renowned French architect Henri Parent. It was once the home of Édouard André and Nélie Jacquemart, a well-known social painter, before becoming a museum. They spent their whole life collecting great works of art, which they then displayed for everybody to see.

name: 17. Ile De La Cité:
info: In the heart of the city, this island is situated. The early Parisian tribes established the city here. Just 981 people live on the island, mostly in the northeast and west. Several canon residences in the neighbourhood were built in the 16th century. In World War 2, victims deported from Vichy to Nazi extermination camps are remembered at the Memorial des Martyrs de la Déportation.

name: 18. Seine River:
info: Seine River, commonly referred to as the heart of Paris, is one of the most stunning and well-liked tourist destinations in Paris. The city's main water supply comes from the 777 km long river. There is a lot to see at the river's shores even if there isn't much to do there.

name: 19. Catacombs Of Paris:
info: This is another popular tourist destination in Paris. Because there are several ossuaries and a sizable collection of bones there, the location is significant. The area was created in the 18th century when overcrowding in cemeteries was becoming more and more of an issue. Over 6 million individuals were transported to the ossuary. Tourists are strongly advised to visit. This is the place to go if visitors want an unusual travel experience. Skeletons and bones can be seen in underground tunnels and caverns open to the public. All adventure seekers would love this location.

name: 20. Galeries Lafayette:
info: The Galeries Lafayette is the only place to go if you want to enjoy the best possible shopping experience in Paris. Lafayette's glimmering galleries are nothing less than heaven for those who love to buy. The location is in the wealthy Opera district. Three blocks of buildings are known to make up the enormous department store. You may explore the stores of some of the most well-known French companies here. You may look at major labels like Hermes, Chanel, and Louis Vuitton. You may also buy items from other brands. A fantastic view of the city is also available from the top floor.

name: 21. Le Marais:
info: There are many things here that you may investigate. Le Marais's historic streets are interesting to explore. This area has unique little boutiques, cool cafés, cutting-edge galleries, and eateries. One may say that this is a fantastic area with lots of things to do where you can enjoy time with your loved ones. For all tourists, this area is truly a must-see. It is well recognized that the location has an avant-garde reputation. This is the perfect place to go if you want to spend a day in Paris with friends or family. Therefore, be careful not to exclude this location from your list.

name: 22. Musee Rodin:
info: Another must-see museum in Paris is Musee Rodin, situated in the city's centre. The French artist Auguste Rodin is honoured at this specific museum. His magnificent creations, such as The Kiss, The Thinker, and The Gates of Hell, are displayed within the museum for visitors to view. Tourists may surely be surprised by the outstanding sculptor's creations at this destination. If tourists want to appreciate art, here is the place for them. There are many wonderful works to discover all across the museum. Learning about Parisian sculpture in this way is helpful.

name: 23. Musee Picasso:
info: The Musee Picasso, sometimes known as the Picasso Museum, is one of Paris' most well-known museums. The museum's major attraction is the presence of thousands of archival items in addition to more than 5000 works of art. It is well known that each of these works provides an example of Pablo Picasso's creative process. Tourists must visit if they enjoy art and have always appreciated Picasso's work. Additionally, tourists may go through the artist's many creations. Tourists can see everything here, from drawings to sculpting and engraving. The museum is famous for having a unique collection of works by outstanding painters.

name: 24. Saint Germain Des Pres:
info: The Seine River is also close to this location. This Parisian district is mostly recognized for its galleries, luxury stores, hip cafés, and restaurants. The location has a lot to offer. Make sure to stay here for a whole day if you want to come. There are many things to discover nearby. After several hours of exploring, you may relax at one of the neighbourhood cafés or restaurants. Visitors need to know that the region is also highly recognized for its exciting nightlife. So, come here if you want a fantastic evening in Paris. This is a must-see location in Paris.

name: 25. Jardin Du Luxembourg:
info: Luxembourg Park is a lovely area to visit in Paris and is situated on the left side of the River Seine, and the destination has a unique appeal that never fails to surprise tourists. Tourists appreciate the breathtaking views at this location. Here, a picnic with the family would be ideal. The finest spot to escape the bustling city life is in this location's natural green surrounds. Tourists will get relaxation from the bustling city life thanks to the area's tranquil beauty. Tourists can travel here to enjoy a relaxing afternoon with their loved ones. The Palais du Luxembourg, located inside the park, is also interesting. Overall, this is a wonderful location to spend time with your family.

name: 26. Tuileries Garden:
info: Another destination in Paris that is great to visit is this one. This is a stunning location in the city to visit that is close to the Louvre. Most tourists arrive at the Garden in the afternoon to take in the sun and wonder at the French formal garden design. The yard provides a lovely view that will help you relax. Come to Tuileries Garden to meaningfully spend time with your loved ones. A small amusement park is also situated in the Garden, making it the ideal place for you to spend time with your children. Families taking vacations here will love this location. You have to go here once while you're in Paris.

name: 1. Sundarapandiapuram
info: A little village called Sundarapandiapuram is found in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi district. It has appeared in several songs and movies and is well known for its beautiful sunflower fields. These meadows served as the backdrop for Mani Ratnam's critically acclaimed movie "Roja." To obtain the greatest views, tourists typically schedule a one-day trip to Sundarapandiapuram and visit the sunflower fields first thing in the morning.

name: 2. Kutralam Falls / Courtallam Falls
info: Courtallam, or Kutralam Falls, is a magnificent waterfall close to Tirunelveli. It is located 7 km from Tenkasi, 62 km from Tirunelveli, and 160 km from Madurai. It is one of the most well-known waterfalls in Tamil Nadu and one of the top attractions in Tenkasi. The "Spa of the South" is another name for Courtallam.

name: 3. Kasi Viswanathar Temple / Ulagamman Temple
info: Sri Kasi Viswanathar Temple is a revered Hindu shrine in the town of Tenkasi. It is approximately 1.5 km from the Tenkasi bus stand, 5 km from Courtallam, and 55 km from Tirunelveli. It is a well-liked Tenkasi tourist destination and one of the important religious sites close to Madurai. The Sri Kasi Viswanathar Temple is devoted to Kasi Viswanathar, a self-incarnated manifestation of Lord Shiva (swayambu). This temple gave the town of Tenkasi, sometimes known as Kasi of the South. According to popular belief, praying to the Lord in this temple is equivalent to doing so in Kashi, and the neighboring river Chittar is compared to Ganga.

name: 4. Thirumalai Kovil
info: Thirumalai Kovil is a Murugan temple located in Panpoli, 5 kilometers from the Panpoli bus stop, 14 km from Tenkasi, and 71 km from Tirunelveli. On a tiny hill bordered by the western ghats and at an elevation of 400 meters, the temple is located on Kerala's border.

name: 5. Five Falls / Aintharuvi
info: Five Falls, also known as Aintharuvi, is another significant waterfall in Courtallam and is located 4 km from the Courtallam Main Falls, 4 km from the Courtallam bus station, and 11 km from Tenkasi. This is the most well-known and pleasant waterfall in the area after the major falls.

name: 6. Sivasailam Temple
info: Lord Sivasailanathar and Goddess Parvati are honored in the Sivasailam Temple. The Pandavas built the temple bordered by the hills Velli Malai, Mulli Malai, and Podhigai. The Shiva lingam in the sanctuary is said to be a swayambhu lingam. He is also known as Sadaiappar because of the lines that appear to be hair on the back of the statue. While wandering around the sanctum sanctorum, one may view this via a hole. This can only be seen when the Archakar offers Aarathi behind the lingam.

name: 7. Pazhaya Courtallaruvi / Old Courtallam
info: Pazhaya Courtallaruvi, also called Old Courtallam or Shivamathungai Falls, is located 8 kilometers from Main Falls, 8 kilometers from Courtallam bus stand, and 11 kilometers from Tenkasi. This waterfall is created when water pours between two rocks and falls into a valley. Steps carved into the rocks at the base of the 200-foot fall allow the cascading water to slow down and become bather-safe. Here, bathing is both safe and well-liked. Tourists may get oil massages in addition to separate bathrooms for men and women. The falls are accessible by road, and it takes around 100 meters of walking from the parking lot to get there.

name: 8. Kutralanathar Temple
info: The Kutralanathar Temple, also known as Thirukkutralanathar, is one of Tamilnadu's busiest temples and is located 200 meters from Courtallam bus stand, 7 kilometers from Tenkasi, and 62 kilometers from Tirunelveli. It is devoted to Lord Shiva. It is one of Lord Shiva's 275 Thevara Shivasthalas. The temple dates back 2000 years and contains several ancient Tamil texts from the Chola and Pandyan eras. It's close to Courtallam Waterfall.

name: 9. Thiru Kutrala Natha Swamy Temple, Courtallam
info: The temple of Thiru Kutrala Natha Swamy is devoted to Lord Siva. It is situated close to Kurtallam's major waterfalls. The primary deity is Thiru Kutrala Nathar Swamy, also known as Kushal Vaimozhi, the Ambal Goddess. The idol of Lord Shiva at this temple is Swayambhu, a self-formed object. Several Shiva lingams in the temples are used to worship Lord Siva by conducting abishek.

name: 1. Silent Valley National Park
info: Silent Valley National Park is conveniently settled in the Nilgiri Hills. It has an area spanning over 34.56 square miles and is surrounded by a buffer zone measuring 57 square miles. It is the natural habitat of many rare species of flora and fauna. Robert Wright, a botanist, explored this area in 1847. This national park incorporates the South Western Ghats Mountain rain forests and tropical moist evergreen forests of Southern India.

name: 2. Virgin Valley
info: Attapadi's best feature is its isolation from bustling tourists. Virgin Valley is no exception. The Mannarkkad region is home to a beautiful valley that can be seen from 35 kilometers away from the hill station. If you are looking for a place to relax in Nature, this is the ideal one for you. Rocks resembling white pearls are common in higher barriers. Their beauty is one of a kind. The water is chilled and fresh. It is part of the Silent Valley chains, and its source is the Kunthi River.

name: 3. Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve
info: The Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve is an international biosphere reserve located in South India's Western Ghats. The Nilgiri Sub-Cluster, a region of the Western Ghats, was designated a World Heritage Site in 2012 by UNESCO. It includes the Aralam, Mudumalai, Mukurthi, Bandipur, and Silent Valley national parks, as well as Wayanad, Karimpuzha, and Sathyamangalam animal sanctuaries.

name: 4. Oxy Valley Garden
info: The Oxy Valley Garden, a lush green oasis near the Agali region of Attapadi, is less than 45 minutes from the center. The garden boasts exotic plants and flowers, acting as a luxurious escape from the city. Oxy is derived from Oxygen that maintains balance in Nature. Agali is a great place for tourists. There are many places where you can hike and even set up your camp to spend the night under a starry sky. You can also enjoy the tranquility of Attapadi's nearby streams of water.

name: 5. Velliangiri Hills
info: The Velliangiri Hills form part of the Western Ghats in the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve. The seven hills, whose altitudes range from 520 m to 1840 m, are bordered by the Coimbatore district in the east and the Palakad district in Kerala in the west.

name: 6. Avalanche Lake
info: Avalanche Lake is a popular tourist destination in the Nilgiri region. The lake's landscape is always blossoming with beautiful flowers like magnolias and orchids. You can walk alongside the lake on winding paths that run around it. Tourists can also do trout fishing in the lake. There is a trout hatchery by the lake, where tourists can purchase fishing rods and other accessories for trout fishing. It is indeed a serene spot.

name: 7. Attapadi Reserve Forest
info: It is a lush, green forest with rich fauna and flora near Attapadi. The Attapadi Reserve Forest is a wonderful place to plan a vacation. It is an ideal spot for a stay-cation because the place has abundant tranquillity amidst Nature and its natural vibes perfectly depict Kerela.

name: 8. Meenvallam Waterfalls
info: Meenvallam Waterfalls is a hidden treasure in the Palakkad district. It cascades up to 45 meters to the Thuppanadu River, which originates from the Kalladikodan Hills. Thuppanadu River then joins the Thoothapuzha, which, in turn, flows into the Bharathapuzha River. It is located 8 km in the forest located near Thuppanad Junction on the Palakkad Manarkkad Route on NH 213. The waterfalls draw the attention of many tourists.

name: 9. Siruvani Reservoir
info: Siruvani Dam and reservoir are one of the most popular picnic spots in the Kalladikodan hills in the Palakkad district. The Kerala Government built Siruvani Reservoir with the purpose of meeting the water needs of the town of Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu.

name: How To Reach Attapadi-
info: Attapadi is a region inhabited by a tribal population, so you won't find any railway station or airport here. But if you plan to travel by road, then the place is easily accessible. In case you wish to take a flight, then the nearest airport is the Coimbatore International Airport in Coimbatore, which is around 43 kilometers from Attapadi, and this distance can be easily covered by road in around 2 hours. The nearest railway station is Palakkad, and again you can travel from there to Attapadi by road in around 2 hours (60.4 kilometers).

name: 1. Sula Vineyard
info: It is a well-known winery situated in Nashik, and it is 180 km from northeast of Mumbai. It is known for the variety of grape wines produced here, like Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling, Chenin Blanc, and Zinfandel. It is open to everyone for a wine tasting and a vineyard tour. The SulaFest is a live music event that takes place among the vineyards. It is held at the winery each year. Those who attend the festival can participate in grape stomping, and they can also do camping here.

name: 2. Saptashrungi
info: It is a Hindu pilgrimage site. Saptashrungi is about 60 kilometers from Nasik. The half-Shaktipeeth among the 3 ½ Shaktipeeths in Maharashtra is this shrine. This shrine is dedicated to Saptashrungi Nivasin. It is claimed that one of Sati's right arm's parts dropped here. The Devi's idol is adorned with a silver nose ring, neckless, and a tall, beautiful crown. On festivals, the deity is adorned with expensive and luxurious jewels that would normally be kept in the temple's safe custody.

name: 3. Trimbakeshwar
info: The Trimbakeshwar Shrine is among India's twelve Jyotirlingas. This shrine is situated in Trimbak, which is 28 kilometers from Nashik. This Shaiva shrine is found at the Brahmagiri Hill's foot. This shrine is designed in a traditional style. On the premises of the shrine, there is the holy Kunda, and the name is Kusavarta. It is reputed to be the river Godavari's source.

name: 4. Pandavleni Caves
info: The Nasik caves or Pandu caves are the monikers of this cave. These caves are located on the Trivashmi Hills tableland. These ancient rock-cut caverns date back thousands of years. This series of 24 caves is a representation of Hinayana Buddhism. The mysterious caves also have musical fountains, museums, and a variety of dining options. There are numerous monasteries, shrines, water tanks, pillars, and carvings inside the cave. Famous kings from that era, like the Satavahanas and Kshaharatas, constructed the Pandavleni Caves for the Hinayana Buddhist monks.

name: 5. Anjaneri Hills
info: It is a place where Lord Hanuman was born. The name Anjaneri comes from Anjani, who was the mother of Lord Hanuman. It is situated in the beautiful Nashik-Trimbakeshwar mountain range. Anjaneri is a well-liked hiking destination.

name: 6. Dudhsagar Falls
info: This waterfall is regarded as one of the most beautiful falls in sight. Dudhsagar Fall's other name is Someshwar Falls. The falls provide a broad view with breathtaking scenery. During the rainy season, the cascade is in full verve and is a sight to behold.

name: 7. Muktidham Temple
info: Nashik's Muktidham Temple has many Hindu gods. It is constructed from real Rajasthani marble. There are replicas of 12 Jyotirlingams present in this temple. There is a Krishna temple as well. The 18 chapters of the Bhagwat Geeta that have been carved on the temple's walls enhance this temple's beauty and distinguish it.

name: 8. Balaji Devsthan
info: On the Gangapur dam road in Nashik, the Balaji Devsthan is located. It contains a replica of the idol god Tirupati and is a haven for people who cannot travel to the main shrine of Balaji. The Godavari river and the nearby waterfall provide an amazing atmosphere of serenity and spirituality. There are regular religious celebrations held here, but the Lakshadeep Utsav on Kojagari Pournima is particularly notable.

name: 9. Deolali Camp
info: Small hill town Deolali Camp is situated apart from the bustle of the surrounding urban areas. It has been an important military hub since the time of the British. It is actually one of the nation's oldest army cantonments. Due to its medicinal properties, it is a major attraction for visitors.

name: 10. Nashik flower park
info: This flower park is the most popular tourist destination in Nashik nowadays. Previously it was a waterpark that was converted into a flower park. There are more than 5 million flowers in this flower park. The walkway in the flower park is decorated with 10 big hearts. That hearts are made from flowers. The Rides at the waterpark are also decorated with flowers. There are three huge peacocks in the park that is fully covered in flowers. For the selfie, there are 30+ selfie points in different shapes available in the garden. This flower park provides a beautiful view of the mountains, as there are mountains behind the flower park.

name: 1. Nathu La Pass
info: As a sort of mountainous pass in the Himalayan mountains, Nathu la serves as the connection between Sikkim and China. It is among the biggest accessible vehicular highways in the world. With an elevation of 14,450 feet and boundaries with the Indo-Tibetan region, Nathu La is one of the most important crossings from a strategic standpoint. Nathu denotes "listening ears," while La implies "pass." One of the three active trade border crossings between India and China, Nathula is well known for its stunning beauty and lovely surroundings.

name: 2. Tsomgo Lake
info: At the astoundingly high height of 12,400 feet above sea level, Tsomgo Lake lies tucked between the Himalayas on the Gangtok-Nathu La highway. This is on every visitor's list for a legitimate reason - its breathtaking natural beauty. It is also called Changu Lake.

name: 3. Rumtek Monastery
info: One of Sikkim's biggest and most important monasteries, the Rumtek Monastery is set atop a hill 23 kilometers from Gangtok. It relates to the Buddhist Kargyu sect, which got its start in Tibet in the 12th century and was originally known as the Dharma Chakra Center. The three-story monastery is a superb illustration of traditional Tibetan gompa architecture.

name: 4. Khangchendzonga mountain and Khangchendzonga Biosphere Reserve
info: For the greatest vistas of Khangchendzonga, travel to Gangtok. The majestic Kanchenjunga, often spelled Kangchenjunga, is the third-highest peak in the world and among the most beautiful mountains. One of the most significant spots to see in Gangtok, it was originally thought to be the tallest mountain peak in the entire world before Mt. Everest's height was revised. Mount Kanchenjunga, which Nepal, Sikkim, and Tibet surround, was first ascended in 1955 but has since been designated a holy mountain. The Tibetan term Kanchenjunga translates to "The Five Treasures of the High Snow". The treasures stand in for God's five treasuries, which are represented by gold, silver, gems, grain, and sacred texts. There are numerous walking paths in and around Kanchenjunga that will lead visitors through forested landscapes and tranquil lands.

name: 5. Khangchendzonga Biosphere Reserve
info: This spectacular natural habitat in Gangtok, one of the top tourist destinations in the city, features a vast variety of normal, endangered, and practically extinct flora and fauna. This biosphere reserve covers roughly 850 square kilometers.

name: 6. Ganesh Tok
info: A popular site in Gangtok is the little shrine known as Ganesh Tok. The charming location, perched atop a hill, offers mind-blowing vistas, including a genuine representation of the Kanchenjunga Hill, which is best seen here in the morning. In 1952-1953, while Shri Appa B Pant served as Sikkim's political officer, he constructed it.

name: 7. Himalayan Zoological Park
info: The Himalayan Zoological Park is among Gangtok's top tourist destinations and is nearby. The Himalayan Zoological Park exhibits some of nature's most beautiful gifts to visitors from all across the world who travel to Sikkim to partake in wildlife tourism. This park offers a range of attractions, including a stunning array of flora and fauna.

name: 8. Harbhajan Singh Memorial Temple
info: The temple built at Harbhajan Singh's Samadhi is called Baba Mandir, and it is located 64 kilometers away and at an altitude of 4000 meters. It is located on the route that runs between Nathu La and Jelepla Pass.

name: 9. National Institute of Tibetology
info: The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology, one of the few of its kind, is a haven for the long-standing Tibetan-Buddhist culture and its origins. The magnificent assortment in the museum and library, which are the major draws here, reflect the commitment with which NIT preserves the illustrious heritage of the nation, the religion, and its priceless culture. As significant as it is for those who study Asian culture and Buddhism, its tranquil, soothing appeal also makes it a haven for travelers, especially for the sporadic history aficionado. A palace that reflects traditional Tibetan architecture, the Namgyal Institute of Technology provides insights into Buddhist culture.

name: 10. Seven Sisters Waterfalls
info: The Seven Sisters waterfalls, one of Gangtok's most breathtaking and impressive sights, must be seen when one is visiting Gangtok. Seven Sisters Waterfalls, which live up to its name, is made up of seven separate waterfalls that are pleasantly situated next to one another on a broad, craggy cliff that appears distinctive from a distance. These seven streams combine to create a tremendous waterfall that captivates the attention of all onlookers. On the Gangtok-Lachung Highway, this spectacular waterfall is located 32 kilometers from Gangtok.

name: 11. MG Road or MG Marg
info: While visiting the city, one must make sure to visit MG Marg, the most well-known tourist attraction in Gangtok. The core of Gangtok and its most active area is MG Road. With several stores, eateries, and hotels lining both sides, it serves as the state capital's prime shopping district.

name: 1. Cavelossim Beach
info: The Cavelossim Beach lies in South Goa and features spectacular black rocks that contrast with the white sand coastlines of this picturesque beach. For tourists wishing to enjoy the seemingly limitless length of the crystal blue waves, Cavelossim is the ideal location. It is nicer and more peaceful than the clichéd party beaches of Goa. Major activities in this area include swimming, sunbathing, and spotting dolphins.

name: 2. Cola Beach
info: One of the best-kept secrets in South Goa is Cola Beach, also called "Khola" Beach. The golden-sand beach in the Canacona area is dotted with volcanic stones. The beach lies off the usual route, concealed by heavily overgrown hills, and requires a fair amount of rugged terrain to be climbed before reaching this unspoiled beauty. As a result, the beach does not get a lot of visitors. Sunbathers will love Cola Beach because of this.

name: 3. Patnem Beach
info: Patnem Beach, one of Goa's most remote and serene beaches, is located near Canacona, South Goa. It's the ideal location for unwinding by the beach and doing nothing. As an alternative, you can enroll in one of the several yoga retreats and instructor training programs at the local institutions providing the same. Swimming in the seas is relatively safe, and there are unobstructed, breathtaking views of the sunset. Patnem Beach is the ideal substitute for those seeking a less crowded beach than North Goa's well-liked beaches because it provides a relaxing, opulent beach experience without excluding any of Goa's must-see attractions.

name: 4. Kuskem Waterfall
info: One of South Goa's least visited attractions is Kuskem Waterfall, which is tucked away in the charming neighborhood of Canacona. The Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary is only around 20 kilometers distant from this area, which is renowned for its untainted beauty. It is a seasonal waterfall; thus, the monsoon season is the best time to visit. The water body gurgles amidst luxuriant vegetation. Although it is not a huge waterfall, it has impressive quality. Additionally, Kuskem Waterfall in Canacona has grown to become a popular eco-tourism destination during the past few years.

name: 5. Butterfly Beach
info: The Butterfly Beach is located in Goa's Cancona district, a few kilometers south of Palolem. This beach is also referred to as Honeymoon Beach. It is in the shape of a tiny cove that is bordered by tall trees. The butterfly beach, one of Goa's most remote and little-visited beaches, is typically only reachable via boat (ferry) from other surrounding beaches, which only adds to its allure.

name: 6. Tambdi Surla Temple
info: The Mahadev Temple is another name for Tambdi Surla. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Tambdi Surla is a Shaivite temple from the 12th century. The temple, which is made completely of black basalt and is one of the oldest in Goa, has a stunning architectural design. A magnificent Shiva linga and a headless bull idol can be found in the inner sanctuary. A further feature that adds to the area's appeal and natural beauty is that River Surla flanks the temple.

name: 7. Rajbagh Beach
info: The Rajbagh Beach, which takes its name from the well-known Rajbagh Residency close to the shore, has long taken pleasure in being one of Goa's greatest and cleanest beaches. The beach, which is in South Goa, has a captivating 1-kilometer-long shoreline and provides a relaxing beach experience. It is one of South Goa's most beautiful coasts and is situated in the Canacona region.

name: 8. Shri Shantadurga Temple
info: One of the biggest temple complexes in Goa is called Shri Shantadurga Temple. The Gaud Saraswat Brahmins' patron deity, Goddess Durga, is honored in this work of art. Vishnu and Shiva are reconciled via the mediation of the goddess Shantadurga. During the Mahapanchami festival, the goddess is hauled around on a gilded palki (palanquin), which is the focal point of the temple.

name: 9. Palolem Beach
info: Palolem Beach, a white sand paradise in South Goa, is one of the most popular destinations for tourists visiting Goa. It is located around 38 miles from Madgaon in Cancona. Comparatively speaking to other of the more well-known beaches in Goa, Palolem Beach is renowned for its tranquility and tranquillity. The dolphin viewing cruise is Palolem Beach's main attraction.

name: 10. Benaulim Beach
info: The tranquil Benaulim beach is located about 2 kilometers from South Goa's Colva, a popular tourist destination. This picturesque beach is the ideal location for a tranquil getaway far from the crowded beaches of North Goa, with its long stretch of vacant sands scattered with tempting beach chairs. It is well-known for its dolphin-spotting cruises and water sports activities.

name: 1. Gangaikonda Cholapuram
info: You will be enchanted and amazed by the beauty of the Brihadishwara temple and the Gangaikonda Cholapuram due to their engineering and antiquity. Gangaikonda Cholapuram is a location that is a tribute to the region's engineering and architectural brilliance and the pride of one of India's finest empires?the Chola Empire.

name: 2. Brihadeeswarar Temple
info: Brihadeeswarar Temple is regarded as the most elaborate example of South Indian temple architecture. Raja Raja Chola I constructed the Brihadeeswara temple, one of the city's most significant attractions. It was allegedly built as a celebration of the Chola Kingdom's victory and is now a world heritage site. It is also referred to as Periya Kovil or Peruvudaiyar Kovil. The temple is a component of the "Great Living Chola Temples'' UNESCO World Heritage Site. Brihadeeswarar Temple also referred to as The Big Temple, is a temple devoted to Lord Shiva that is renowned for its size and exquisite artwork.

name: 3. Vijayanagar Fort
info: You only have to travel 2 km to reach this amazing palace from the Brihadeeswara temple.  In the year 1550 AD, Nayak kings and certain Maratha kings collaborated to construct this magnificent fort. The castle includes a library, an outstanding art gallery, and the Tanjore Palace, Sangeetha Mahal, etc. Additionally, a part of the fort complex is the Shiva Ganga Gardens. The fort still conveys the strength and grandeur that it must have once held, despite being largely demolished.

name: 4. Airavatesvara Temple
info: Among the many Shiva temples in Thanjavur is the Airavatesvara temple, which is situated near Darasuram. According to tradition, Lord Indra's white elephant, Airavata, came here to pray to Lord Shiva in order to lift a curse placed on him by Rishi Durvasa. Yama, the god of death, is claimed to have worshipped Shiva here as well. This temple, along with everyone else at Thanjavur, is regarded as one of the greatest Chola temples still in existence.

name: 5. Thanjai Mamani Koil
info: A Divyadesam is a collective name for the trio of Vishnu temples that make up Thanjai Mamani Koil. It is claimed that Lord Vishnu is primarily revered in this location in the form of his Narasimha avatar, which he adopted in order to defeat the devil king Hiranyakashipu and save his disciple Prahlad. Within the temple are their statues. The worshippers of Vishnu love and frequent this temple. Being one of the 108 Divyadesams, the temple attracts worshippers in a unique way and has a unique image.

name: 6. Schwartz Church
info: Schwartz Church, also recognized as Fort Church, is situated close to Brihadeeswarar Temple in the Thanjavur Palace garden just north of the Sivaganga Tank and was constructed by Raja Serfoji in 1779 as a tribute to his teacher, the Danish missionary FC Schwartz, who passed away in 1798. It is spread over an area of 2 km from Thanjavur Railway Station, 750 km from Old Bus Station, and 500 meters from Brihadeeswarar Temple.

name: 7. Thanjavur Royal Palace
info: Considered to be the Nayak Kings' home, it was located inside the Vijaynagara Fort complex. There are numerous locations worth seeing on the palace grounds, including the Nayak Hall, Saraswati Mahal Library, and the Durbar hall. It was the official palace of the Maratha monarchs from 1674 to 1855 and is also referred to as Maratha Palace or Nayak Palace. Around 1550 CE, Thanjavur Nayaks built a portion of it; the Marathas extended it. Huge halls, wide hallways, observation and arsenal towers, as well as a cool courtyard are among the palace's most notable features. As part of their tour of Thanjavur, history buffs must visit this palace to learn about the culture and way of life of the local kings.

name: 8. Thanjavur Waterfalls
info: The most well-known waterfalls in Thanjavur are Agaya Gangai, Kutladampatti Waterfalls, and Kiliyur Falls. The 300-foot-high Agaya Gangai is located on the river Aiyaru and is located 141 kilometers away from Thanjavur. The Tamil Nadu Forest Department oversees the preserve forest where the Kurladampatti waterfall is located. The 89-foot waterfall is very well-liked by travelers.

name: 9. Thanjavur Saraswathi Mahal library
info: The Saraswati Mahal Library is situated inside Thanjavur Palace next to the Royal Museum, 2 km from Thanjavur Junction Railway Station and 0.5 km from Old Bus Station. One of India's most significant collections of oriental manuscripts is housed at this library.

name: 10. Thirumananjeri Temple
info: The Thirumananjeri temple is well-known among many Tamilians for granting wishes made there and for blessing marriages. The exquisite sculptures of gods and goddesses on the temple's walls serve as another illustration of its magnificent design and architecture. One needs to return to the temple with their spouse to seek blessings when a commitment made here is accomplished. For travelers with a religious bent, this temple is a must-see!

name: 11. Chandra Bhagwan Temple
info: This temple, which is dedicated to the sacred moon god, is also significant to its followers. This temple, which is 25 miles away, is well-known among those who think that the Moon is unfavorable to them based on their star signs.

name: 12. Swami Malai Temple
info: This temple, which is located in Thanjavur, is crucial to the Hindu community in southern India. This temple is one of the Arupadaiveedu, which are the six principal abodes of Murugan. Each residence symbolizes one of his six life stages. The shrine is located where Lord Murugan is thought to have taught his master intellectual truths about the cosmos. This temple was built as a memorial.

info: Splunk

name: 1. Bannari Amman Temple
info: The Bannari Amman temple is devoted to Maa Durga and is encircled by forest areas against a mountainous landscape. Including some of the few Amman temples in south India, it is rare. A few pillars that resemble a rectangular cross-section add to the shrine's distinctiveness even though it is built in the conventional Dravidian architectural masterpiece. Travelers and tourists should include the Bannari Amman Temple on their list when visiting Erode. The primary festival observed on the grounds of the temple is known as Kundam, which is also one of the state's festive occasions. The festival is held throughout the months of March and April, which is the Tamil month of Pangini.

name: 2. Chennimalai Murugan Temple
info: Chennimalai also referred to as the "Handloom Town," is located in Tamil Nadu's Erode town. It is situated along the primary bus line that connects Palani and Erode. The city is renowned for its temples, dargahs, old forts, and numerous nature preserves. One of the major tourist attractions in Chennimalai is the Murugan Temple. Father Murugan, who is compared to Sevvai Graham or planet Mars, is this temple's principal god. The other eight planets orbit the deity in complete sync. In Chennimalai, milk and curd are utilized as special offerings to Lord Muruga, and it is widely believed that yogurt does not decay there. The Kodaikanal, Sathyamangalam, and Anthiyur mountains can all be seen easily from the summit of the mountain. It offers viewers a lovely vista and tranquility.

name: 3. Bhavani Sangameshwarar Temple
info: It is believed that Mahendra Verman, who is also known as the first Pallava ruler, constructed the historic Sri Sangameshwarar temple. This temple appears to be a peninsula encircled by two rivers when viewed from above. A swinging or cradle crafted with the help of ivory was reportedly gifted by a British official known as William Garo after he survived unharmed the destruction of his rest house in the year 1802. He believed that the Deity herself had saved him, and as a result, he converted to devout worship. His autograph is visible on the cradle's framework. Dakshin Prayag is another name for this shrine because it is where the rivers Kaveri and Bhavani converge.

name: 4. Government Museum, Erode
info: The Government Museum, one of Erode's top famous sights, is a cultural and a historical enthusiast's dream come true. It was established in 1987 and is a significant depository for many items with ties to history, literature, and the arts. Artwork from Tanjore, Kongu Chola empire monuments, Bargur handicrafts, as well as other items, is among the exhibits.

name: 5. Birds Sanctuary, Vellode
info: The Vellode Birds Sanctuary is situated in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu's city of Erode. The bird sanctuary is around 10 kilometers from Erode Central Railway Station in the southeast and 15 kilometers from Erode Central Bus Terminus on the route to Chennimalai, close to Vellode. The reserve is included in Tamil Nadu's list of heritage areas.

name: 6. Bhavanisagar Dam
info: The Bhavanisagar Dam, built on the Bhavani River, is among the nation's relatively rare large dams. It suffices to say that the dam is one of Erode's top tourist destinations. The dam, which was constructed on the Bhavani River, is situated between Mettupalayam and Sathayamangalam. The water spilling out is a breathtaking sight, stretching for eight kilometers and reaching a height of 32 meters. One of the biggest earthen dams on the entire globe. The dam is located approximately 16 kilometers west of Sathyamangalam, 35 kilometers away from Gobichettipalayam, and 36 kilometers north of Mettupalayam.

name: 7. Thindal Murugan Temple
info: The Hindu religious Temple of Thindal Murugan is one of the most visited destinations in Erode. Folklore is that after Lord Murugan enlightened the land, a protracted dryness stopped. One has to ascend 150 stairs to get to the temple, which is 50 meters above the ground and perched atop a hillside. In the past, the State of Mysore's primary location of devotion was this 750-year-old temple. Regional buses that travel from Perundurai to the central bus terminal stop near the temple.

name: 8. Arudra Kabaliswarar Temple
info: The Arudra Kabaliswarar Temple dates back more than 500 years. It is situated in the lucky town of Erode in the state of Tamil Nadu. The Arulmigu Arudra Kabaliswarar Temple is said to have been built by a Chozha king in the Kongu Chola kingdom (1004-1280). The old temple is also known as Thondeeswaram, as per the inscription on the wall of the sanctum sanctorum. Additionally, God Shiv, who is the main divinity of this temple, is known by many names, notably Thondeeswarar, Thondeeswaram Udaya Thambiranar, Thondeeswaram Udaya Mahadeva, Nayanar, Thondeeswaram Udaya Pidarar, Thondargal Nayanar, and so forth.

name: 9. Periya Mariamman Temple
info: Sri Peria Mariamman Temple, a well-known religious location, is one of the most well-liked places of worship in Erode. The temple was constructed 1200 decades prior by the Kongu Cholas and is devoted to Mariamman (a variation of Durga), the Hindu Goddess of rain. Individuals with illnesses like chickenpox and measles are said to be treated by the Deity.

name: 10. CSI Brough Memorial Church, Erode
info: The 1933-built CSI Brough Memorial Church is situated in the center of Erode. Rev. Antony Watson Brough, who came to Erode from the London Missionary Society, oversaw the construction of the church. Rt. Rev. Azariah finished it in 1933 and gave it the name Brough Memorial Church. It was built using the Indo-Saracenic style. Years later, the church is still regarded as one of Erode's most respected houses of worship. Many believers and tourists gather there all year long. The main building components were crushed lime mortar and eggs. You can not complete your journey to Erode without giving some time to visit this beautiful church.

name: 1. Aizawl:
info: Northeastern India's Mizoram region's picturesque capital city of Aizawl is 1132 meters above sea level. The Mizo Tribe makes up most of the population in Aizawl and the area's stunning hills and forests. Like most states, the city is renowned for its agricultural goods, ethnic handicrafts, and textiles. From Aizawl, key hubs of northeast India, such as Silchar and Guwahati in Assam, are easily reachable by air and land. It's essential to remember that an Inner Line Pass, or ILP, is required for admission into Mizoram and is available from Guwahati, Silchar, Shillong, New Delhi, and Kolkata.

name: 2. Serchhip:
info: Serchhip in Mizoram is a location that may provide you with a distinctive and colourful experience. It is most renowned for having the highest rate of literacy in India. One may experience a little village in this town, complete with all its daily life, activities, and colours.

name: 3. Lunglei:
info: Lunglei, which means "The bridge of rock" in the literal sense, is well-known for its breathtaking scenery and natural surroundings. It is a little town around 170 kilometres south of Aizawl whose name comes from a bridge-shaped rock that can be found near Nghasih, a river Tlawng tributary. For individuals who enjoy both natural sightseeing and adventure activities together, Lunglei is the perfect unconventional vacation spot. Travellers to Lunglei frequently choose to go hiking, bird viewing, or camping.

name: 4. Champhai:
info: The administrative centre of the Champhai district is located in the town of Champhai, which is close to the Indo-Myanmar border on Mizoram's eastern border. It is strategically and commercially significant for both India and the state of Mizoram, which is located 188 kilometres away from the capital city of Aizawl. Champhai and its environs are famous for their stunning natural scenery and extensive valleys of rice fields. Due to having a significant area for rice growing, it is referred to as the "Rice Bowl of Mizoram." Additionally, it has a certain romanticism and attractive appearance thanks to its colourful seasonal flowers.

name: 5. Mamit:
info: The fourth-largest district in the state of Mizoram is Mamit. Mamit, the district's administrative centre, is located approximately 95 kilometres west of Aizawl. Don't forget to include this location in your journey while visiting Mizoram; it is famous for its magnificent scenery. A well-liked tourist destination in this area is the Dampa Tiger Reserve, one of India's well-known natural protected areas.

name: 6. Saiha:
info: Saiha's population has increased dramatically over the past ten years, making it the Mizoram town with the quickest growth. The Saiha district of Mizoram has the census town of Saiha, which is 729 meters above sea level on average. This community is regarded as a sanctuary for anglers.

name: 7. Kolasib:
info: The smallest and one of Mizoram's eleven newest districts, Kolasib has a border with the Cachar district of Assam. Kolasib is located in northern Mizoram, and it is located 79 kilometres north of Aizawl. Kolasib, like most other Mizoram districts, is rich in culture and scenic beauty.

name: 8. Reiek:
info: One of the highest hills in Mizoram is Reiek Tlang, also known as Reiek, which rises to a height of 1465 meters. Reiek Tlang is a beautiful viewpoint that offers panoramic views of Aizawl and the surrounding valley against a backdrop of Mizo Hills' beauty. It is located 29 kilometres from the city of Aizawl.

name: 9. Vantawng Falls:
info: The Vantawng Waterfalls, the tallest waterfall in the state and the thirteenth tallest in the nation, is one of the North East's most fascinating waterfalls. The Vantawng Falls are Mizoram's pride and a top tourist destination. The waterfall is stunning, and it's located 137 kilometres from Aizawl, the nation's capital.

name: 10. Hmuifang:
info: Hmuifang, also known as Hmuifang Tlang, is one of Mizoram's most stunning locations and an incredible hill station with a lot to offer the discerning traveller. Hmuifang is a mountainous town in the centre of the Mizoram state, approximately 50 kilometres from Aizawl, the state's capital. The hill resort attracts a lot of fans to its hills because of its reputation for adventure and wildlife-related activities.

name: 11. Dampa Tiger Reserve:
info: A magnificent wildlife sanctuary called Dampa Tiger Reserve is situated in Mizoram, India's deep, dark jungles. The forests, around 125 kilometres from Aizawl and home to a massive variety of flora and animals, attract visitors and nature enthusiasts from all over the world to the north-eastern state of India.

name: 12. Tamdil (Tam Lake):
info: Tamdil Lake, the largest lake in the state of Mizoram, was deliberately made to serve as a natural tourist destination for the area. Tamdil Lake, also known as the "Lake of Mustard" in Mizo, is a stunning lake with breathtaking scenery, pure blue water, and a peaceful atmosphere. The lake lies hidden in the Mizoram hills, around 100 kilometres east of Aizawl, between hills and evergreen trees.

name: 13. Falkawn Village:
info: Falkawn village, a model village illustrating the way of life of the Mizo people, offers first-time tourists to Mizoram an exceptional cultural experience. The Mizo people, who make up the state's largest tribe, are represented by their way of life and culture in Falkawn Village. Falkawn village, 22 kilometres from Aizawl, the nation's capital, is an innovative idea and an attempt to give visitors a glimpse into one of our region's most influential tribal cultures.

name: 14. Phawngpui Peak:
info: Phawngpui Peak, the state's highest point, is highly respected by the local tribes. The stunning blue mountain, around 300 kilometres south of Aizawl, is a beautiful destination to visit and inspire your spirit of adventure. The hill, part of Phawngpui National Park, looks out over spectacular terrain with many deep cracks and towering cliffs. No adventure lover can let go of the experience of hiking to Phawngpui's top of the mountain.

name: 15. Phawngpui:
info: A charming and tranquil village called Phawngpui can be found in the Mizoram state. This location, 2157 meters above sea level, offers beautiful views. The place around this site is gorgeous due to its dense forests and tall mountains. The area is abundant in flora, fauna, and lush, dense forests. Make sure Visitors climb Blue Mountain and enjoy the hike with stunning panoramic beauty if Visitors want to add a little adventure to your vacation. Visitors will love the entire area as you climb the mountain and experience the feeling of being in heaven.

name: 16. Phawngpui National Park:
info: The Phawngpui Blue Mountain National Park, also known as Phawngpui National Park, is a stunning conservatory in Mizoram covered with tropical forests and home to many unusual animals and birds. The park's natural beauty and attraction are further enhanced by its views of rivers and mountain ranges. Additionally, it is home to various bird and animal species, including the black eagle and the Asiatic black bear.

name: 1. Mavuthu
info: The distance between Mavuthu and Theni is 35 kilometers. It is located 20 kilometers away from Anipatti. The Velappar Temple, which was established at this location and is located on the Varushanad Hills, is well-known. Vinayaka is worshipped at this temple. Another temple in the area is devoted to Saptakansika, built by Kandamanjur. In the place where this temple is situated, there is a waterfall. It is thought that bathing here may treat different skin conditions. Maavuthu is a Tamil term that means "Spring of Mango Grove." The mango trees in this area receive a lot of water due to the frequent heavy rains. This area has a lovely scenic view full of natural vegetation around.

name: 2. Kuchanur
info: The Shani temple at Kuchanur is a renowned temple. It is said that Lord Shani dwells in this area. Thus, the city was given the name Kuchanur, which is also the name of Lord Shani. According to legends, Lord Shani is thought to reside at this ancient temple. Along with this temple, there is also a temple for Lord Hanuman, and this one also houses the Panchmukhi Ganesh statue. This temple is located on a river bank. Kuchanur is located 20 kilometers from Theni. From all around the nation, almost a thousand people visit this location. Devotees gather here to worship Lord Shani every year.

name: 3. Tirtha Thotti
info: Teertha Thotti is 19 kilometers away from Theni. It is located 2 kilometers away from Periyakulam. It is located between the route of Madurai and Kochi. The location is a famous pilgrimage site as there is a temple dedicated to Lord Subramaniam, and it was established here nearly a thousand years ago. Teertha Thotti means scared water tub. There are Neem trees all around this natural water tank. This tank serves as a natural spring.

name: 4. Suruli Waterfall
info: The Suruli Waterfalls date back to the 18th century. It is almost 56 kilometers from the city of Theni. It is a beautiful two-stage cascading waterfall. The waterfall drop from the height of 150 feet to the pool and flows further to a short distance, and plummets again. Meghamalai is the source of origin of the Suruli waterfall. This location served as the inspiration for the Silappathikaran poem by Tamil poet Lango Adigal. Near this waterfall, some shrubs are therapeutic. The Suruli Velappar Temple is situated near the waterfall. The Tamil Nadu Tourism Department organizes a unique celebration here each summer. Visitors flock here during the monsoon season from all around the nation.

name: 5. Sothuparai Dam
info: On the Varaganadhi River's Kodaikanal Hill, the Sothupparai Dam is constructed. It is situated 12 kilometers from Periyakulam. It's a great location for a picnic with family and friends. On both sides of the highway, there is a mango tree that is standing there in a line beautifully. The general public can see the dam from a floor bridge that has been built near the dam, and there is also a lovely garden here. This provides drinking water to Periyakulam residents and also receives water for farming activities. It is Tamil Nadu's second highest dam.

name: 6. Kailasanathar Temple Cave
info: The Suruli waterfall is close to the cave where the Kailasanathar temple stands. This temple cave is located eight hundred meters above sea level. According to the Silappapathikaram of Tamil literature, there was a time when different festivals were celebrated at this temple. A natural spring near the temple is also thought to have therapeutic qualities. A dargah bearing the name of the Muslim saint Abubakar Mastan from the 17th century is located next to the temple cave.

name: 7. Kumbakkarai Waterfall
info: On the Kodaikanal Hills in the Western Ghats, there is a waterfall called Kumbakkarai Falls. It is located 9 kilometers away from Periyakulam and 24 kilometers away from Theni. Is. This waterfall originates from Kodaikanal Hills. There is a variety of birds that migrate here. This waterfall consists of two stages. The water falls from the height of 400 meters and collects in rock recesses that is quite big in size and are named after wild animals. The Lord Murugan idol is located next to this waterfall. You may visit this waterfall at any time of the year. Though during the monsoon, this waterfall appears to be quite lovely and will make you happy

name: 8. Devadanapatti Kamakshi Amman Temple
info: Temple of Devadanapatti Kamakshi Amman is situated 27 kilometers from Theni. This temple is located in a little village near the Manjal river. A large puja is held here during Mahashivratri, and visitors come from around the area. The major gates of this temple are always locked.

name: 9. Meghamalai Hill
info: Meghamalai Hill is about 70 kilometers from Theni. It is located in the Western Ghats, and it is 500 feet above sea level. It is also known as the High Way Mountain. This place is rich in wildlife and different plants, and you can enjoy the greenery all around this location. Here, you will find more than 100 different bird species. It is quite a remarkable place for bird lovers. The Tamil Nadu government has set up a bird sanctuary because of the variety of species that reside and migrate here. On the Meghamalai hill, a wide range of wildlife creatures such as Leopard Tiger, Wild Wore, Nilgiri Tahr, Porcupine, Flying Squirrel, Spotted Deer, and other animals can be seen here. There is also a beautiful tea garden that is located in this area that people can enjoy while their visit to this hilly area.

name: 10. Vaigai Dam
info: On the Mullai River near the village of Andipatti, the Vaigai Dam has been constructed. This dam is about twenty-five kilometers from Theni. If you are traveling with your family, you can enjoy a picnic in this area. This dam was inaugurated on 21 January 1959. There is a children's Park near the dam, known as Chhota Vrindavan. This dam is 71 feet wide and 111 feet long. This dam provides drinking water to the whole city.

name: 11. Shanmuganathi Dam
info: On the Meghamali Hills, there is a beautiful location called Shanmuganathi Dam. In the Theni, this dam is built across the Shanmugaha River. Appipatti, Vellaimmapuram, Pushkaraikoudan Patti, Udaipatti, Seppalakottai, and Sukkanagal Patti are a few of the locations near the damn in Theni. Shanmugaha Temple is the temple dedicated to Lord Murugan is worshipped.

name: 12. Balasubramaniam Temple
info: A well-known temple Balasubramaniam Temple is situated near Periyakulam in the Theni district, Tamil Nadu. Rajendra Chola of the Chola dynasty constructed this temple. This temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan. It is believed that the idol worshipped in this temple was found beneath the ground. In Tamil Nadu, Balasubramaniam Temple receives the most visitors.

name: 13. Chinna Suruli Waterfall
info: The Meghamali Hills are the source of the Chinna Suruli Falls, often called Cloudland Falls. It is located fifty-four kilometers from Theni. It is located close to Kombathozhu village. You can enjoy a lovely vista of the waterfall and the expanse of silvery, shining clouds. You can enjoy the stunning view of Theni from this waterfall, which makes it a must-visit place for those who love photography.

name: 14. Gowmariamman Temple
info: The ruler of the Pandya dynasty, Veerapandia Kattabomman, constructed the Gowmariamman temple in the fourteenth century. Local legend has it that King Veerapandya saw Kanneshwaramudiyar and Goddess Gowmariamman in a dream before ordering the construction of this temple. Gaumari is the temple's main god. According to the belief, all the desires of the devotees are said to be granted by this goddess. In April and May, this temple has its biggest celebration. The distance of this temple from Theni is 8 kilometers. This temple is built on the Mullai River's banks.

name: 15. Bodi Mettu
info: Theni is home to Bodi Mettu, the most picturesque hill station in Tamil Nadu. This hill station is located at an elevation of 4500 feet above sea level in the Western Ghats. It is a wonderful tourist location. Numerous visitors come here to enjoy their holiday each year. Bodi Mettu has a wide variety of plants and animals. It is also a wonderful love for bird lovers as they can spot several bird species here. The distance between Theni and Bodi Mettu is 43 kilometers.

name: How to Reach Theni

There are two sanctums in the "L"-shaped temple, and a Mukha Mantapa connects them.

info: The waterfall is 175 meters high. The Machhkund river creates the waterfall. Mountains and green valleys around the region. The location is often referred to as "Matsya Tirtha."

info: The tallest mountain peak is Deomali, which rises to 1672 meters above sea level. In addition to being a popular tourist destination, the area is also used by campers and sports enthusiasts for activities including trekking, mountaineering, and hang gliding. info: The waterfall is fantastic, and thick trees encircle the area. It is a lovely site with two waterfalls on the river Nagavali. The two enormous rocks on the hilltop are like massive elephants. name: 6. Jagannath Sagar
info: In the middle of the town of Jeypore is Jagannath Sagar's lake. There is also a park and play area around the lake and a boating club. In 1716, 10,000 labourers were engaged by the then-King Ramchandra Dev-II to construct a pond on 300 acres. The British East India Company declared the pond a tourist spot three years later.

name: 7. Kolab Botanical Garden
info: On the banks of the Kolab dam, the Kolab Botanical Garden is a well-liked destination for weekend picnics. There are over 200 different flowering plant kinds in the well-kept garden. The Kolab Reservoir looks beautiful at night. Here, boating is possible, and everyone enjoys going there to go out with their family.

name: 8. Maligura Tunnel
info: Maligura is a native word that translates to "Village of Malis." The Malis are a native group with a distinct culture and way of life from the other tribes in Orissa. The tallest wide gauge railway tunnel in India, a highly famous tourist destination, has been constructed close to this tribal village.

name: 9. Minna Jhola
info: One of Jeypore's most famous holy sites is the Minna Jhola. The Minna Jhola is situated where three rivers confluence, and it is a well-liked location for relaxation and refreshment. Thousands of followers come to this Shiva shrine during Shiv Ratri.

name: 10. Nandapur
info: Many visitors visit the historical centre to see the Batrisa Sinhasan, a renowned attraction. The Statue of Ganapati drew attention to the area's rich history, and the monuments and shrines at Sarbeswar are evidence of the area's ancient history.

name: 11. Papadahandi
info: There is a temple in the Papadahandi for Lord Shiva, the most revered deity in these places. In addition to being an important centre for pilgrimage, Papadahandi is a picturesque location. The temple is located deep in a tranquil setting, and champak trees line its area.

name: 12. Patroput
info: Tourists are drawn to the village of Patroput by its historic bridge and the surroundings. This bridge can carry a 10-ton roller, and the British constructed it while they were in charge of India.

name: 13. Raisal
info: Located 60 kilometres from Koraput and 3 kilometres from Laxmipur, this small town has a perennial stream running through it and is popular with weekend visitors. name: 14. Sabar Srikhetra
info: Koraput is around 2900 feet above sea level in the middle of lush hills. It is a beneficial health destination due to the town's magnificent outlook and healthy environment, and the breathtaking beauty transports visitors to another world.

There is a 30-foot-tall Jain temple with five images of the five Tirthankaras, such as Resavanath, Mahavir Jain, Ambika Devi, Jakhya, and Jakhyani. The pictures were carefully carved to high artistic achievement, proving that the Kechela was a centre of Jainism throughout the Middle Ages.

name: 16. Gulmi
info: At Gulmi, the Kolab River creates a whirlpool that draws big crowds from the surrounding District and the state of Chhattisgarh. It is 25 kilometres from Chandeli and 100 kilometres from Koraput.

info: The distance from Koraput to it is 18 kilometres. It is a modern township well-known for its MIG fighter aircraft, Sukhoi plant, and museum that showcases impressive aircraft engines.

info: The region of Daman Jodi is hilly and serenely beautiful. The largest aluminium plant in Asia, NALCO, is situated nearby, and this location is the most excellent option for those who enjoy trekking.

name: 19. Kolab dam

name: 1. Veli Tourist Village
info: The Veli Tourist Village is an amazing picnic spot close to the lake in ethereal surroundings, making it one of the best places to visit in Trivandrum. A small number of playthings and an area designated specifically for children are provided, and there is also the opportunity to go for a boat ride on the lake.

name: 2. Karikkakom Devi Temple
info: It's hard to believe this old temple, which dates back more than 600 years, is still standing. The landscape that surrounds this temple is peaceful, quiet, and meditative. The temple is exceptionally tidy, and its maintenance is of the highest possible standard. It is believed that the goddess Karikkakom is a reincarnation of the goddess Chamunda Devi, so the temple is dedicated to her. The entire temple and its surroundings are quite enchanting, and it is located in a very convenient location close to a bypass for a national highway. Within the temple grounds is a sizable area designated for parking vehicles.

name: 3. Vellayani Lake
info: The Vellayani lake is the largest in the city of Trivandrum and is widely considered one of the city's top tourist destinations. The lake provides some enticing perspectives of the village and the backwaters, making it an excellent location for socializing. Enthusiasts of fishing will be pleased to learn that this lake provides excellent fishing opportunities.

name: 4. Kanakakunnu Palace
info: One of the most amazing and beautiful places in Trivandrum, this destination is renowned for its traditional Kerala architecture. It serves as one of the city's most popular tourist spots. This stunning palace is exceptionally well-kept, spotless, and close to the Napier Museum and zoo. The nature around the palace is very amazing, with lots of lush vegetation all around.

name: 5. Attukal Temple
info: This mesmerizing temple is devoted to the goddess Bhadrakali, one of the many forms of the goddess Mahakali. It is considered one of the most popular tourist destinations in the Trivandrum area. The temple's architectural style is awe-inspiring, and the tranquil atmosphere makes it one of Trivandrum's most popular tourist attractions. The Attukal temple holds several Guinness World Records, one of which is the record for the most people assembled for any festival. The Pongal festival is celebrated on the temple grounds with energy and enthusiasm.

name: 6. Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple
info: This wonderful temple has a dazzling architectural design and an atmosphere that amazes you. It is also one of the top sites to visit in Trivandrum. This magnificent temple also has the distinction of being the wealthiest temple in the whole world. Shri Padmanabhswamy, the lord of Trivandrum, is the deity of this temple.

name: 7. Napier Museum
info: It is a magnificent museum constructed in the middle of the 19th century by a British commander called Napier. It is considered to be one of the most popular hangout spots in the city of Trivandrum. A significant hub for the city's artistic and cultural life may be found at the museum. It is the greatest site to learn about the immensely rich cultural and historical history of the state of Kerala, and this fascinating museum is the perfect venue to visit.

name: 8. Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium
info: This Aquarium can be found near the seaside town of Kovalam in the Indian state of Kerala and has become a popular tourist destination. The Aquarium, which covers an area of two acres, is home to a wide diversity of marine creatures that may often be difficult or impossible to find in other parts of India. The Ministry of the Environment and Forests has designated it as one of seven national aquaria in the country.

name: 9. Shri Chitra Art Gallery
info: Over three decades, the Shri Chitra Art Gallery has promoted art appreciation and growth in India. It does this by presenting the work of prominent Indian artists and by offering facilities that are on par with the most cutting-edge technology. Every traveller who comes to Trivandrum needs to make time to check out this attraction.

name: 10. Shangumugham Beach
info: An amazing beach called Shangumugham Beach may be found just in the neighbourhood of the city airport. This beach, which has crystal-clear seas and snow-white sand, is a stunning location to unwind and enjoy the ethereal atmosphere of its surroundings. As a result of the beach's impeccable cleanliness and the fact that it has not been altered in any way, it is widely considered to be one of the city's most picturesque locations. In addition, there is a little shrine dedicated to Devi located on the shore.

name: 11. Agasthyakoodam
info: At an elevation of 1890 meters above mean sea level, Agasthyakoodam is the second highest peak in the Indian state of Kerala. It is also a part of the Sahyadri range of mountains. The woods of Agasthyakoodam are home to an abundance of exotic animals and a wide variety of medicinal herbs, plants, and brightly coloured orchids.

name: 12. Padmanabhapuram Palace
info: The magnificent palace can be seen at Thuckalay, which can be found on the road to Kanyakumari, which was once the seat of the former kings of Travancore. This magnificent example of the traditional building of the Kerala School of Architecture is a timber palace that has been carefully maintained. The magnificent paintings, delicate flower carvings, and the black glossy granite floor have all been able to withstand time.

name: 13. Akkulam Lake
info: The peaceful Akkulam Lake can be found in the Aakkulam region of Trivandrum, and it is the ideal destination for anybody who enjoys spending time outdoors. This lake, encircled by lush vegetation, is perfect for anyone looking for a peaceful spot to visit where they can unwind among the splendour of nature.

name: 14. Neyyar Dam
info: This dam is an abode of paradise in Kerala. It is an amazing tourist destination to spend a quiet day in the sun surrounded by nature's finest delights. It is also one of the favourite tourist attractions in Trivandrum. Take in positive energy and allow it to revitalize all of your senses as you are surrounded by stunning natural scenery.

name: 15. Aazhimala Siva Temple
info: This temple was built in honour of Lord Shiva and had a vibrant range of architectural styles. The temple is well-known for having an architectural design that is both complex and breathtaking. The areas just next to the temple are quite scenic. In direct proximity to the temple is a stretch of coastline dominated by several rocky cliffs. The temple is home to a statue of Lord Shiva that is both stunning and impressive in its size.

name: 16. Varkala
info: In the district of Thiruvananthapuram, one may find a wide variety of beach resorts and spas. In addition, it is a significant location for religious tourism among Hindus. The famous social reformer Sree Narayana Guru is said to have been laid to rest on a hill known as Sivagiri, located close to the city of Varkala. According to one version of mythology, the wise man Narada was once confronted by a band of wandering mendicants who all admitted to having sinned.

name: 17. Priyadarshini Space Planetarium
info: The Priyadarshini Space Planetarium, which opened its doors to the public in 1994, is now considered one of India's most accessible and multipurpose planetariums. It is outfitted with cutting-edge technology that makes it possible to see all the components that make up the universe.

name: 18. Vizhinjam RockCut Cave
info: The Vinadhara Dakshinamurti god resides inside the Vizhinjam Rock Cut Cave, which has a rock-cut sculpture dating back to the 8th century and has a single chamber.

name: 19. Vizhinjam Lighthouse
info: The Vizhinjam LightHouse can be found on the peak of Kurumsal Hill, which is just ten kilometres distant from the city of Thiruvananthapuram.

info: You will undoubtedly adore Malpe beach if you are a beach lover. It is recognised as one of Karnataka's top beaches and is yet completely undiscovered. So, this is an excellent beach to visit if you're looking for unusual spots to visit in Udupi.

name: 5. Sri Krishna Temple
info: The 13th-century Sri Krishna Shrine, also known as Sri Krishna Matha, is a Vaishnavite temple founded by Saint Jagadguru Sri Madhvacharya. The Navagraha kindi, a distinguishing aspect of this temple, is a silver-plated window with nine openings through which the God is worshipped. The Ashta Mathas offer daily prayers to God, and worshippers from all over the nation come to this temple to show their respect. This temple, which is well-known across the world for its customs, ceremonies, and Dvaita philosophy teachings, draws tourists who are interested in learning more about this way of life.

name: 6. Daria Bahadurgarh Fort
info: On one of the four rocky islands of Malpe Beach, Basavappa Naik of Bidanur built the Daria Bahadurgad fort. This amazing Island, which is only two kilometres from Malpe, is also home to factories that produce Mangalorean tiles close to the fort, making a day trip there to learn how these tiles are made an educational excursion.

name: 7. Barkur Village - Discover this Cute Village
info: In Barkur village, the Barkur temples are remarkable and have unique qualities that distinguish them from other temples. Although they are constructed with sloping terracotta roofs similar to Keralan temples, they are distinct since they lack gopurams.

name: 8. Coin Museum Corp Bank - Collectors of Coins
info: Corporation Bank is another name for Coin Museum Corp Bank. The Heritage Museum includes a sizable collection of coins dating back to 400 BC from different Indian rulers. Additionally, visitors can have a thorough overview of the background history of banking in India since 1906.

name: 9. Chaturmukha Basadi
info: In the town of Karkala, there is a historic symmetrical Jain temple called the Chaturmukha Basadi. Due to its four symmetrical faces, this historical temple is known as "chaturmukh" and was built by Immadi Bhairarasa Vodeya in the 16th century on a small rocky hill from the Santara dynasty.

name: 10. Kodi Beach - Best for Beach Games
info: The Kodi Beach, sometimes called the Delta Beach, is adjacent to Kundapur Town. Kodi, which in Kannada means "shore", is particularly well-known since it is one of the best spots to visit in Udupi because it is surrounded by water on three sides.

name: 11. Manipal lake - A Calm Side of the Town
info: Manipal Lake is one of the best tourist attractions in Udupi despite being a little lake that locals appreciate. In addition, it's a fantastic area to meander around and eat some delectable street cuisine.

name: 12. City Centre - A one-stop shop for you
info: A renowned shopping and lifestyle attraction in Udupi is its City Centre. This commercial centre, which has a number of shops, restaurants, and service locations, is situated on Mosque Road in the middle of the city. Originally constructed to accommodate the traffic between Udupi and Manipal, this is today a well-liked tourist destination and one of the top attractions to see in Udupi.

name: 13. Mangroove Plantation
info: Visit the mangrove plantations to see Udupi's lovely and environmentally conscious coastal districts if you're looking for natural hotspots. Around the gangolli, Kodi, and Swarna riverine areas, there is an extensive amount of mangrove plantations. Visit the Parampalli, which has acres of mangrove forest and is close to the Kodihole river. As a lover of nature and wildlife, you'll appreciate it and surely consider it to be among the best Udupi tourist attractions.

name: 14. Koup Beach - Unknown Udupi Gem
info: One of the nicest locations to visit in Udupi is Kapu, or Kaup Beach, a town in the district of Udupi that is situated halfway between Mangalore and the town of Udupi. This is because of the crystal-clear water that breaks against the sand beachfront that is lined with palm trees. A historic lighthouse built in 1901 and located on this beach is open to visitors from sunrise until 6:30 am.

name: 15. Anantheshwara Temple
info: One of the oldest temples in the Tulu Nadu region, the Anantheshwara Temple, is situated next to the well-known Shri Krishna Matha Temple. This ancient Hindu temple, built during the Alupas' rule in the eighth century, is devoted to Lord Shiva.

name: 1. Elk Falls

info: Visitors may experience the nature of Kotagiri in all of its beauty at Longwood Shola. Animals like flying foxes (a giant bat that eats fruit) and Indian bison make this lush, thickly forested area home.
